story:
Now these boy will take you through the hills of ol’ Kentucky, bearing the stores, traditions and liquor that date back a century. This old-time band delivers with an intensity that would knock the sock’s right off of their forefathers feet.

Hailing from the back woods of Pewee Valley, Kentucky. Whiskey Bent Valley pay’s homage to their southern kin.Songs from the tobacco fields to the rivers, iron skillets to moonshine stills, upbeat and professional, this band posesses the skill to honor history and preserve the instruments, their style and every authentic nuance of the day. With their sense of fashion, From overalls to string ties, straw hats to silk vests, along with a turbo charged performance, their approach breathes fire into this vintage genre.

Incorporating time honored treasures from such icons as Roscoe Holcomb, The Stanley Brothers, and fiddle legend Tommy Jarrell, or a roster of original compositions including crowd-pleasers “Graveyard Blues” or “Shady River” the band puts on a timeless, energiezed show, Playing everything from ballads, breakdowns, sea shanties, and swamp stomps. Audiences from children on their parent’s knee to packed saloons past midnight ,and finding favor with the older generation as well makes for a wide range of appeal.

The boys take cues from parents and grandparents who have tapped into folk country and bluegrass through festivals, radio and endless collections of vinyl recrodings. Band founder Col. Mason Dixon hails from a long line of musicians and will tell you it’s not so much in the whiskey as it is the DNA. Each member’s family performs and enjoys the indigenous music of the appalachian foothills and pastures of Kentucky. 

Appearances on a wide range of radio and tv programs, state fairs ,square dance’s and festivals have brought them an active fan base for this region. Often times the boy’s bring a delicious yield of their summer crops to gigs in bushel baskets for the taking. Going even more down to earth, they are making their cd packaging “green.” All of their records are made from industrial hemp paper and recycled cardboard with environmentally-friendly, vegetable-based inks.

No matter whats chillin’ in your mason jar, sour mash or sweet tea, come on out for a live show where the  Whiskey Bent Valley Boys will be pounding out the swing dancing, foot stompin, hard driving tunes that are guaranteed to tickle your innards.


Col. Dixon - Banjo & Guitar

JR - Fiddle & Vocals

Leroy - Bass


Whiskey Bent Valley Boys - Dry Ridge

Molly Hare

Whiskey

Rollin Mills

Bushy Tailed Rabbit

Old Rubin

Free Little Birdie

Mississippi Sawyer

Wild Bill

Riverbirch

Ashbrooke

Sugar Hill

Rabbit Rabbit

Spittin In The Peach Can

Bonus Tracks:

Old Brown Mule

Floyds Fork

Rock Andy

Big Scioty


Whiskey Bent Valley Boys - Dry Ridge will be released on Black vinyl limited to 500 copies worldwide. If you need any more information please email me at blastzoneentertainment@yahoo.com also don't forget to go to www.blastzone-entertainment.com.

story:
Hi there,

 I'm Rory Patrick Campbell born and bred in London but have lived all over Europe for many years mainly in Amsterdam and have played keyboards in many different bands with a lot of diverse musicians the good and the great many of whom came from the  USA   and since returned there which is where my rock n roll roadtrip plan comes in     

I will be travelling alone by car with my Melodica and a keyboard visiting great musicians I have known situated all over the states jamming with them interviewing them and documenting my road-trip generally with the camera (YOU) as my travelling companion!

This June for the first time ever I went on reconnaissance to California with the intention of making a musical road-trip after a lifetime as a band musician and having accumulated muso-friends and connections all over the USA , I now see that with a minimal budget it would be possible for me to undertake this great adventure and with my experience as radio presenter and musician  I feel now that I could deliver a product that would interest many people who like myself dream of making such a journey .

If I achieve my goal funding on Indiegogo to make my documentary across America I hope to visit and jam with the following friends all of whom I met here in Amsterdam! Scotty Grill - Pittsburg,l Annette Taborn- Seattle, Luke Glenn- Florida keys,  Vinny Fazzari- Los-angeles, Lydia Warren-Virginia. Boyd Small- Selem, Erin Young-Augusta, Karen Ashton-Nashville, Jerome Lee- Las vegas,  Kevin Hunter - New York,r Doug Orlando- Arizona Mathew Smith- Austin, Laith al saadi - Annarbor,   and more!

Risks and challenges

I am not a professional film-maker but will be enlisting the help of a friend experienced in editing in order to enrich the continuity and quality of my documentary on the road, as for my transportation i shall be hiring a cheap as possible car unless somebody could lend me a vehicle for this glorious journey!

story:
Hey everyone! 

I just landed an internship in West Hollywood, CA at a major recording studio! This is huge since I have lived in Texas my whole life! I have always dreamed of moving to California and had been saving up for the trip for quite some time. But! This internship will last a total of around 9 weeks, and that's just outside of my budget for living!

So I decided to raise some of the money through IndieGoGo with the goal of $2,000 to cover the remaining balance of the trip! 

Now of course I wouldn't ask for money without giving you something in return! So check out all of the awesome rewards for each contribution!

story:
Here We Go!!

   In 2010, I loaded my family and two Uhauls and departed from Ninety Six, SC with my sites on Nashville, TN. I was always told that the music business is a pipe dream. Well to me that depends on what you define as your level of success. For me, success is making a living doing what you love. I had a fellow tell me one time, "If you love your job, you'll never work a day in your life."That is so true and a statement that I hope to one day live by with your help and generosity.

                                                           What I've Done!!

     Since being in Nashville, I have recorded 2 albums, toured and performed over 150 shows in the Southeast, been on an award show with and made a great friend in UFC Legend Rich Franklin, collaborated in the studio with a Country Music Legend (T. Graham Brown) worked with multiple producers, opened for Darryl Worley, Craig Campbell, Trent Tomlinson, Bucky Covington, and Wil Champlain (finalist on the Voice) and have written with some great songwriters.. All that sounds great; Right. Well truth be told, all of this happened before I had a team around me that completely and truly believes in me and my art. I have recently acquired management with my good buddy Andrew Bailey at Insight here in Nashville. Andrew has worked with many large scale acts and music labels during his tenure in the music business,  I think Andrew believes in me more than I believe in myself somedays. Andrew has surrounded me with great songwriters for my new project, a booking agency that has guaranteed to keep me busy upon completion of this new project, the opportunity to record at the Historic RCA Studios on Music Row and a full scale marketing plan for the project that will lead to it's success in 2016.

                                                             Here's The Truth!!

    Here's the Truth.. The Music Industry has changed so much in the past 15 years. The days of Head Executives going to Tootsies on a Friday night to find new talent are long gone. With the new digital revolution (digital downloads, streaming services, youtube, etc..) album sales are at a historic low. That is good and bad for the industry.. It is bad for the major labels because album sales are what funded the labels for so many years and now that revenue stream is gone. It is great for the independent artist because it gives US a chance to have our art heard on a worldly platform with the right team. The only downfall for the independent artist is that like any small business, the independent has to fund him/herself to create the art. Thats where I am asking you guys/gals to come in.


                                           What your Contribution will be used for!!

- $5000 - This is the cost to finish the production, mixing, and mastering of my new EP to be recorded at RCA Studios on Historic Music Row. This will allow for 5 full band (Nashville's Finest Studio Musicians) and 2 raw stripped down acoustic tracks giving a total of 7 new songs for the EP Project that I have written or co-written with some of Nashville's most creative songwriters.

- $2750 - Website Rebuild, Rebranding, Photography for album cover, and CD Duplication (website,social media, merchandise, etc..).

- $3250 - PR and Marketing Promotions of new project to radio stations, ad space, media outlets, etc..

- $2000 - This will cover the cost of a video to be produced, edited, and released for promotional material to push my new single.

- $2000 - One Sheets for Radio Promotion/Tour for new single


                                                         If Times are Tight!!

      If times are tight, I completely understand! However, you can still be a big help.. Here's how and it's very simple.. Just share this listing with your friends through all of your social media sites (facebook,twitter, instagram, youtube, etc..) that's a huge help in itself.


                                                   At The End of The Day!!

      At the End of the day, none of this would be possible without you. I have been out touring and making music for the past 5 years. I have met some amazing people and acquired an awesome family of fans that really are moved and appreciate my music. I am asking you guys, my people, to help me take my career to the next level. Thank you for visiting this page, thank you for your consideration, and God Bless You All. Hope to see you on the road in 2016!!

Hope to see you on the road in 2016!!

story:
Click here to listen to an exclusive, limited-time-only stream of SIDE B (22 of 45 tracks) from the 10th Anniversary Compilation.

Our 10 Year History

Founded in early 2006, The Bay Bridged is a San Francisco-based 501(c)3 nonprofit recognized nationwide as the leading source for San Francisco Bay Area independent music. The Bay Bridged is led by a group of 30-plus volunteers who work tirelessly (after our day jobs) to promote Bay Area arts and music through our award-winning music blog and podcast, as well as a series of acclaimed music festival events including Phono del Sol, The Bay Brewed, and formerly, Rock Make Music and Arts Street Festival. Over the last 10 years, our work has served to directly promote and support over 4,000 bands and musicians.

Over the last 10 years, we've:

  • Showcased the best of San Francisco Bay Area music to over 5 million visitors on our web site
  • Brought over 80,000 attendees to festivals we've produced
  • Written over 8,000 articles about 4,000+ bands
  • Produced over 400 hours of podcasts
  • Presented and promoted over 200 shows around the Bay Area


It’s Time To Take The Bay Bridged To The Next Level

A high-cost of living (we know you know) and a shrinking pool of media outlets in the Bay Area are threatening our music community. Less media outlets means less room for coverage of smaller local artists who have trouble getting the attention of the mainstream press.

This is where The Bay Bridged has taken a leading role in our community: For 10 years, The Bay Bridged has been covering the San Francisco Bay Area music scene with daily news, interviews, features, show reviews, podcasts, and mixtapes to millions around the nation. We also create, produce, and promote unique, low-cost concerts and festivals that put local artists on bigger stages and (as often as possible) in front of all-ages crowds.

Our readers know that our coverage isn’t driven by clicks or ad sales; it’s driven by a passion for excellent art — who else is going to write about that awesome and unheard Oakland band with no label and a three-song Bandcamp demo? It’s why we’ve been called the “Best Arts or Music Website” and “Best Music Blog” by the SF Weekly and the SF Bay Guardian repeatedly. And this is why our award-winning podcast series is syndicated through KQED.

Why We Need You To Join Us

It’s a critical time for Bay Area arts and music. Now more than ever, smaller artists need allies like The Bay Bridged to defend, promote, and protect Bay Area music. But as a volunteer-run organization, we still need your help to make 2016 our most impactful year yet. With you joining our Year-End Fundraiser, The Bay Bridged can:

    • Increase our writer compensation budget and begin accepting freelance articles at rates competitive with larger media organizations
    • Publish even more great in-depth features, opinion pieces, and mixtapes
    • Increase our resources to develop and produce future events like Phono del Sol and The Bay Brewed that support Bay Area music

Rewards, Perks, Exclusive Songs!

**Click here to listen to a limited time, exclusive stream of SIDE A (23 of 45 tracks) from the 10th Anniversary Compilation**

In order to put our money where our mouth is, we’ve coordinated with our favorite Bay Area musicians to create an exclusive The Bay Bridged 10th Anniversary Compilation album featuring 45 rare, unreleased, and never-heard-before tracks from:

A Million Billion Dying Suns • Andrew St James • Battlehooch • Bear Call • Dangermaker • Dirty Ghosts • Dominant Legs • Exray's • Ezra Furman • Field Medic • Foxtails Brigade • Future Shapes • Future Twin • Growwler • Halcyonaire • Hot Flash Heat Wave • Kelley Stoltz • Kendra McKinley • Lee Bob & The Truth • Lee Gallagher and the Hallelujah • Lia Rose • Male Gaze • Melted Toys • Nackt • Nate Baker • Never Young • Paint the Trees White • Religious Girls • Scary Little Friends • The She's • Social Studies • The Soft White Sixties • Sonny Smith • Strange Hotel • Sugar Candy Mountain • Terry Malts • The Bilinda Butchers • The Blank Tapes • The Sam Chase & The Untraditional • The Tambo Rays • Tartufi • Travis Hayes • Tumbleweed Wanderers • Whiskerman • Worker/Parasite

Donate at least $15 to the Indiegogo campaign to receive your digital download in early January when the compilation is released. Only donors via Indiegogo will have access to this album as it won't be released in any other form.

All donors of at least $15 will also be entered into a raffle to win our GRAND "SEE THE BEST MUSIC IN 2016" PRIZE which includes:

  • 1 Pair of General Admission tickets to Outside Lands 2016 
  • Four FREE VIP tickets to the 2016 Phono del Sol Music Festival (July 2016; artist lineup TBA), unlimited free drinks for all four attendees, plus exclusive seating/viewing area of the main stage
  • 1 Pair of "good-for-any-show" tickets to Slims 
  • 1 Pair of "good-for-any-show" tickets to Great American Music Hall 
  • 1 Pair of "good-for-any-show" tickets to The Chapel 
  • 1 VIP Table with a free bottle of champagne for you and three friends at any show at Brick and Mortar or The New Parish

Other donor levels include awesome t-shirts and hoodies, tickets to Phono del Sol, the chance to co-host a podcast with The Bay Bridged co-founders, the opportunity to help us book a show and then invite your own personal guest list to the event, and more.

Feeling generous? We’ll even take you and seven friends out for a boat party extravaganza during a Giants baseball game with a special mixtape. Or we'll host a BBQ and play basketball with you and special guest John Vanderslice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to everyone you know as well as follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

The Bay Bridged 10th Anniversary Fundraiser art by Nic Buron.
story_txt:
Click here to listen to an exclusive, limited-time-only stream of SIDE B (22 of 45 tracks) from the 10th Anniversary Compilation.Our 10 Year HistoryFounded in early 2006, The Bay Bridged is a San Francisco-based 501(c)3 
nonprofit recognized nationwide as the leading source for San Francisco 
Bay Area independent music. The Bay Bridged is led by a group of 30-plus
 volunteers who work tirelessly (after our day jobs) to promote Bay Area
 arts and music through our award-winning music blog and podcast, as 
well as a series of acclaimed music festival events including Phono del 
Sol, The Bay Brewed, and formerly, Rock Make Music and Arts Street 
Festival. Over the last 10 years, our work has served to directly promote and support over 4,000 bands and musicians.Over the last 10 years, we've:

Showcased the best of San Francisco Bay Area music to over 5 million visitors on our web site
Brought over 80,000 attendees to festivals we've produced
Written over 8,000 articles about 4,000+ bands

Produced over 400 hours of podcasts
Presented and promoted over 200 shows around the Bay Area
It’s Time To Take The Bay Bridged To The Next LevelA high-cost of living (we know you know) and a shrinking pool of media 
outlets in the Bay Area are threatening our music community. Less media 
outlets means less room for coverage of smaller local artists who have 
trouble getting the attention of the mainstream press.This is where The Bay Bridged has taken a leading role in our community:
 For 10 years, The Bay Bridged has been covering the San Francisco Bay 
Area music scene with daily news, interviews, features, show reviews, 
podcasts, and mixtapes to millions around the nation. We also create, 
produce, and promote unique, low-cost concerts and festivals that put 
local artists on bigger stages and (as often as possible) in front of 
all-ages crowds.Our readers know that our coverage isn’t driven by clicks or ad sales; 
it’s driven by a passion for excellent art — who else is going to write 
about that awesome and unheard Oakland band with no label and a 
three-song Bandcamp demo? It’s why we’ve been called the “Best Arts or 
Music Website” and “Best Music Blog” by the SF Weekly and the SF Bay 
Guardian repeatedly. And this is why our award-winning podcast series is
 syndicated through KQED.Why We Need You To Join UsIt’s a critical time for Bay Area arts and music. Now more than ever, 
smaller artists need allies like The Bay Bridged to defend, promote, and
 protect Bay Area music. But as a volunteer-run organization, we still 
need your help to make 2016 our most impactful year yet. With you 
joining our Year-End Fundraiser, The Bay Bridged can:


Increase our writer compensation budget and begin accepting freelance articles at rates competitive with larger media organizations
Publish even more great in-depth features, opinion pieces, and mixtapes

Increase our resources to develop and produce future events like Phono del Sol and The Bay Brewed that support Bay Area music

Rewards, Perks, Exclusive Songs!**Click here to listen to a limited time, exclusive stream of SIDE A (23 of 45 tracks) from the 10th Anniversary Compilation**In order to put our money where our mouth is, we’ve coordinated with our favorite Bay Area musicians to create an exclusive The Bay Bridged 10th Anniversary Compilation album featuring 45 rare, unreleased, and never-heard-before tracks from:

& The Truth • Lee Gallagher and the Hallelujah • Lia Rose • Male Gaze • Melted
Toys • Nackt • Nate Baker • Never Young • Paint the Trees White • Religious Girls • Scary

Wanderers • Whiskerman • Worker/Parasite

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys, my name is Shawn Perry and chances are if you are reading this you either know me, someone in the band or a fan of one of my previous music projects. 

Thanks for your enduring support. 

The Skinny- 

A little background on me and the band. I have been performing professionally since I was 13. I was a former coach on the MTV series MADE, I have done radio and films and I have shared the stage with many rock legends over my career. My current project The Hazzard County Rebellion is a musical gumbo full of all of my favorite aspects from modern country, outlaw country, classic rock, pop and metal.... I am a huge sucker for happy rap... who knows MC Hammer or Young MC might make a cameo on a rebellion track someday. 

Why should YOU care?

The Rebellion is a pretty special thing both musically and socially here is why- 

Musically, this is my first foray into being a "Solo" artist. But the fact of the matter is pretty much every band I have even been in I have been the one doing the lion's share of the work and the bulk of the writing, so in many regards nothing has changed. The biggest reason for going the "Solo"  route is the freedom from having image and marketing labels associated with being a "Band". Being a solo artist allows alot more creative freedom, and it essentially neutralized any industry "Image" standards for the rest of the band, which if anybody reading this has ever gone after a major recording contract, that kind of stuff is a huge deal.... I have literally had A&R reps from major labels say things like they didn't like this guys hair, or that guys shoes and that they loved our band and they would be interested in signing us if we sounded more like (insert dumb BUTTROCK band here) or this guys looked more like this dude from some other dumb band, that has since broken up since I sat down with that fool.... So taking all of those things off that table was very important to me-

That being said; however, this is probably the most functional band I have ever been in so....go figure life is funny that way I guess. I have purposely surrounded myself with people who are actually good people, fantastic friends, and musical equals. Everyone in the band is EXTREMELY talented. The band is made up of Grayson Latimore Jr. (Drums) Dave Romweber (Guitar) Kevin Thiede (Guitar) Melissa Willis (Bass) and Ayden Ash (Fiddle)

 I am very blessed to call them friends and bandmates. Collectively we have created a group that is sonically and visually and bit of culture kaleidoscope.  The Rebellion is a multicultural, multigenerational, multi gender cross section of America. With that being the reality, I think it gives what we say in our music much more of a voice and much more gravitas than your average rock and and more that 99.9% of the country acts on the planet. Sure, we have songs about whisky and chicken and all that noise but we also have songs and social justice, income inequality, child abuse and other serious issues.  I personally feel that we need to give those issues a voice, a loud voice- 

Why Contributing is important

It's all about the fans! Fans make the music industry go round. Fans make records, tours, cool merch and in this case music videos possible. If you believe in bringing some rock and roll spectacle to country music; If you believe in blurring color lines and the lines between musical genres, and you believe in not only having a good time but saying something important in the process then this is your chance to be a part of something that we believe is truly unique and LITERALLY as American as something possibly can be. We can't do what we do without your love and support- 

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget for this video in DIMINUTIVE in the scheme of things. We are only looking to raise $1000 to make this video. I doesn't seem like a lot of money for a music video right? ....RIGHT!

Having lots of friends in this business we are able to get things done MUCH, MUCH cheaper than the average bear can. This will be a professional broadcast music video similar to the ones my other bands have done in the past... here is an example done on a similar budget, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AFdQIQVQ-ak

100% of the cash raised for this video (minus the cost of the perks) will go directly to the production of this video. If we go over that the goal which hopefully we will, we will just make a bigger better video...we can always buy more lights and add more explosions, and fry up more catfish...we literally have NO PROBLEM WITH THIS! 

If for some reason we don't meet our goal on indigogo... the video will still get made...it just might not be quite as awesome or one of us might have to sell an organ on the black market....we would rather not do that.

Perks of contributing:

Gold Level

EVERY contribution of $5 or more gets a free digital download or our new EP "Country Girls" which will be dropping in November, just leave us your email and we will send you private dropbox link to download from as soon as its ready to go... EASY…weeks  before its available for purchase-

$ 20 - SPECIAL edition hard copy of the CD, autographed by the band Limited to 100 units worldwide- and EXCLUSIVE to this campaign (Est Delivery November) 

$40 - autographed Tee Shirt + CD (Est Delivery November) 

$60 - Autographed Tee Shirt + CD and a CUSTOM thank you video posted on our youtube page (Est Delivery November) video delivery Est. 1 week-

$100 will get you all of the above PLUS and *Official* executive producer credit on the music video....ooooohhhhh MR. Big Shot.....Oh and you also get to be an extra in the video…..

Now the Crazy Stuff- 

Platinum Level

$250 private Kayak excursion: Band guided trek down the beautiful vermilion river (limit 6 people) 1-3 hour trip based on river conditions and weather + Plus all of the Gold level perks ….Oh and you also get to be an extra in the video…..

$500 all of the above PLUS a private backyard BBQ for you and few friends. (The winner of this prize must provide the food and the venue for the event) The Rebellion will play a private show (90 minutes) and I will make up a batch of my world famous CLEVELAND BBQ sauce and act as grill master. To be delivered on a date of the winners choosing provided it does not conflict with another live performance. + Plus all of the Gold level perks ….Oh and you also get to be an extra in the video…..

$2900 Valkyrie: Chimera Guitar Autographed by the band. 

OK this is a pretty special one.... I own a custom guitar company, I only make on average 5-10 guitars a year. The Chimera is my brand new flagship model, the culmination of my entire life as a player and the last four years running this company…It is 100% hand crafted by me and my team. The street price on the guitar is $3900 so it’s already $1000 off the price. This will be serial #3, Zero and 1 will be mine, #2 is already sold. The Winner will choose the color stain of their choosing over a AAAA flame maple carved top and the band will sign the WOOD! on the back before the guitar gets clear coat.... Literally THE ultimate perk on Indigogo-  (est. delivery early 2016) The winner will also get video updates and pictures along the build process- + Plus all of the Gold level perks ….Oh and you also get to be an extra in the video…..

The Impact:

Starting things off on the right foot is important, we believe in this concept, this songs and above all else we believe that YOU are going to enjoy what we are creating. A successful first single/music video will open the doors to future videos, bigger shows and more touring for the band.

Risks & Challenges

We have already worked out all or the challenges for this music video, as they say in Texas this ain’t our first rodeo. The only X-Factor since this music video will be filmed outside, production dates will be weather dependent and may have to shift if there is heavy rain…

Other Ways You Can Help

We get is we know not everyone can contribute….. if you can’t that’s cool too, But that doesn’t mean you CAN’T HELP

The first thing you can do to help is to share this campaign… Indigogo even has some special tool to help you do so…

Spread the word about the band, post this campaign on social media sites like Facebook, Instagram and Twitter….heck post it on Tinder or Ashley Madison… whatever gets the job done J If you are really creative post a short video on your youtube page about The Rebellion…. The bigger the noise we can make the better!

story:
UPDATE: Listen to the first track NOW!!! Also, get your first look at the album artwork!

Streams by Hughes Taylor from Hear My Melody.


UPDATE: For a limited time, "Limited Edition Tee" is $15 off!


UPDATE: Preview Hear My Melody NOW!

Visit HughesTaylorMusic.com or HughesTaylor.bandcamp.com


Who am I..

Hey guys!

My name is Hughes and I have been playing blues guitar ever since I was about 12 years old. I started on an old hand-me-down Les Paul guitar and learned my first chords off of a bar napkin from a local musician in my hometown of Macon, Ga. Ever since then, my life has been totally encompassed by music. 

I started recording my first full-length LP over the summer, spending countless hours writing, playing, recording, and all else that goes into the long process of expressing myself through music. Now I am reaching out to you in order to take it to the next level. This album is extremely important to me because it is the first real step in advancing my dream of making a career out of making music.

I have already completed about 70% of the album, and have set my starting goal at only $5000 to complete recording, mastering, CD replication, artwork, and other components that are essential in completing an album. I truly believe in this album and have poured my heart and soul into it. I know that together, we will see my dream come to fruition. 

I am fully aware that it takes much much more than this amount to really capture everything that goes into a new album project, so I hope to reach $8000 as a stretch goal in order to truly capture my vision with the highest of quality.


Thank You so much for all of the support that you, as my friends, family, and fans, have already given me. I know that with your help, paired with my hard work and dedication, we will see my dream come to life!

Let's make an album!


Here's What is Needed...

A lot goes into making an album. I have set my starting goal at only $5,000 to cover the minimum costs of the bare essentials; things like the rest of recording, mixing and mastering, CD replication and digital distribution, artwork, perks and shipping, and IndieGoGo fees.

Because so much more goes into post-production and the release of an album, I have set a stretch goal of $8000 to cover the remaining parts of album post-production; ie. marketing, press, merchandising, release concert/party, and touring.


Here's What You’ll Receive…

What’s better than that warm and fuzzy feeling you get when you help a young man achieve his aspirations and dreams? Perhaps something a little more tangible? I can obviously never thank you enough for your support and contributions, but I can offer you my music, merchandise, and some one-of-a-kind memorabilia! There is something for everybody! Take a look at all of the perks. I know we can find you something that really resonates with you!

(Please be sure to click on a perk found on the right hand side to select it)


The Impact of Your Contribution

This album is not just a collection of songs. It is so much more than that. The music, the guitar, it all comes from the heart. Beyond that, this is a huge learning experience for me. I am working with some very talented people to create something that is the first real stepping stone to a long lasting career. 

Your contribution not only funds the physical product, but it fuels my passion. Your contributions help me to see that there are people who also believe in what I do, and there is no better motivator than that!

Risks & Challenges

Making music is not about the money. Making music, especially blues music, is about soul and passion and pouring your heart into a piece of art that people can share and understand on an emotional level. And, as much as I wholeheartedly believe this is true, it DOES take money to record, market, make CDs for, and distribute the music. Without the necessary funds, my music will not be created with the quality it deserves, nor get the media distribution it needs.

Can’t Contribute? DON’T WORRY! You Can Still Help..

Even if you can’t contribute monetarily, you can still make a huge difference in plenty of other ways. One of the biggest things you can do is just SPREAD THE WORD; share, post, like, tweet... all of the social media platforms out there are a fantastic way to get the word out about my upcoming project.

There are fans all over, I need your help to find them!

Now I am reaching out to you in order to take it to the next level. This album is extremely important to me because it is the first real step in advancing my dream of making a career out of making music.I have already completed about 70% of the album, and have set my starting goal at only $5000 to complete recording, mastering, CD replication, artwork, and other components that are essential in completing an album. I truly believe in this album and have poured my heart and soul into it. I know that together, we will see my dream come to fruition. I am fully aware that it takes much much more than this amount to really capture everything that goes into a new album project, so I hope to reach $8000 as a stretch goal in order to truly capture my vision with the highest of quality.Thank You so much for all of the support that you, as my friends, family, and fans, have already given me. I know that with your help, paired with my hard work and dedication, we will see my dream come to life!Let's make an album!Here's What is Needed...A lot goes into making an album. I have set my starting goal at only $5,000 to cover the minimum costs of the bare essentials; things like the rest of recording, mixing and mastering, CD replication and digital distribution, artwork, perks and shipping, and IndieGoGo fees.Because so much more goes into post-production and the release of an album, I have set a stretch goal of $8000 to cover the remaining parts of album post-production; ie. marketing, press, merchandising, release concert/party, and touring.Here's What You’ll Receive…What’s better than that warm and fuzzy feeling you get when you help a young man achieve his aspirations and dreams? Perhaps something a little more tangible? I can obviously never thank you enough for your support and contributions, but I can offer you my music, merchandise, and some one-of-a-kind memorabilia! There is something for everybody! Take a look at all of the perks. I know we can find you something that really resonates with you!(Please be sure to click on a perk found on the right hand side to select it)The Impact of Your ContributionThis album is not just a collection of songs. It is so much more than that. The music, the guitar, it all comes from the heart. Beyond that, this is a huge learning experience for me. I am working with some very talented people to create something that is the first real stepping stone to a long lasting career. Your contribution not only funds the physical product, but it fuels my passion. Your contributions help me to see that there are people who also believe in what I do, and there is no better motivator than that!Risks & ChallengesMaking music is not about the money. Making music, especially blues music, is about soul and passion and pouring your heart into a piece of art that people can share and understand on an emotional level. And, as much as I wholeheartedly believe this is true, it DOES take money to record, market, make CDs for, and distribute the music. Without the necessary funds, my music will not be created with the quality it deserves, nor get the media distribution it needs.Can’t Contribute? DON’T WORRY! You Can Still Help..Even if you can’t contribute monetarily, you can still make a huge difference in plenty of other ways. One of the biggest things you can do is just SPREAD THE WORD; share, post, like, tweet... all of the social media platforms out there are a fantastic way to get the word out about my upcoming project. There are fans all over, I need your help to find them!

story:
My name is Jason Gerrish.  I am a country singer/songwriter  The honesty, integrity and values of country music have always rung true to me since I discovered the genre. Some of the artists whose songs have resonated the most to me are Brad Paisley, Trace Adkins, Jamey Johnson, George Strait and Johnny Cash. I always knew that music was what God had put in my heart to do as a passion.  I have performed at such prestigious venues as Infinity Hall, Toad's Place and others. 

Now that the introduction is out of the way, I just finished writing songs for my debut cd.  I can't wait to get into the studio and record it.  The only problem is studio time, musicians, equipment, etc... are expensive. Any funds from Indiegogo will go towards making this the best cd that it can be.  The CD is going to be about 8 songs long.  Technically, that makes this an ep.  Every little bit is greatly appreciated.  Even if this campaign is not fully funded, I still intend to go forward with this project.  If more money than needed is raised, it will go towards the purchase of getting better equipment and/or making some great music video(s).

Thank you for checking out my campaign.  Please, check out the cool perks and give whatever you can afford to give.  


Thank you,

Jason Gerrish

story:
WHO?

Hello, I’m David Knopfler.  Some of you might only know me through my work as the founder member of Dire Straits, though most probably know me through the dozen or more albums I’ve released in my own name over the past three decades.  Some of you are already my friends, others may have met me at my concerts, through social media, or you may simply be curious to find out what I’ve been up to.


WHAT?

I am fundraising for my next studio album and am offering a variety of hopefully interesting and exciting ways you can help me make this record a reality.  I’m writing to you today from my home studio in Somerset, England.  This beautiful part of the world is one of the places where I will be making this record. For the past several years I’ve also spent a great deal of time in a lovely, small town in Upstate New York called Geneseo… a well-kept, secret place that has served as an inspiration for many of the songs I’ve written for this record, as well as a place my family and I were honored to call home for a time.  Over these past years I've written what I think are my best songs yet, but to get them to you they have to be recorded in professional studios and that’s where you come in.

WHY "the grace project"?

I've titled this campaign "the grace project" in part to reflect the nature of the work. Many of the compositions, in one way or another, reflect an aspect of grace: either the journey, the search, or grace found. Some of the songs you may have heard in recent concerts, while others are ready to be performed and recorded for the first time with my band. There are songs of love lost, love found, songs of loss, of redemption and songs of hope. Above all, this is going to be a record that I hope will resonate with you.


WHY FUNDRAISING?

Historically, like many of my fellow singer-songwriters (who have avoided the mainstream and who work independently in the margins) we used to pay for our recordings through a network of international record deals with both Indie and Major record labels.  As most people know, with the advent of the Internet and digital media those kinds of arrangement are as good as obsolete. 

Too many records these days are banged out from back bedrooms without due regard to quality. Those of you who know my work will know only too keenly that I don’t work that way.  I like to make personal, handmade records with great attention to both craft and art at each and every stage of the process, from writing to recording and mastering, to artwork and pressing.  I work with sympatico artisans, each who are masters of their own craft and all with inordinate attention to detail… essentially, those who have dedicated their lives to music over wealth. 

Harry Bogdanovs and I have been working on the album here in England off and on now for some time, either polishing tracks I began in Geneseo or originating tracks here ourselves, and I’m very excited about the wonderful work we’ve been producing together so far, and particularly about those songs we are planning to begin work on with other band musicians. 

I think it’s going to easily be my best studio album to date, but that can only happen to the highest standards if I have sufficient funds to hire the most appropriate players for my songs and to capture the magic and spirit of what we are capable of creating together in a professional studio. Working with diligence, passion and patience, it’s my sincere belief that together, with YOUR help, we can deliver a combination of special tracks, each with exactly the right instrumentation and production they need to give breadth to these songs and to give YOU the best possible listening experience when you hear the results.

I'm asking for $75,000 dollars as a reasonable budget to make the record but if we manage to exceed that amount, don't worry, we plan to use it on additional instrumentation and other trimmings. I've been known to hire whole orchestras before... Spending a recording budget is remarkably easy!

WHERE?

I’ve been recording some of the acoustic tracks at my home studio in England with my musical partner, Harry Bogdanovs, and will soon be working at a London studio with the rest of the band, including Pete Shaw on bass, Martin Ditcham on drums and, if this campaign goes well, hopefully other special guest musicians as well. 

HOW?

Every dollar counts, so whatever you can pledge will be gratefully appreciated!  If you think this is a record you are going to want to buy anyway, then please simply pre-order it from me and be one of those who will get their record sooner than the official release date.  A variety of other ways you can help are listed here, including the opportunity to become the owner of an original and completely unique Dire Straits Platinum Disc, the first ever awarded that has been in my possession since 1978.  I don’t think of it so much as “selling my medals” as recycling them to a deserving home and as a special thank you to someone who is going to be an important patron and contributor to this landmark album. 

I’ve come up with contributions in all price ranges to suit all pockets, wallets and purses. If you can't afford to contribute, please share the link to this fundraiser with your friends; I appreciate all the help I can get to see this project come to fruition.  You are the people I make music for so this is your album too.  Thank you in advance for your help.

WHEN?

After the funds are raised, we will complete the album and lovingly ship out the hand packed records to you all this autumn.

THANK YOU FOR LISTENING!

Best wishes,

David Knopfler

story:
Xombiewoof Records “Black Winter” Metal Compilation

Metal to Boil the Blood on a Dark Winters Night

Xombiewoof Magazine started bringing the music loving public reviews, interviews and stories about the musical world 7 years ago, then 1 year ago formed Xombiewoof Records, a small run boutique label to bring unsigned artists into the light of day, it's been great but now we want to do more for the world. We have done many fundraisers with great success to help children's charities, this year we, with the help of some fantastic Musical Artists, we will create the ultimate Heavy Metal Compilation Album!

With the help of Music Instrument companies, Promoters, and the bands themselves, as well as help from big name nationally known artists, we will bring out an arsenal of Heavy Metal Hits, 20 songs in total from 20 bands on 2 Vinyl albums that will get the earth shaking, all in the name of helping children with life threatening illnesses.

Childhood Diseases can occur at any time in a child's life, and often, the families do not have the resources to act in time, we look to change that with Black Winter, our Fundraising Album!

One of the many things we at Xombiewoof Magazine do is support charities that help children; the fact is childhood disease claims the lives of 1 out of every 100 children in America and the rest of the world in fatality and 2 out of every hundred in crippling or painful events that last a lifetime. Xombiewoof Magazine wants to help change that, we want to make it our goal, with your help, to make the future a brighter place for those that have been stricken with illness that, if detected and treated early, don’t have to be a death or living death sentence. So often do you get messages to donate but don’t see any reward, so we have come up with a plan to help them and make it a benefit for you. The “Black Winter Project” is where we get donations through the fundraiser, you get a premium for your donation and once we have produced the album, the proceeds from the album will be given to the charities we support. The premiums or “Perks” range from small gifts to a limited edition copy of the finished album. We have the support of artists all over the United States and several foreign countries that are donating a song to the album, 20 tracks for a 2 record set. You may ask why he title “Black Winter”, well because its METAL!, Heavy Metal is a musical medium with a message of hope, through the expression of the soul and it gets you motivated to do what you believe in, SURVIVE the hardships and be victorious!

The charities we support are St. Jude’s Hospital, The American Cancer Foundation, The Central Coast Diabetes Foundation, The Heartbeat4Kids Program and The Fender Foundation.

Black Winter is planned to be the biggest collection of independent hard rock and metal artists on one 2 record set, gathering music from the US and around the world, with guest artists from nationally known bands lending their talents, Black Winter will be the one to have in your collections. This album will be limited to 2000 copies on Black / White Marbled Vinyl with 8 x 11 mini posters from every band involved and a Black Winter T-Shirt.

Artwork for Album Cover and T-Shirt is being created and will be listed soon.

MID PROJECT UPDATE:

Bands and Artists Confirmed for Black Winter Project

1.  Roy Coston

2.  Black Valentine

3.  210ToLowell

4.  Demon Boy

5.  Adler

6.  Bumblefoot

7.  Freddy Villano / Gaggle of Cocks

8.  Carlos Osnaya

9.  Parley

10.  Ralph Santolla / Devils Highway

11.  Shrouded In Neglect

12.  Not Dead Yet

13.  Absent Minded

14.  I.B.S.F.A

15.  Joe Walla

16.  Dive Bomber

17.   Carl Canedy


In Negotiation

Hellion
Rudy Sarzo
Pamela Moore
Denny Colt
Lance King
Neil Turbin
Johny Cromatic
Lance King
Jason C. Miller
Ronny North
Death Division
Doug Pinnic
Eric Bloom / Richie Castellano – Blue Oyster Cult
Rob Chevelle
Brian Forsythe
Jason Sutter

Sponsors will get some great perks so read on!

Xombiewoof Records, a small independent Record Label was started with the intent of seeking out and recording music by new and unsigned artists. In the 2 years since we have been developing and have started working with the best independent bands we could find, and now, in our second year, we plan to do something phenomenal, we plan to bring to you this December the “Black Winter”, a 2 Record Set with 20 Metal Artists in a compilation that will be brain smashing and organ melting and oh so cozy by the fireside.

This project is in its starting stages, and we are presently negotiating with some top names artists to guest appear with some of the Hard Rock and Metal artists that have committed to this project. As this project continues, we will be releasing more info, but safe to say, this will be Mega-Metal!

Summary about the Xombiewoof Record Label

Xombiewoof Records is a small independent Record Label that was started with the intent of seeking out and recording music by new and unsigned artists.

Music is a life affirming gift; it can bring you happiness and give hope when all seems low. Music allows us to express ourselves and find in others the words that capture our feelings. There are countless musicians and artists in the world that for one reason or another are not able to get their talents recorded and shared with the world. Even in this age of technology when music is easily downloaded and "shared" bands that are unsigned have limited ability and resources.

We want to be the game changers, the "fairy godfathers" of music, we have started the development of our Recording Studios and Mastering Facility, and we have contacted Record Pressing facilities in Los Angeles, New York and Indiana that will do our Vinyl Production and Packaging.

Did you say... VINYL??

Yes, we said "Vinyl", there was a time when making a record meant you made it to the top and you would create something that would be treasured by fans all over the world, The record gave way to the CD, and then to Digital Media, however the avid collector, hardcore fan and old school music lovers still seek out Vinyl, the sound quality is superb and there is nothing more fascinating than placing that big black disc on a turntable.

In recent years, Records have made a grand comeback, Record Companies have started Producing Vinyl again, Small Record Labels are popping up everywhere and Record Stores have become an Oasis of Musical Adventures once more.


Unlike a traditional Record Company, we do not Contractually sign the Artists to produce a specific amount of records, each artist will be approached by us and offered a "Pressing Agreement", We will Record and Produce a "Limited Edition", collectable record pressing that will be numbered and assigned a letter of authenticity, distributed to record stores and through direct sales through our Bandcap site - http://xombiewoofrecords.bandcamp.com, and the band will receive, after production costs are met, an agreed portion of sales, and a portion of our profits go to charities for the treatment of Juvenal Diseases. Pressings will be limited to no more than 2000 copies of any album or single, and we will also post the music for streaming at our Soundcloud page - https://soundcloud.com/xombiewoof, where our artists' music can be heard, alongside nationally supported artists and other independent music publishers, bringing our subscribers and the public new music daily and always providing alternatives to the norm.

Once we have met our obligation to produce, publish and market the bands single or album, we will connect with marketing agencies, PR agencies and larger labels to "shop the album" with the band and get them connected with a Label that will possibly sign them to a larger contract, or the band can stay with us and make as many or as few albums they like.

The Impact & Goals of our Project

Our major impact Goal is to help artists, young and old, achieve their dreams and create a collection of works from artists all over the United States, and possibly the world.

We have already connected with several Musical groups and have started production on the masters for these upcoming releases, let’s make some magic together. Supporters of this project have a unique opportunity to be part of a great project and will be noted on each pressing as contributing producers. We will forward to you info on the bands you have supported and they will be your fans and your greatest admirers.

Standard Pressings and Editions will be on standard Black Vinyl, where Limited Editions, Subscription Picks and Specials will be on Single, Mulch-colored or Blended Color Vinyl, each one becoming not just a source of great music, but a truly "one of a kind" presentation of a bands hard work.

We will also produce Flexi-Disc and other recorded media editions that will cater to collectors and people that want the fun gift for the record collector they know.

Come On, who has not ever wanted to be a Record Producer, now is your chance!

Project Notes and Info:

We will be doing updates as this project continues and as we grow, we will involve you more and more, you will have a role in supporting the arts and finding the next major music stars!

Photographs, Videos and More will be added!

Go to our Updates Page to see the new activity, everyday we are getting new bands involved, see who's helping us help the Future of Man, ... our Children!

BIG NEWS: 08/20/2015 Update

Evolution Guitars, Custom Guitar Manufacturers has graciously added an incentive to this project. not so much a perk, but an added bonus to one lucky sponsor. Evolution Guitars will select at random from one of our sponsors to receive a Custom Guitar for FREE !!! - No Purchase Necessary - all you have to do is sponsor this project! But we have to meet our goal by 75%, so share this, help us get funded and you could possibly get more than expected.

Studios and Mastering Facility, and we have contacted Record Pressing
facilities in Los Angeles, New York and Indiana that will do our Vinyl
Production and Packaging.
Did you say... VINYL??
Yes, we said "Vinyl", there was a time when making
a record meant you made it to the top and you would create something that would
be treasured by fans all over the world, The record gave way to the CD, and
then to Digital Media, however the avid collector, hardcore fan and old school
music lovers still seek out Vinyl, the sound quality is superb and there is
nothing more fascinating than placing that big black disc on a turntable.
In recent years, Records have made a grand comeback, Record
Companies have started Producing Vinyl again, Small Record Labels are popping
up everywhere and Record Stores have become an Oasis of Musical Adventures once
more.
Unlike a traditional Record Company, we do not Contractually
sign the Artists to produce a specific amount of records, each artist will be
approached by us and offered a "Pressing Agreement", We will Record
and Produce a "Limited Edition", collectable record pressing that
will be numbered and assigned a letter of authenticity, distributed to record stores
and through direct sales through our Bandcap site - http://xombiewoofrecords.bandcamp.com,
and the band will receive, after production costs are met, an agreed portion of
sales, and a portion of our profits go to charities for the treatment of
Juvenal Diseases. Pressings will be limited to no more than 2000 copies of any
album or single, and we will also post the music for streaming at our
Soundcloud page - https://soundcloud.com/xombiewoof, where our artists' music
can be heard, alongside nationally supported artists and other independent
music publishers, bringing our subscribers and the public new music daily and
always providing alternatives to the norm.
Once we have met our obligation to produce, publish and
market the bands single or album, we will connect with marketing agencies, PR
agencies and larger labels to "shop the album" with the band and get
them connected with a Label that will possibly sign them to a larger contract,
or the band can stay with us and make as many or as few albums they like.
The Impact & Goals of our Project
Our major impact Goal is to help artists, young and old,
achieve their dreams and create a collection of works from artists all over the
United States, and possibly the world. 
We have already connected with several Musical groups and
have started production on the masters for these upcoming releases, let’s make
some magic together. Supporters of this project have a unique opportunity to be
part of a great project and will be noted on each pressing as contributing producers.
We will forward to you info on the bands you have supported and they will be
your fans and your greatest admirers.
Standard Pressings and Editions will be on standard Black
Vinyl, where Limited Editions, Subscription Picks and Specials will be on
Single, Mulch-colored or Blended Color Vinyl, each one becoming not just a
source of great music, but a truly "one of a kind" presentation of a
bands hard work.
We will also produce Flexi-Disc and other recorded media
editions that will cater to collectors and people that want the fun gift for
the record collector they know.
Come On, who has not ever wanted to be a Record Producer,
now is your chance!
Project Notes and
Info:
We will be doing updates as this project continues and as we
grow, we will involve you more and more, you will have a role in supporting the
arts and finding the next major music stars!
Photographs, Videos and More will be added!Go to our Updates Page
 to see the new activity, everyday we are getting new bands involved, 
see who's helping us help the Future of Man, ... our Children!BIG NEWS: 08/20/2015 UpdateEvolution Guitars, Custom Guitar Manufacturers has graciously added an incentive to this project. not so much a perk, but an added bonus to one lucky sponsor. Evolution Guitars will select at random from one of our sponsors to receive a Custom Guitar for FREE !!! - No Purchase Necessary - all you have to do is sponsor this project! But we have to meet our goal by 75%, so share this, help us get funded and you could possibly get more than expected.

story:
RESEÑA

Soy LEONARD, cantautor Venezolano, guitarrista y percusionista flamenco.

Quiero que tanto tú, como yo, seamos participe de este sueño. Es simplemente poder grabar mi segunda producción discográfica en los Estados Unidos, pero para esto NECESITO CONTAR CON TU APOYO y es que esta producción me hará salir y entrar del país las veces que sea necesaria, ya que necesito grabar con músicos de Venezuela y de aquí, por tanto, debo tener una visa de trabajo (O-1), la cual tiene un costo de 5.600$ que incluye; tramites consulares, abogados, etc.

Lo bonito de llegar a una meta es el recorrido. Es por esto que pienso seguir con este camino y más si es compartido contigo que me quieres apoyar.

A DÓNDE IRÁ EL DINERO?

El dinero que ustedes donarán, será transferido directamente a mi cuenta personal y yo mismo monitorearé toda esta actividad.

MI TRAYECTORIA

Tengo 16 años en el mundo de la música. Con un disco en mi haber (2010), y siendo integrante del musical Venezuela Viva, tuve el privilegio de viajar por muchísimos países con más de 104 conciertos. Durante mi carrera he compartido escenarios con artistas de la talla de Francisco Céspedes, Santiago Cruz, Pedro Guerra, Diego '' El Cigala'', entre otros. 

PUEDES VISITAR MI PAGINA Y ESCUCHAR PARTE DE MI NUEVO MATERIAL

www.leonardmusica.net

En todas las redes sociales (Instagram, Facebook, Periscope, Youtube, Twitter, etc) me podrás conseguir como LEONARD MUSICA.

RIESGOS

Tengo los días contados para poder tramitar esta visa, por tanto, me urge tener este dinero cuanto antes, para avanzar al siguiente paso; MI PRODUCCION DISCOGRAFICA y compartirla con todos ustedes, a quienes les agradezco en el alma su generosidad e intención.

Y si no puedes ayudar económicamente, hay una manera de colaborar, es súper fácil y me ayudará muchÍsimooooo. Es sólo correr la voz, compartir por medio de las herramientas de indiegogo este video a tus contactos y/o por las redes sociales..

UN ABRAZO Y MILES DE BENDICIONES PARA USTEDES..

LEONARD!

story:
About Apple Hill

Throughout its 45 years as a hub of musical activity and inspiration, Apple Hill has grown from a regional summer camp into an all-ages festival that brings diverse participants from all over the U.S. and the world together to celebrate music. Apple Hill is a special place for musicians because it provides a unique experience to all its participants, using music as a common language that allows people to connect with others in a supportive and positive environment.  Its program, Playing for Peace, epitomizes Apple Hill’s mission by bringing diverse peoples together as a means of enlightening the world by connecting them through music.

 The Sugar House Needs a Facelift (you would too if you were 85!)

Apple Hill is all about creating an environment where people can celebrate music and community. The Sugar House is the perfect symbol of this experience. It’s a welcome “home away from home” for musicians in the winter and provides a relaxed space where fellow teachers and students can hang out during the summer. 

The Sugar House is in dire need of maintenance upgrades to keep it the magical place it has always been:

  • The foundation needs to be repaired

  • The roof needs to be replaced

  • New energy efficient windows need to be installed


Help us Preserve this Historic Gem

There’s just something about the Sugar House.  People write songs about it, reminisce about it, and everyone seems to have a favorite story about staying there.  It's the only year-round housing facility and one of the most historic buildings on Apple Hill's campus. Without these needed repairs, the  Sugar House would eventually need to be torn down.  Please help us preserve this gem!


Help us Get the Word Out 

  • Post this link on Facebook and Twitter
  • Send an e-mail to your friends about the campaign
  • Stay connected.  Like Apple Hill's Facebook page and share updates

story:
Our Second Album

 

After the amazing success we have had around the world with "Path of the Warrior", we are ready to take the next step!  The next Thousand Oxen Fury album will be heavier, more progressive and more epic than anything we have done before!

Check out a few tunes from our first album "Path of the Warrior":

"Rise Again" - https://youtu.be/giGd1g5LgRU

"Shelter From the Storm" - https://youtu.be/MUH7msO58eQ 

"Path of the Warrior" - https://youtu.be/aiESFMxtl58

"Empty Shadows" - https://youtu.be/ceikgwbv1h8

"Through Burning Eyes" - https://youtu.be/btVwSfoExYM

What We Need & What You Get

We estimate that we will need approximately $3000.00 for the entire project.  That funding will cover the following: 

  • Recording time at Hahn Audio in Aurora, CO
  • Mixing by the amazing producer Taylor Hahn
  • Mastering by a well known international artist in Europe
  • Mass production of the album on CD
  • International distribution of CDs and Digital Downloads (iTunes, etc.)
  • Promotion of the album at metal festivals around the world

The Impact

The United States needs more quality progressive metal.  That is exactly what we believe we have to offer.  We have been very successful with "Path of the Warrior" and can't wait for the chance to "one up" ourselves.  This next album will match and go beyond what we started with the first one.  But we can't do it without your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word by using the Indiegogo sharing tools.  Tell your friends and your friend's friends.  Help keep quality, progressive, thought provoking music alive!!!

story:
Hi my friends, I'm Ivan from Vigilante I'm a musician, producer, DJ and activist.

(For more information please visit my website)

Since 2005 I have been making music and touring the world with talented musicians playing hard electronic music in an attempt to shake people's conscience about the problems we face in our world.

Mixing elements of electronics music and metal I have been able to create a very powerful mix that allowed me to share the stage and collaborate with many of my favorite musical heroes like Nine Inch Nails, Public Enemy, Clawfinger, Ministry, Die Krupps and many more.

Rigth now I'm working very hard in my new album "TURNING POINT" and in the middle of my new tour for 2015.

I'm launching this crowdfunding campaign to invite you to be part of this process.

With your help I will be able to dedicate more time and resources to finish the new album and play for the 1st time in places I never played before.

There is many cool perks to thank you for your contribution.

Thanks in advance for your support

WE ARE ONE!

Ivan / Vigilante

"A new consciousness is developing which sees the earth as a single organism, and recognizes that an organism at war with itself is doomed." 

(Carl Sagan)

“We are all connected; To each other, biologically. To the earth, chemically. To the rest of the universe atomically.”

(Neil de Grasse Tyson)

story: Hey y'all! My name is Shaun Abbott. I'm a country singer/songwriter from Knoxville, TN. I'm setting my heart on releasing my brand new EP titled "Round Two"! But as always, I cannot make that happen without YOUR help! Fans are your family. A lot of singers these days forget who got them where they are today. So fans, I'm going to need your help to make this happen! I promise that this EP will be worth contributing to! For every $20 you contribute, I will send you a signed hard copy of the EP to your house! Please share this with your friends and family! Use the share tools for Facebook, Twitter, ect..

story:
Thanks so much for checking out our campaign!  

Said the Shotgun began playing music together in January of 2014 at an apartment above an old art gallery in midtown Sacramento, CA. The band's musical styling draws from American roots and blues music as well as throwback American and British rock n roll. Birthed in Sacramento, but conceived in a variety of cultural landscapes, the band's members bring their influences from time spent living and playing everywhere from the busy streets of Los Angeles to the sleepy banks of the Mississippi delta. 

In May of 2014, the band went into Velvet Tone Studios with the ever so talented engineer, Pat Olguin, to record some of the music we had been working on. Pat has multiple platinum album credits, as well as Billboard #1s in multiple categories. The recording quality, Pat's professionalism, and the overall vibe of Velvet Tone were a great fit for us as a band. After three days of initial tracking, we had captured what would become the heart of a full length album. Since then, we've poured ourselves into every note and have finished cutting what we feel is a well rounded piece of art that we are so proud to share. 

As this campaign is running, mixing and mastering of the 11 track album, "Snake Oil", is being completed and there are all kinds of activities going on in the Said the Shotgun camp.  We've been working on music videos, album artwork, website materials, publishing, merchandise, photos, release date plans... there has just been so much to do! We got together to create the video for this campaign recently, and we really hope you enjoyed watching it. We need your help to afford to finish all of the tasks that are involved in an album release. 

We are asking for at least $3,000 to pay for the mixing, mastering, and printing of the record. The album will be distributed both digitally on the various online platforms as well as in physical print CDs. We'll be creating masters that are ready for vinyl records, but won't be printing those until much later unless we raise over our goal considerably.

If you are able to help us by donating and/or spreading the word we would be forever grateful.  There are "perks" for each tier of contribution.

story:
WELCOME TO THE THAILAND TAKEOVER RELAUNCH !

THIS IS AN EXTENDED 1 WEEK CAMPAIGN FOR TAKE THE MOUTHPEACE TO THAILAND.  Here is the original campaign link: TakeTheMouthPeaceToThailand

Last week I extended my Thailand Indiegogo Campaign. There are some real angels out there who want me to go to Thailand so much , that we made 15% of our $3500 goal! Their faith in me pushed me to I begin my first round of vaccinations. As much as I abhor any interactions with needles, I did this in faith that I will get what I need to get to Thailand. Don't let me get poked for nothing! Please help me reach my goal.


How did I get here?

  • Who would have thought that a little Black girl (oldest of 3, from a teenage mom) from the Westside of Chicago, would graduate college, work and teach dance in Europe?  That is the POWER of ONE and the impact of the arts.  Throughout my entire life, the Power of One was in my teachers and mentors.  My village built up my self esteem and life skills by their words, leading by example and exposing me to the performing arts in my childhood. Thanks to Ms. Dalber for helping me create and submit my first book, The Princess and The Giant, for a writing contest in 3rd grade. Thanks to Ms. Clarkson for taking me to Cats & Jammin' Kids, my first dance recital in second grade.  Thanks to Ms. Manos for taking me to my first opera in 7th grade.  Through speeches, spelling bees and oratory and writing contests, I found my gift and sphere of influence primarily through poetry, stories and music.
What We Need & What You Get

  • THE BIG NUMBER; $2975 to cover the cost of roundtrip airfare, lodging and supplies.  Thanks to the generosity of donors from the first campaign, we raised $525!  We only have 7 whole days to raise $2975!
  • W.I.I.F.M. Besides the euphoric feeling of knowing you're giving to something great, you're probably thinking, "What's in it for me?" As a supporter of this campaign you deserve perks.  Perks range from authentic gifts from Thailand to singing telegrams or event performances.  Perks can be seen at this page: Perks Link

What Impact?

  • Even with technology, nothing can ever replace the impact of human contact. My physical presence is a gateway  for youth over 8,000 miles away to connect with and glean from the expertise and experience through the lens of an African American woman. 
  • Why am I so confident about this international impact? The MouthPeace in Thailand is an extension of what I've always done: empower and edutain through the arts.  From my 1 year tenure teaching dance to teen girls in Ireland, I know firsthand that the arts are a great unifier and learning tool.  Youth everywhere have something to say.  It's important that I give them tools to strengthen their voice.  I also expect to glean from their culture, so that I can use those tools with youth here in the U.S.
  • THAT'S NOT ALL! Aside from teaching the youth, during this residency I will be completing the  draft of my one woman show, "Everybody is a Star".  I started filming the documentary over a year ago. This autobiographical piece will definitely empower and entertain people of all ages. 1 month to dedicate to this without competing with the rigors of daily life, will help me get a lot accomplished on this special project.  Some perks offer complimentary access to this show.

Risks & Challenges

  • The main challenges of making this campaign a reality are MONEY and TIME. Remember, it's 7 days to $2975. Yep, a pretty aggressive relaunch. You see, I must come up with the money within a month, as my flight, housing and teaching plan must be submitted for approval by 3/1/15. 
  • Another challenge is combating the 'starving artists' mentality.   It can be difficult to procure financial support when people don't highly value the arts as a necessity.  
  • Aside from this campaign, I've applied for a scholarship.  I will not know if I've won this scholarship until 3/31/15.  Let's not take such a huge risk, waiting to hear about this scholarship.

Other Ways You Can Help

So, you've read it all but you can't give money.  Do you have an airline discount or know someone that does? Are you a business that can sponsor or know someone that can? That's a contribution.  Never underestimate the Power of One: One dollar, one call, one share, one tweet, one referral.  So, please feel free to use my Indiegogo share tools right away. The Power of One helped me get here today.

Enough talk.  Let's ACT!

The main challenges of making this campaign a reality are MONEY
 and TIME. Remember, it's 7 days to $2975. Yep, a pretty aggressive relaunch. You see, I must come up with the money within a month, as my 
flight, housing and teaching plan must be submitted for approval by 
3/1/15. 
Another challenge is combating the 'starving artists' mentality.   
It can be difficult to procure financial support when people don't 
highly value the arts as a necessity.  
Aside from this campaign, I've applied for a scholarship.  I will not know if I've won this scholarship until 3/31/15.  Let's not take such a huge risk, waiting to hear about this scholarship.

   Other Ways You Can Help
So, you've read it all but you can't give money.  Do you have an 
airline discount or know someone that does? Are you a business that can 
sponsor or know someone that can? That's a contribution.  Never 
underestimate the Power of One: One dollar, one call, one share, one 
tweet, one referral.  So, please feel free to use my Indiegogo share 
tools right away. The Power of One helped me get here today.  Enough talk.  Let's ACT!

story:
At MusicPax, we love music and are tired of seeing the artists getting screwed by the existing streaming services because that limits the art!  

Overview of the industry's Money problem:  https://www.moneytips.com/new-money-in-the-music-streaming-industry-infographic

Only MusicPax pays artists 100% more than other services and allows you to stream music for free with no interruptive advertising nor monthly subscriptions required.  Plus you will win free stuff and discounts on things you truly want.  

Obviously we cannot disclose how we can provide free music and 100% more money to artists without ads or subscriptions, but our very different revenue model has been extensively validated (it works!) and we are considering a patent.

Our streaming music player is complete.  All we need is for 100,000 of you to each give us a $1 or more to fund our final development and launch. 

If you can give more than $1, please donate as much as you can.  More money =  extra benefits for you based on the size of your contribution and it means that we can get MusicPax to you faster.

In addition to bringing Peace (Pax) to the Music industry, your donation qualifies you with lifetime status as an original MusicPax “Founder”.  

Each Founder receives lifetime preferred access to artists and special MusicPax services prioritized based on your contribution amount relative to the total amount raised.  

That is, all Founders get the first spots in line (and your donation amount determines your rank in line) for things such as:

- free/special tickets for concerts and artist events

- free/special songs & swag  by artists

- free promotion of your personal playlists (which will also make you money given our unique social model)

Please donate what you can and please share this with all of your friends!  

Thank you and here’s to Playing it Forward with MusicPax.  Peace!

Apple Music Update:  http://www.digitalmusicnews.com/2015/10/01/you-have-less-than-24-hours-to-de-activate-your-apple-music-account/

MusicPax Artist Benefit Update:  we enable this functionality for the artists at no charge!: http://www.digitalmusicnews.com/2015/10/30/why-facebook-and-twitter-are-practically-useless-compared-to-email/

story:
WHAT IS SMA?

Semana de Música Avanzada (SMA) –the Advanced Music Week– is an annual arts and music festival that started 5 years ago in Guatemala City. Our main objective is to inspire musical creativity in Guatemala through workshops, conferences, cinema, exhibitions and shows with local, regional and international artists that are shaping electronic and advanced music all over the world. 


ARTS AND MUSIC IN GUATEMALA

Guatemala is a Central American country with a population of around 15 million people.  An approximate 40% live in extreme poverty and another 30% live on minimum wage.  The amount of people that have actual access to  cultural activities and electronic music events in the country is extremely small. 

For the past 10 years Guatemala has seen an innovative cultural movement emerging with new galleries, art spaces, clubs, independent music labels and independent editorial houses.  One of the breaking points has been the reappearance of the old city center as an area for creativity and low cost housing, which has seen many local artists hub there.  Another game changer has been the growth of electronic music in Guatemala. Underground parties sparked a new vision for many young musicians over the past years. These events have brought a sense of equality on the dancefloor, with people from different ages, races, social status and sexual orientation dancing side by side. This is an exciting development, particularly in the Guatemalan context.


BRIEF HISTORY OF SMA

SMA started in 2011 under the direction of Andrés Castaño, a local Dj, producer and promoter who has been involved in electronic music in the country for more than 15 years.  The original idea was to create an event that would bring together diverse cultures, sounds, and socioeconomic groups in an attempt to break the social barriers that have torn the region.  This edition started as a two day event where many local artists, along with Luis Maier (Sunjam) from Honduras and Xpansul (True Type Tracks, Plus 8) from Spain.  The festival hosted 3 conferences, a movie screening and a flyer and photography exhibition documenting the origins of the electronic music scene in Guatemala.  The events were hosted in 3 different spots in the city center.*

*See below for description and documentation of each SMA edition during the past 5 years.  


SMA first edition flyer

WHY WE ASK YOU TO DONATE

As a nonprofit organization, our objective is to continue offering accessible entry to all events while remaining a sustainable project. We receive aid from CCE (Spanish Cultural Center), German Embassy, Fundación Paulo Alvarado, and from the Guatemalan Ministry of Culture. Despite rapidly growing interest -evident in festival attendance, financial support from cultural organizations, and an exciting guest roster- we still rely mainly on private investment from the director and his team.

Many of the local and regional artists hdonate their work understanding the importance of SMA.  However, we aim to compensate all artists, speakers, and workers who make this event possible. Neither the directory nor the team working for SMA receive any payment for their labor.

A pivotal element in SMA is to make most of the events as affordable for all people in the country regardless of their economical status. The opening night is 100% donation based. On subsequent days, most of the workshops, cinema and conferences cost around $2.00 and the parties cost no more than $16.00. There is also a festival bracelet which covers all of the activities for $25.00. 


WHAT COMES NEXT?

The festival´s sixth edition is aimed to be a game changer.  We want to improve all of the activities, have more focused hands on workshops and do new installations and activities in the streets of the city center.  Along with this we want to be able to bring back some of the artists that have shaped this past editions (including Cristopher Willits, Tom Ellis, and Xpansul) and also be able to bring new artists such as Tycho, Dauwd, ATOM TM, Dave Aju, Juan Atkins, among others. However, this will only be possible if we can gather 50% of the festival´s total costs through this campaign and through new like-minded sponsors. 

We know not everyone can make an economic donation. In that case, please share this through social media or word of mouth with any person you know or feel might be interested in contributing. 

Muchas gracias,

Andrés Castaño
