*PREVIOUS EDITIONS OF SMA:

Second edition of SMA (2012)

The second edition saw new acts from El Salvador, Mexico, Spain and Honduras.  The festival started growing and also officially initiated the relationship with the Spanish Cultural Center which has been a key ally so far.  This edition also marked the incorporation of 2 very special music figures in the country, Paulo Alvarado and Joaquin Orellana, two of the greatest experimental classical artists of our times in Guatemala. 

Joaquín Orellana

Paulo Alvarado

Third and fourth editions of SMA (2013, 2014)

The third and fourth edition added 2 more days of activities and promoted new genres, as well as new activities such as cinema.  The exhibitions took a new lifeform exploring visual artists paired with local musicians such as Paulo Alvarado and Alex Hentze who cured a space for contemplation with quadraphonic sound along video mapping with Mario Santos.  This editions hosted artists such as Tom Ellis(UK), Robert Babicz(Bedrock, GER), Andy Martin(Items & Things, MEX) and Wooky and Videocratz(Lapsus, ESP) among others. 

SMA 4th Edition Opening Day

Alex Hentze + Mario Santos Quadraphonic Mapping

Regina Celli concert Opening Night

Fifth edition of SMA (2015)

The fifth edition came strong with new international talent. Cristopher Willits(Ghostly International, USA) performed live for the festival´s opening night and German duo COMA along with Robag Whrüme hosted a special Kompakt Showcase.  The festival closed with regional talent, K.E.E.N.E. from Panama, Esteban Howell from Costa Rica and local ghetto house master Sishi Rosch played sets along Gabriel Cazali, Alex Hentze, Chiru, Lujo Prado and Voodoo Disco.  This edition also solidified the work team behind SMA which finally has all of the pieces of the puzzle together.  

SMA 5th Edition flyer by Jorge Letona


THE PEOPLE BEHIND SMA

Hubert Bendfeldt: Administration Manager - https://www.utz.gt/

Tavo Gomez: Cultural/Conferences Manager - https://www.facebook.com/eldanzantebydanzonperez

Jose Raúl Gonzalez: Sponsorship and Public Relations - https://www.facebook.com/pages/JR-Gonzo/1685272...

Marcos Godoy: Operational Manager - http://cubebookings.bandcamp.com/album/cb-artists

Jose Rodriguez: Documentation(Photography + Video) - https://instagram.com/myeyesadjust/

Dieresis: Social Reinforcement Manager - http://bajopresionrecords.com/tag/dieresis/

Chiru: Voluntary Team Manager

Kenny Paredes: Social Media Manager

Jorge Letona: Graphic Director - https://www.behance.net/jorgeletona

Andrés Castaño: General Director - http://cube-culture.com/

story:
10 Years ago a bunch of women came together to make music and have some fun. 10 years and three directors later, SASSY is still going strong making great music and sharing it with the wider South Australian community. We regularly perform at festivals and community events but now we want to be a bit more ambitious.

A couple of years after we formed we released our first album: SASSY at the Singing Gallery but since then we haven't made any more recordings. That's all going to change for our 10th birthday celebration concert when we release our first album in 7 years: 10 Years and Still SASSY. Unfortunately to do this properly it won't come cheap, and being a volunteer community choir we can't do it alone!

That's where you come in.

But we're not just going to ask for your money and expect not to have to put in the hard yards ourselves! We've shopped around and got the best deals we can find and the whole project, including arranging, recording, mastering, printing, distribution and rights management will probably end up costing around $2000 for the first run of CDs. We're hard at work fundraising in the local community and are only looking for half of that amount from you, and we're not asking for it for free. We've got a bunch of rewards you can earn through your kind donations from your name going on the credits for the album, copies of the CD or even custom acapella arrangements of a song of your choice by our Musical Director for your own choir.

We're just a small volunteer choir without much in the way of funding. All of what we have to spend on things like venue hire for rehearsals and performances and director's fees comes from the choir members' yearly subscriptions. As such we don't often find ourselves in a position to tackle ambitious projects like this, but with your help we can do it.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. If you believe in what we're doing, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends.

story:
Special Thanks to Peter's charming gentlman's voice in my video (he should do radio, right? He's a public speaker, so he's a pro) for expertly pushing the 'On' and 'Off' buttons while providing commentary for your entertainment. Also for the newly acquired tripod to shoot said video. Thanks Peter!
Onward…..

Have you ever heard of a 'Longhair Photographer'? 

Me neither. 
Until NOW. 
I am Invicta of Invicta's Art Photography and I photograph Longhairs. That's it. 

Long haired men, affectionately known as 'Longhairs' to those in this unique subculture, comprise a mere 2-5% of the adult male population (http://www.choisser.com/longhair/) . Of this scant percentage only a sexy sliver inhabit the prestigious echelon of the Long Haired Male Model (LHMM). 

It is my passion and mission on this earth to photograph the world's best LHMM and bring them to you in the form of an annual calendar and magazine plus an engaging social media presence. 

Your donation will help preserve the legacy of the Long Haired Man for generations to come and will allow me the ability to capture this legacy without undue hinderance. Longhairs are an eternal Endangered Species in our mainstream culture and I volunteer myself to document their Hotness in the ever-changing habitat of our modern society. 

Whenever I see one has chopped it off my heart weeps. 

Another one bites the dust. 

Luckily, my archives hold dear what once was and nevermore shall be. Come enjoy this journey with me and together let's show these men we love and value them.

Let's honor their courage to grow it out in a world constantly pressuring men to conform, to 'get a haircut and get a real job'. Let's face it, most jobs can be done regardless of hair length, thank you very much. Long live the Longhairs!

And let's inspire more men to grow it out so they too might one day join the ranks of Invicta's Longhairs!

The Models:

Ash Armand: this IS my photo, hence the watermark. :)

Collin Lenn: not my photo, photographer unknown. (I haven't shot with him yet)

Rob Leonis: not my photo, photographer unknown. (I haven't shot with him yet)

Pedi Amiri: not my photo, photographer unknown. (I haven't shot with him yet)

The Trip:

DATES: April 9th-19th, dates flexible, staying longer if funds permit or going to LA to shoot more hotness over there too. 
EXPENSE BREAKDOWN: 
Gas: $300-ish. There and back plus driving around Vegas location scouting and whatnot. Plus, if I go to LA, could be higher. I also hope to search for rideshare opportunities to save on gas but have to prepare in case I can't find any riders. 


Food: $165-ish? Ouch! This allows for $15/day. I may not need it all. I'm usually a cook-at-home kinda girl, so I always hate having to eat out so much while travelling. If I end up staying places where I CAN cook, you better believe I'm gonna! 

Lodging: Hopefully not much. $100? I already have at least one free place to stay lined up for a few days, but if anyone you know lives in Vegas I'm always looking for a new couch to crash on where I won't get raped and murdered as a side-dish. Can't do these shoots if I'm dead! I also may car camp out in the desert for a few nights because I love the peace and quiet and doing rebellious, anti-society things like living out of your car for a while. Typical motels will be avoided like the plague! I may splurge on a cheap Airbnb room if things get dire, though. 


Other expenses: 

9% of my total donations goes to Indiegogo, so please keep that in mind when throwing money in my face! 

$100-200 for miscellaneous crap that could come up. I don't plan to party or do fun shopping while there but you never know when you'll need more batteries for a flash or something will break or you have to pay a fee to get into a park to shoot.

Postcards for Perks: $100ish. I order my super fab postcards through Moo.com so I can get a different image on each one if I want to. 

Prints for Perks: About $3 per print if done at the dreaded Walmart. Shipping to US only, probably flat rate envelope. 

If my original trip dates come and go and I still have funds left over I would either stay longer in Vegas to shoot more models if there are any or perhaps sun myself on a lonely desert rock for a day or two since April is the prettiest month to be there and I know I'll want to enjoy a little alone time after shooting to de-stress. I may also venture over to LA to shoot with a few more models if funds and time permit!

 The Perks, Risks and Challenges:

$5- I'll make you a video shout-out and send it to you either through Facebook or email. You can make silly requests of me too if you want, let's have fun with this! 
$10-Postcard- If you're patient enough to wait for me to edit and order cards from THIS trip  you can have a postcard from one of Vegas shoots OR you can have a card from my next order which will contain photos from my November LA trip (the stuff I'm posting now on my Facebook page). I still have 4 Ash postcards left, but they're from the old set. Plus I have a handful left of other models.
$25- 8x10 Print of your model of choice from this trip (once I edit these photos) OR any of my photos as seen on my facebook page, just send me the link to your favorite photo. Plus a postcard!
$50- A short video shout-out to you with from your model of choice! Plus a postcard AND 8x10 of your model of choice.
$75- A SIGNED 8x10 of Ash Armand AND your name mentioned in short video shout-out from our shoot, plus a postcard of model of your choice. (Pending his approval to sign prints- I'm 90% sure he'll say yes, but keep that in mind)
$100- A mini-photoshoot for you! 1 person, 1 Hour shoot with 5 edited photos plus all useable shots (unedited) on disc. (If you can't travel for a shoot, suggest something else you want!)
$200- A less-mini photoshoot for you! 1-2 people, 1-2 Hour shoot with 10 edits plus all useable shots (unedited) on disc. (If you can't travel for a shoot, suggest something else you want!)
$300- A real, luxury photoshoot for you! 1-3 people, Shoot up to 4 hours with 20 edits plus all useable shots (unedited) on disc. Weddings don't apply. (If you can't travel for a shoot, suggest something else you want!)
$500- Tell me what you want. The more creative the better. 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
Well, there's always the chance things don't go according to plan. 
Risks: Asteroids, being eaten by Sasquatch, poisoned broccoli, a voodoo hex. File those under non-imminent. 
Challenges: Preventing my assistant from dry-humping the model's leg. Getting enough protein for breakfast. Getting enough sleep while couchsurfing. 
With 7 years experience as a photographer I know I can handle the usual stresses that come with the job.  Short of losing limbs, or exploding in a crash, I'm gonna get the job done. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help by spreading the word to any and all Longhair Lovers you know or to short-haired and generous men you may know, especially if they have a power exchange kink where they enjoy paving the way for another's dream even if (or especially if) it has nothing to do with them. Trust me, it's out there, fucking google it. Thanks 50 Shades. ;) 

Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools when spreading this campaign like herpes on a college campus!…Or nutella on toast…ok, let's go with the latter. I don't wanna get sued. 

If you're a journalist or know one, feel free to feature my project to meet your last-minute 'WTF?' story deadline! Whether people laugh WITH me or AT me is none of my business, it's a funny story either way. Viral potential right here!

Lastly, I think this approach is pretty hilarious, hopefully you did too! Always trying to share smiles and have a good time. No intention of offending, but I know my humor isn't everyone's cup of tea. Like I said, laugh with me or at me, or diagonally across from me, I don't care what orientation you prefer, just as long as you 'Smile'- my favorite Michael Jackson song, the Original Longhair King and my first love. I dedicate my work to him, he started it all and has inspired everything I do. I love you Michael. 

Long live the Longhairs! 

Find my work on my Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Invictas-Art-Photography/155626707826692

On Tsu: https://www.tsu.co/LadyInvicta

And all over the web, fucking google it. ;) 

xoxo

-Invicta
story_txt:
Special Thanks to Peter's charming gentlman's voice in my video (he should do radio, right? He's a public speaker, so he's a pro) for expertly pushing the 'On' and 'Off' buttons while providing commentary for your entertainment. Also for the newly acquired tripod to shoot said video. Thanks Peter!Onward….. 

Have you ever heard of a 'Longhair Photographer'? 
Me neither. 
Until NOW. 
I am Invicta of Invicta's Art Photography and I photograph Longhairs. That's it. 

Long haired men, affectionately known as 'Longhairs' to those in this unique subculture, comprise a mere 2-5% of the adult male population (http://www.choisser.com/longhair/) . Of this scant percentage only a sexy sliver inhabit the prestigious echelon of the Long Haired Male Model (LHMM). 
It is my passion and mission on this earth to photograph the world's best LHMM and bring them to you in the form of an annual calendar and magazine plus an engaging social media presence. 
Your donation will help preserve the legacy of the Long Haired Man for generations to come and will allow me the ability to capture this legacy without undue hinderance. Longhairs are an eternal Endangered Species in our mainstream culture and I volunteer myself to document their Hotness in the ever-changing habitat of our modern society. 
Whenever I see one has chopped it off my heart weeps. 
Another one bites the dust. 
Luckily, my archives hold dear what once was and nevermore shall be. Come enjoy this journey with me and together let's show these men we love and value them.
Let's honor their courage to grow it out in a world constantly pressuring men to conform, to 'get a haircut and get a real job'. Let's face it, most jobs can be done regardless of hair length, thank you very much. Long live the Longhairs!
And let's inspire more men to grow it out so they too might one day join the ranks of Invicta's Longhairs!
   The Models:


Ash Armand: this IS my photo, hence the watermark. :)

Collin Lenn: not my photo, photographer unknown. (I haven't shot with him yet)


Rob Leonis: not my photo, photographer unknown. (I haven't shot with him yet)

Pedi Amiri: not my photo, photographer unknown. (I haven't shot with him yet)
The Trip:


DATES: April 9th-19th, dates flexible, staying longer if funds permit or going to LA to shoot more hotness over there too. 
EXPENSE BREAKDOWN: 
Gas: $300-ish. There and back plus driving around Vegas location scouting and whatnot. Plus, if I go to LA, could be higher. I also hope to search for rideshare opportunities to save on gas but have to prepare in case I can't find any riders. 



Food: $165-ish? Ouch! This allows for $15/day. I may not need it all. I'm usually a cook-at-home kinda girl, so I always hate having to eat out so much while travelling. If I end up staying places where I CAN cook, you better believe I'm gonna! 

Lodging: Hopefully not much. $100? I already have at least one free place to stay lined up for a few days, but if anyone you know lives in Vegas I'm always looking for a new couch to crash on where I won't get raped and murdered as a side-dish. Can't do these shoots if I'm dead! I also may car camp out in the desert for a few nights because I love the peace and quiet and doing rebellious, anti-society things like living out of your car for a while. Typical motels will be avoided like the plague! I may splurge on a cheap Airbnb room if things get dire, though. 



Other expenses: 
9% of my total donations goes to Indiegogo, so please keep that in mind when throwing money in my face! 
$100-200 for miscellaneous crap that could come up. I don't plan to party or do fun shopping while there but you never know when you'll need more batteries for a flash or something will break or you have to pay a fee to get into a park to shoot.
Postcards for Perks: $100ish. I order my super fab postcards through Moo.com so I can get a different image on each one if I want to. 
Prints for Perks: About $3 per print if done at the dreaded Walmart. Shipping to US only, probably flat rate envelope. 
If my original trip dates come and go and I still have funds left over I would either stay longer in Vegas to shoot more models if there are any or perhaps sun myself on a lonely desert rock for a day or two since April is the prettiest month to be there and I know I'll want to enjoy a little alone time after shooting to de-stress. I may also venture over to LA to shoot with a few more models if funds and time permit!
 The Perks, Risks and Challenges:

$5- I'll make you a video shout-out and send it to you either through Facebook or email. You can make silly requests of me too if you want, let's have fun with this! 
$10-Postcard- If you're patient enough to wait for me to edit and order cards from THIS trip  you can have a postcard from one of Vegas shoots OR you can have a card from my next order which will contain photos from my November LA trip (the stuff I'm posting now on my Facebook page). I still have 4 Ash postcards left, but they're from the old set. Plus I have a handful left of other models.
$25- 8x10 Print of your model of choice from this trip (once I edit these photos) OR any of my photos as seen on my facebook page, just send me the link to your favorite photo. Plus a postcard!
$50- A short video shout-out to you with from your model of choice! Plus a postcard AND 8x10 of your model of choice.

$200- A less-mini photoshoot for you! 1-2 people, 1-2 Hour shoot with 10 edits plus all useable shots (unedited) on disc. (If you can't travel for a shoot, suggest something else you want!)
$300- A real, luxury photoshoot for you! 1-3 people, Shoot up to 4 hours with 20 edits plus all useable shots (unedited) on disc. Weddings don't apply. (If you can't travel for a shoot, suggest something else you want!)
$500- Tell me what you want. The more creative the better.

story:
Short Summary

Broken Arts is a volunteer-run collective dedicated to fostering local and independent creativity in Oshawa, Ontario. We've been around for six years and this year will mark our fifth annual installment of Broken Arts Fest on July 18th, 2015.

Broken Arts Fest is a free music festival in Oshawa's Memorial Park featuring mostly local musicians, as well as vendors selling their homemade wares. Because Broken Arts isn't a profit-seeking organization, we rely on donations, sponsorship and vendor fees to make the festival happen. The more funding we get, the better the festival! That's where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

We - the Broken Arts team - have been working very hard this year to get the festival running, and we've come a long way. There are still certain expenses, however - such as renting sound equipment and paying the performers - that can stand to benefit greatly from additional funding.

Depending on how close to the festival you choose to donate, we may not receive your actual donation in time for the event. But knowing that your donation is on its way will let us know that we can cover the expenses knowing that we will be able to recoup what we spend.

We have set the goal of $500 as a best-case scenario. If we do not reach the desired goal, the money we do raise will still greatly help us in the execution of Broken Arts Fest.

The Impact

The Broken Arts team does this job as a labour of love -- none of us make a profit from it and we take time out of our personal lives to put everything together. Why do we do it? Each member of the team will likely give you a different answer, but what unites us is the conviction that community action at a local level matters. We want to give a platform to people making independent art, no matter their age or socio-economic status.

Risks & Challenges

While we expect to raise enough money to allow the festival to go on without a hitch, we are not quite there yet. Some members of our team have occupied leadership roles in other organizations and have run large events before, so we are confident in our abilities to surmount every challenge in our way. Your contribution, however, will go very far in aiding us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help out! Head over to our Facebook page or our Twitter (@brokenartsca), and help spread the word about Broken Arts Fest so that everyone knows this is happening! If you live in Durham Region and want to volunteer on the day, you can ask us for more details at brokenartsca@gmail.com.

And of course, come to Oshawa's Memorial Park on July 18th to check it all out!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Terra, Executive Director for Salem Chamber Orchestra.  One day, I sat down for coffee with a friend in the non-profit business and he showed me a video of what their organization was all about.  I couldn't believe how impacting the video was, it made me want to be a part of the good work they were doing right then and there.  Ever since then, I have known Salem Chamber Orchestra needs to share their story on film.  This mini-documentary will give the community a taste of what SCO is all about, and show viewers why they will love coming to a concert.  The means for making this film are within reach, but we need help from you in order to make sharing our message possible.  Your support will help SCO continue to make Salem, OR a thriving community full of performing arts, culture, and educational opportunities.  

What We Need & What You Get
We have already started pre-production for this project with a local company.  They are committed to helping us realize this idea and have provided some of their services in kind.  However we still need to pay for about two and a half days of filming at multiple locations, custom graphics, and post-production. $5000 is what we need to make this happen.  

The good news is, we have some amazing perks!!  You could have the opportunity to attend an exclusive dinner with the conductor, guest artist, and orchestra musicians, get a backstage pass to see what goes on behind the scenes before a concert, and even VIP passes to the documentary premier party!  

What if we don't make our entire goal?  We are still planning to complete the project.  But if we don't make our goal, the timeline for producing the project will be significantly impacted and we will have to seek financial support in other places.

The Impact
 In a recent arts survey, the vast majority of citizens believe that the presence of live, professional performing arts in the community: 1) improves the quality of life, 2) promotes understanding of other cultures, 3) fosters pride in the community, and, 4) contributes to the education and development of children and adults.

All of these wonderful contributions to the community can't happen without awareness of the Salem Chamber Orchestra.

SCO continues striving to make Salem a progressive and high quality place to live.  The project to make a micro-documentary is key in SCO's ability to make the arts accessible to more people in the community.  Using this film as a tool to engage new and younger audiences will help SCO grow and continue fulfilling its educational and community oriented initiatives.  We must ensure the rich legacy of  arts and culture in the Mid-Willamette Valley.   

Risks & Challenges

There is a risk in not fulfilling the project funding in the timeframe we have planned.  We need to begin pre-production work this summer, which includes capturing behind the scenes shots of our musicians' and conductor's musical lives.  This takes careful planning between the Executive Director and production team to schedule and coordinate all of the logistics.  The film will culminate with footage leading up to the fall concerts in 2015.  This time frame is invaluable to producing and releasing the project with the most impact.  If we don't have the funding in time, our plans may shift.  

However, we have a reliable base of supporters!  You are the ones that helped us create Play Me I'm Yours in 2012, and we can work together to produce another great community engagement project.  We also have a consistent track record from several granting organizations, so if we don't meet our goal, we will seek additional funding from granting organizations.  

Play Me I'm Yours was partially supported by the Oregon Arts Commission and City of Salem Transient Occupancy Tax.  The remaining 50% of the project was supported by community business owners and individuals just like you!  This allowed us to work with other non-profits to place 11 pianos in public places all over town.  Crossing boundaries of age, class and culture, Play Me, I’m Yours democratizes the arts and encourages the exploration of creativity by everyone.

Mayor Anna Peterson endorsed Play Me, I’m Yours, citing its alignment with city goals “to be a leader in projects to improve the quality of our urban environment.”

Salem Chamber Orchestra continues leading the city towards a bright future with this exciting new micro-documentary.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If making a contribution is not currently within your means, you can still help us reach our goal!  We need the voices of people in Salem to share and advocate for this project.  The more people who know, the greater the chances of having it funded.  Please make some noise (beautiful, harmonious, musical noise), about our campaign within your circles and use the Indiegogo tools to share the project on social media.  Thank you for caring and for sharing!

story:
Nerd Fest V: A Night of Epic Fantasy

This event is a fun filled night of epic fantasy with some of the best Vancouver has to offer. Its a variety show consisting of stage performers, live music, magic, sword fighting, short films, and even a costume contest. Local vendors of all types will be setting up booths selling their goods and services that will bring out the nerd in us all. Its like a mini fan fest but more adult themed!

Aesir Promotions is a small independent company that is run by a small group of dedicated musicians and artists whose goal is to contribute to Vancouver's fan community a night that celebrates all types of fantasy culture. This year is our fifth year putting on this festival and we plan on bringing our audience some exciting new acts and some old favorites revamped! All performers that we will be bringing in this year are of the highest quality for the benefit of our audience and the giveaways will be even bigger. In order to do this however, we are going to need some assistance from our fellow nerd enthusiasts!

What We Need & What You Get

What we are looking to raise is approximately $2,000 to help us with the production costs. Production costs are anything that is needed to make the event run: Hall rental and staff costs, printing expenses (programs, posters etc), and promotional costs (publicist, website etc)  so we can get the word out to the people in the streets. Any perks that involve tickets to the event will have a portion set aside to go towards the payment of the performers.

But what about the perks you say? We have a wide variety from Nerd Fest swag and mystery goodie bags to requesting your favorite video game song from one of the bands, to having your name on the new festival shirt for this year as a sponsor!

One of our most exciting perks is one that will only cost you $25 and you can have our resident wizard RanDeXGest make you a 60 second video clip advertising anything you like with his own personal wizard twist. You could do a birthday shout out or advertise an upcoming event, anything! We will put these videos on our website or possibly choose a couple special videos to play the night of Nerd Fest! 
Even if we don't meet our end goal amount, we will still use your generous donations towards our above mentioned costs so that the all the ticket money will go to where it needs to go, to the performers.

* please email us your script or note for our wizard when choosing this perk! (nerdfestvancouver@gmail.com)

Supporting Local! Those of us involved in putting on Nerd Fest feel that it is important to support your local performing artists and artisans. Which is why the majority of the acts and vendors involved are from the lower mainland. Many of them have donated some of their amazing work to be part of this campaign (thank you!) and are a big part of how we can make this an annual festival

Other Ways You Can Help

We all understand that money can be tight these days. So if you are unable to contribute to our campaign in that way, there are all types of ways you can be involved! Help spread the word by posting about Nerd Fest on facebook, twitter or any other social media. Please check out our website don't forget to tell a friend as well!

http://www.nerdfestvancouver.com/

all understand that money can be tight these days. So if you are unable 
to contribute to our campaign in that way, there are all types of ways 
you can be involved! Help spread the word by posting about Nerd Fest on 
facebook, twitter or any other social media. Please check out our 
website don't forget to tell a friend as well! http://www.nerdfestvancouver.com/

story:
Who We Are

Greetings, earthlings! We're Rafael, Gabriel, and Fiona, three siblings from NY, and together we make up 1209Sycamore! We all played music growing up, and eventually found that we loved playing and writing songs together. We've been working together for the past five years and are ready to make an album of our original tunes! These songs mean a lot to us and we'd love to share them. Any support you can give us is greatly appreciated! 


What We Need 

We are looking to raise $8,000 to cover the costs of recording a full studio album. This will go towards: 

    - Professional studio recording

    - Paying studio musicians

    - Post-production costs (mixing, mastering, etc.) 

    - Album artwork and photography

*Whether or not this campaign is fully funded, we will find a way to make this album happen! 


Risks & Challenges

We know that recording a full-length album takes a lot of work, and we are fully committed and excited to put in that work! 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're kinda broke like us, and can't afford to contribute, you can still help us by sharing this campaign all over social media. That being said, every dollar counts, and we truly appreciate anything you can give!

story:
http://connorroff.com/

Thank you for taking the time to check out this crowdfunding page and support the recording and release of my new EP.

Hopefully you’ve already watched the video above, if not please have a look, since it outlines everything I’ve been up to the past few months in London and will continue to pursue over the next while.

The following pie chart shows a rough breakdown of costs for this record. Those of you contributing in Canadian Dollars (CAD), don't be frightened, the currency simply gets converted into British Pounds (GBP) according to the current exchange rate.


For clarification, EP Production is made up of studio time, sound engineer, producer, session musicians, editing, mixing and mastering.

Thank you so much to those of you that have supported me in the past. Your ongoing support in helping me pursue my musical dream has and always will be much appreciated. This EP is a big step in the right direction for me musically. It's more upbeat with heavier sounds and maturer themes that I think will help build my artist team, fan base and help put me on the map as a singer/songwriter. Many people would argue that to pursue such a career is monumentally challenging in so many ways and they’d be right. But it’s your generosity that helps makes it possible so thank you. – CR x

P.S. Please help spread this campaign by sharing it through your own social media platforms and by telling your family and friends.


Bio:

“Roff’s voice demonstrates remarkable flexibility alternating from heartfelt fragility to soaring refrains. One of Roff’s talents is to build and sustain atmosphere throughout the EP to create a sense of a journey; apt considering the artist’s own travels.” – Gigiti

With over fifteen years of musical experience, Connor Roff’s passion for music has taken him around the world. After leaving the UK at the age of seven and moving to Vancouver, Canada, Roff was introduced to and inspired by the likes of the Rolling Stones, Ray Charles and Fleetwood Mac, with his range of tastes enhancing his performance versatility.

Classically trained on the piano and self-taught on the guitar, this repertoire helped Roff develop a unique style, fusing rock, pop, folk and soul, with a powerful voice.

Sincere songwriting, thought-provoking lyrics, and catchy melodies created Connor’s debut self-titled EP released in January 2014 and recorded at Fader Master Sound Studios with local producer Winston Hauschild.

Roff took to the stage for the Celebrate! Stanley Park 125th Anniversary alongside The Arkells, The Matinée, and others and was a part of LAUNCH! Fest, a performance and mentorship showcase. Connor’s next step was to gain exposure to a wider Canadian audience, organizing two solo Eastern Canada tours and performing on the train as part of VIA Rail’s Artist on Board program.

Roff’s move to London, England has given him exposure to a scene that has enriched every aspect of his music including songwriting, performing and networking.

2015 marks an exciting chapter of the Roff adventure, with plans for the release of a new EP and supporting tours following the release of his new single Chasing Dreams.

http://connorroff.com/

story:
Flussi è un festival internazionale di arte elettronica e cultura digitale che si tiene con cadenza annuale ad Avellino, promosso e prodotto dall'associazione culturale senza scopo di lucro "Magnitudo".

 Il festival, nato nel 2009, è divenuto negli anni realtà di successo grazie ad un programma artistico-culturale di respiro europeo, caratterizzato da una variegata offerta di contenuti musicali, installativi e didattici, legati alle nuove tecnologie, all'arte e alla cultura digitale.

Il festival, affermatosi come punto di riferimento nel panorama nazionale dei festival dedicati al genere, si offre come occasione di promozione del territorio, contribuendo all'arricchimento dell'offerta culturale della provincia attraverso una proposta di qualità che grazie alla presenza di numerosi artisti di levatura internazionale richiama ogni anno un pubblico di appassionati da tutta Italia.


Flussi è cresciuto di anno in anno rinnovando e ampliando l'offerta del festival fino a giungere alla formula attuale: tre palchi, workshops, dibattiti ed eventi speciali in partnership con altri attori locali (conservatorio Domenico Cimarosa, Caritas diocesana, Teatro Carlo Gesualdo, festival del cinema Laceno d'Oro). 

Crescendo abbiamo puntato sempre più su artisti internazionali di punta, senza troppo assecondare tendenze e mainstream ma cercando un'identità e uno stile proprio, per acquisire carattere e tratti distintivi. 

Uno tra tutti il basso costo di accesso ai workshop e agli spettacoli, alcuni totalmente gratuiti!

Flussi è cresciuto tanto ma continua a reggersi su forze spontanee interne e resiste come sana espressione di una volontà e di un'azione dal basso. Mettere in piedi un festival come il nostro significa fare i conti con molti dettagli pratici, tecnici ed economici. Un lavoro continuo ed impegnativo svolto nel corso dell'anno con dedizione e spirito di sacrificio senza percepire alcun compenso.

Purtroppo, da diversi anni, la tenuta del festival è stata fortemente compromessa, per le ragioni che tutti conosciamo: austerity, tagli alla cultura, situazione critica dei bilanci pubblici e privati.

Ogni anno affrontiamo con tenacia e coraggio le condizioni avverse di un contesto ancora piuttosto ostile che stenta a riconoscere in pieno il valore di un'iniziativa come la nostra. Il sistema cultura in Italia e nel sud in particolare soffre di una cronica carenza di risorse, manca una visione “europea” e si fa fatica a riconoscere l'importanza e l'impatto che ha un festival come Flussi per la cultura e l'economia del territorio.

È per questo che ci rivolgiamo a tutti quelli che hanno sempre partecipato al festival, al suo pubblico, a coloro che ne sono venuti a contatto o che semplicemente ne hanno sentito parlare, a chi ne è stato solo sfiorato, a tutti quelli che riconoscono e si nutrono della bellezza delle cose.


Per poter realizzare la settima edizione di Flussi e coprire una parte dei costi di produzione, abbiamo bisogno del sostegno di tutti voi, di coloro che conoscendo il festival ne apprezzano la proposta e i risultati raggiunti a vantaggio del territorio (attrattività e indotto), ne comprendono il valore, ne ammirano la sfida e riconoscono gli sforzi compiuti dai tanti che, con sacrificio e dedizione, si spendono per realizzare questo evento unico in Irpinia.

Grazie al tuo contributo puoi rendere la produzione del festival un’impresa possibile, ancora possibile, affinché  si mantenga alto il livello dell’offerta artistica/formativa e bassi i prezzi di ingresso e fruizione. 

È  per questo che ti chiediamo di sostenere Flussi con un'offerta, di tendere la mano al festival, di realizzare un contatto con esso, di spendervi una attenzione in più, sapendo che insieme investiamo in un'opera e in uno scopo che ci accomuna: restituire valore e bellezza al luogo e al tempo che abitiamo.

Aiutateci a non disperdere un patrimonio culturale importante
per la provincia e per il mezzogiorno!

Aiutateci a realizzare l'edizione 2015 del Festival!

Sosteniamo a tutti i costi la cultura!

story:
Update May 1st, 2015:

This is the "home stretch" for us to raise the much-needed remaining $3K+ to cover the costs of audio post-production, graphic design, and publication of the unique 8X11 BOOK, which will include links to the MP3 audio and a CD. 
The Deadline is May 4th. Every dollar you can share with us NOW will help us successfully present to the world a collection of GORGEOUS songs, most of which the world has not heard! Excited? We are! Thank you in advance for your support.

Update April 28, 2015:

NEW VIDEO just posted in the Gallery! More to follow in the next few days! Click the tab on the upper right side.

JUST  S I X  DAYS LEFT before this campaign closes! Contribute as little as $10.00 now, and receive a complimentary download of the entire album, PLUS the eBook! See the other PERKS too! 


Our historian Rachel Hildebrandt has wowed us with some amazing finds! From the letters between the Schumanns [Robert and Clara!]... quotes about Franz's close friendship with "the other Franz," i.e., Liszt... Wagner encouraging Franz to write operas [and his flat refusal to do so]... and details on how Franz was pursued by a publisher in the U.S. over 100 years ago -- it's all going to be in the eBook! 


JOIN US on this fascinating exploration into the life of a man who, despite his personality quirks, was able to respond to the emotional core of great poetry, and set it to music like no other composer. The evidence is in the songs!
**************************************************

Update April 13, 2015:

Recording is complete! What an intense, but amazing week! 
We are in the Home Stretch! Just 21 more days to meet our Funding Goal. 
To that end, we've added an enticing, valuable new PERK to the mix:

Fund us $10 between now and our May 3rd deadline, and receive a FREE Digital Download of both the Music AND the eBook! 

**********************************

If you've thought of contributing to this project, now would be a great time to do so! We are sparing no expense to bring the world a comprehensive, super hi-res, HD collection of 40 of the most beautiful songs ever written. 

********************************** 

The entire team thanks you in advance for your support: 

1. Doug Yoel, four-time Grammy-nominated producer;
2. Pianists Rita Greenstein, Colin Fowler and Michael Hey;
3. German Diction Coach Archie Worley;
4. Historian Rachel Hildebrand;
5. Publicist/Marketing Specialist Judith Adler;
6. Translators Jonathan Trudel and Dr. Wendell Frye of Hartwick College;
7. Transcriptionist Alex Guerrero;
8. Videographer and film editor Maddy Krol; 
9. Graphic Designer [Position Open! Inquire Within!] 
10. BookBABY.com -- an AMAZING resource of publishing know-how! 
11. Diana Zaslove and George Kahn, RECITAL hosts July 5th [Los Angeles];
12. Jean Widaman and CCMP.org, RECITAL host July 12th [Carmel, CA]
13. St Matthew's Lutheran Church, RECITAL host Aug 4th [San Francisco]  
14. NYC recital host TBA, late June 2015. 
*************************************************

Update March 21, 2015: 

Rachel Hildebrandt has joined our team! Rachel, a fluent German speaker, is an amazingly talented historian. Rachel's work spans a wide range:

http://www.live-like-a-german.com/germany_related_articles/show/Knecht-Ruprecht

Rachel will "play detective" to find any and all connections Franz had with his ultra-famous 19th century German friends and colleagues:

Robert Schumann, Franz Liszt, Felix Mendelssohn and the opera great, Richard Wagner, who evidently enjoyed Franz's songs so much that he kept a library of his songs in his home.

Rachel's research will help answer the most important question: "With songs this beautiful, why did Franz's songs go by the wayside?" 

There are already a ton of possible answers. 

We will explore all of this, in more detail, in the book. 

*********************************************************************

OK, CDs are Dinosaurs. We get it. 

So the $18.95 8X11 book will include instructions on how to download the recording for free, via Tim Krol's web site, timkrol.com -- You will also get an eBook for your gadgets; and yes, just in case you need it, a CD will also be tucked inside the front cover of each book.

This next phase will help us launch the first printing of a full-sized, 60-page book to showcase the stunning music of an "otherwise forgotten" composer. 

In the book, we will explore the ups and downs of Robert Franz's life, along with interesting tidbits about his relationships with some of the famous composers of his day [Wagner, Schumann, Liszt, Mendelssohn], and a deeper look into the lives of the poets who inspired him. 

The poems, newly translated into 21st century English, thanks to Dr. Wendell Frye, will appear in large and easy-to-read fonts throughout the book. More on Dr. Frye's expertise can be found here:

http://www.amazon.com/Indian-Summer-Translated-Wendell-Printing/dp/3034303483/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1426542725&sr=8-2&keywords=wendell+frye

***********************************************************

If it had not been for Rita Greenstein, this project would never have happened. If you have a few moments to watch this youtube, you will find out why Rita continues to be an ongoing inspiration, not only to us, but many many others:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_wuJalMCBlg 

******************************************************************

Funding will also pay for the excellent [and long, meticulous and painstaking] work of Alex Guerrero, one of NYC's top lyric tenors, who created clean, newly typeset sheet music for a significant number of Franz's songs, many of which have never been published in the USA:

http://www.bach-cantatas.com/Bio/Guerrero-Alex.htm

story:
What's up people? You can call me KLUTCH!!! If you’ve been following me for the past few months, you’ll know that I’ve been very busy promoting my debut EP #DeathToSelf, doing shows while writing and recording my first full-length album titled #YouGetWhatYouGive!

The concept is simple. In life we get what we give out, whether it's positive or negative. My music has always been about spreading positive vibes, real life, & spreading the gospel at the same time.  We’ve come a long way already but still got a #LongWayToGo so I wanted to let you in on a little secret…I’m letting YOU be a part of it in a big way! 

By teaming up with my friends at IndieGoGo, I’m able to bring you along for the ride of releasing this new album. 

As a THANK YOU I'm giving out the first single "Riches" produced by Hollywood Legend, for FREE DOWNLOAD EXCLUSIVELY on my website!!! 

Here’s how it works: I’ve put up some really cool exclusives and fun opportunities that I know you’ll love! Not only will you be getting involved with my new album, but a portion of your pledge will also go to an amazing charity near to me, Autism Speaks! (5%)

It has been YOU all along that has allowed me to do what I love. YOU guys are the reason I’m here! So come along and join the journey OFFICIALLY! 

Since 'WE' will be working together, I felt it fair to let you know where 'YOUR' money is going! 


1. Beats/Production (12 songs)

2. Studio recording/Mastering (Album will be recorded in 40 days/nights)

3. Physical Distribution (CD &Vinyl copies)

4. Digital Distribution (Online retailers Itunes, Google Play)

5. Marketing & Promotion/Radio Campaign (College and National FM Airplay)

6. Music Videos (I plan to collaborate with a variety of talented directors and editors to create a unique music video to accompany each single)

7. Merchandise (Shirts, Hats, Hoodies, CDs, Vinyl, etc)

8. Booking National Tour

 

                                         


Total budget is $30,000 to achieve all of this. I will be backing the other half with my OWN $15,000, I just need YOUR help raising the other half. #YouGetWhatYouGive #WhyNot #ThatsKlutch  

Fundraising will last 60 days. Here's what you can expect.

- TWO Updates every month 

- NEW Song releases every TWO weeks 

- NEW Music Video/Lyric Video releases once a month

After completion, I will proceed to the recording studio for 40 DAYS/NIGHT to record and finish the album. 

Also all REWARDS will be ordered and delivered by October 28, 2015. 

Album release date is TBA 2016
story_txt:
What's up people? You can call me KLUTCH!!! If you’ve been following me for the past few months, you’ll know that I’ve been very busy promoting my debut EP #DeathToSelf, doing shows while writing and recording my first full-length album titled #YouGetWhatYouGive!The concept is simple. In life we get what we give out, whether it's positive or negative. My music has always been about spreading positive vibes, real life, & spreading the gospel at the same time.  We’ve come a long way already but still got a #LongWayToGo so I wanted to let you in on a little secret…I’m letting YOU be a part of it in a big way! By teaming up with my friends at IndieGoGo, I’m able to bring you along for the ride of releasing this new album. As a THANK YOU I'm giving out the first single "Riches" produced by Hollywood Legend, for FREE DOWNLOAD EXCLUSIVELY on my website!!! Here’s how it works: I’ve put up some really cool exclusives and fun opportunities that I know you’ll love! Not only will you be getting involved with my new album, but a portion of your pledge will also go to an amazing charity near to me, Autism Speaks! story:
About us

The box collective is an international company run by women that originated as an ensemble in New York. Consisting of artists who hunger to challenge the traditional theatre scene and engage their audience through a real experience, our work evokes visceral reactions beyond passive entertainment.

From the beginning, the vision of the box was to create a company that would perform not only in New York, but take this approach to theatre around the world. In the past few years we’ve forged international relationships and collaborations throughout Europe and we continue to grow into new territories both artistically and geographically.

This is theatre of immediacy, necessity and risk-taking. Beginning from an organic creative process, the ensemble works together to create a holistic performance experience. This is theatre that comes from a question and a need to know. 

www.thebox-collective.com 

Summer 2015. The box collective was invited into residency at the Heller Gardens to develop our newest work “The Stadt Elegies.” We will spend a month developing this piece which we will go on to perform in Italy, Berlin and Munich. In tandem we are creating a documentary film in co-production with Viscus Film to capture our process of artistic creation.

The ensemble includes artists from all over the world: 5 performers hailing from Austria, Australia, Germany and the United States, our director from the Moscow Art Theatre, a composer from Spain and a filmmaker from Belgium.

Itinerary:

Heller Garden Residency in Gardone, Italy

Duse Theater in Asolo, Italy

Kühlhaus in Berlin, Germany

Team Theater in Munich, Germany

More about the piece…This story unravels like an hourglass, as flowing sand through Rilke’s fingers. He suffers the pain of loss and the ecstasy of love. In the end he is left with an empty palm, full of words.

Rainer Maria Rilke is widely recognized as one of the most lyrically intense poets and his work is often described as inherently mystical. This deep level of searching begins to touch something that is so innately human it feels as if Rilke is actually writing his words from inside of you.

In his search for solitude, he finds planes of human experience that are collective. This unity through separateness is what inspired “The Stadt Elegies” and the juxtaposition of the individual in the cityscape, searching for connection among a sea of faces.

In order to find a meaningful connection with one another we must first cultivate an intimate relationship with ourselves.

Our Creative Ensemble

Monika Gossmann - Director 

http://monikagossmann.com

Christian Wewerka - Josef (Father) 

http://www.christian-wewerka.de

Andrea Goldman - Salome (Lover) 

http://www.andreagoldmanweb.com

Sara Fay George -Ruth (Child) 

http://www.sarafaygeorge.com

Esther Sophia Artner - Sophie (Mother) 

Angus McGuther - Rainer (Artist)

http://angusmcgruther.com

Dani Campos - Musical Director/Composer

https://danytec.wordpress.com

Claudia “Maneka” Maharaj - Projection Artist

www.manekalights.com

Julia Verena Wewerka - Designer/Performer

https://juliawewerka.wordpress.com

Julie Deffet - Cinematographer

https://juliedeffet.wordpress.com

What We Need & What You Get

We’re raising money to cover the costs of an ensemble of 10 artists who will be traveling with us from Italy to Berlin to Munich. Funding raised will cover transport costs, housing and production expenses.

We have a bunch of great perks, including the ultimate opportunity to share in the creative process and stay with us in residency at the Heller Garden Villa in the Italian Rivera.

Please help support us and be a part of the creation and realization of this work.

Why we need to do this

In our work we constantly strive to explore stories that challenge and expand our personal understanding of humanity as a whole. We are using Rilke’s words as a window to see deeper into ourselves and our relationships. This piece speaks to the primal human experiences of fear, anxiety, and isolation and explores the greater potentiality of Love, Intimacy and Creative Inspiration. These themes that are so viscerally relatable are not bound by gender, culture, tradition or language. They are universal and by bringing together this diverse group of Artists we are able to give voice to a spectrum of perspectives.

We live in an era of isolation but without solitude. We are constantly surrounded by people and devices and yet we remain strangers to ourselves. How then can we know intimacy? If we were to embrace our solitude could we know each other on a deeper level?  

We have been developing work between the United States and Europe since 2010. Our first piece, "La Cueca" premiered at the Solar Gallery and New York Chelsea Art Museum to critical acclaim. We spent time in Berlin developing our second piece "Sometimes at Night" touted by ArtiBerlin as “A true discovery in the Berlin art scene.” We debuted "116" at the New Ohio Theatre in New York in the fall and recently premiered "Wild Horses", an anti-musical with original music by recognized Spanish composer, Dani Campos. This will be our fifth original work and our return to Europe with an incredible ensemble of box collective artists, who we have been working with over the past five years.

Risks & Challenges

This is most ambitious piece we’ve ever undertaken. We have artists coming together from the US, Belgium, Austria, Australia, Spain and Germany to create and perform this work.

It’s our first time traveling with a small child, baby Darth Vader, who has many special needs, but is very supportive in the building of an Empire.

In all seriousness, he’s super high-maintenance, but really this is the next step in the evolution of the box collective working towards our vision of an international ensemble that truly crosses borders both geographically and artistically.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are so grateful for whatever you can contribute to help us realize this ambitious goal, even it if means just sharing our work with your friends and community. Help us to continue charting into the unknown.

Love from the box collective & baby Darth Vader

story:
Endet die Erfolgsstory hier? 

Du hast es in der Hand! Willst du R. Valbo für immer von readmore.de verbannen? Dann greif ins Portmonee! Du bezahlst – und er ist für immer weg. Nicht ein neuer Thread, nicht ein neuer Post. Alles wie früher.

Das Ziel: Goodbye Valbo

Das Preisschild: 250 Euro. Und wenn das Ziel nicht erreicht wird? Dann bleibt R. Valbo dem Trashtalk-Forum erhalten (hurra!). Der Fairness halber wird er dann aber zumindest eine temporäre Auszeit nehmen. Kurz und schmerzlos: 50 Euro pro Woche. 

Erfülle dir deinen großen Traum

Also, worauf wartest du noch? Ein Trashtalk-Forum ohne R. Valbo – ist das nicht das, worauf du schon so lange gewartet hast? Keine Frage, das ist nicht wenig Geld, aber wenn alle an einem Strang ziehen, sollte das doch wohl zu schaffen sein?! Selbst, wenn jeder nur 1-2 Euro überweist! Also, keine Ausreden – los geht's.

story:
We need to manufacture CDs, distribute and promote the release of this really cool album. We've covered everything else!

In between recording & producing projects for myriad other artists, as well as releasing albums with The Wild Truth, Allied Gardens and STLA, I've been writing, performing and recording the songs that comprise my first actual solo release since 2007's Sotto Voce and it's called The Sexy.

This recording features an incredible cast of top-shelf players, like drummers Brian "Nucci" Cantrell, Jake Najor & Bill Ray, bassists Lauren Scheff, John "Big Slim" Anderson and Chris Hale, along with keys by John Foltz, Wolfgang Grasekamp and the previously mentioned Lauren Scheff. There's also bitchen electric guitars by Peter Bolland and wonderful pedal steel from the late, great Doug Meyer. There's horns, too! Tsukasa Takahashi on trumpet, Kirk Chang on trombone and my close friend, the incomparable Ed 'Muggles' Croft on saxophones. Brooke Mackintosh sang like a bird too! In between, I played guitars, plucked Owen Burke's ukeleles, arranged, orchestrated and sang the best I ever have. The result is something I'm obviously very proud of and excited to share with the world!

On behalf of myself and the album's players, I offer humble thanks to you all and hope you will feel not only justified, but rewarded in your investment. Thank you from the bottom of our collective hearts,

Sven-Erik Seaholm

story:
Tank and the Bangas 

Global sound with a New Orleans soul.

WITH YOUR HELP & LOVE, OUR CAMPAIGN WILL COVER EXPENSES & PROFESSIONAL CREW NEEDED TO BRING OUR MUSIC VIDEO TO LIFE!

Recently Awarded Offbeat Magazine's 'Best Emerging Artist' award, Tank and The Bangas began in 2011 at an open mic set in New Orleans.   The band officially formed in their future practice space, centered around Jerk Chicken Sam’iches and a drum set, at an Aunt's shotgun house.  Instantaneously, Tank and the Bangas knew they had a sound and blend of musical style all their own, one that evolved with Tank's poetically rocking lyrics.  Rummaging through their sound like a thrift store hippie, you’ll find the Bangas music references everything from Rhythmic Soul to Rock, R&B, Gospel and funk.  

IT'S THE FANS. 

Tank and the Bangas' fans gave so much love calling for more original material,      urging Tank to release her first album, Think Tank.  

Fans have supported the band everywhere: from local neighborhood bars to the New Orleans Jazz Festival, where the band played to an amazing world audience!

JOIN IN TO EXPAND OUR FAN FAMILY & BRING TANK'S FIRST PROFESSIONAL VIDEO TO THE WORLD!


LONDON'S CALLING.

RHYTHM OF LIFE is fast paced and so is our campaign! 

Tank and the Bangas travel on a self-funded tour to play London this summer!
Our talented film crew wants to send the band off to England knowing our collective creativity is shot, wrapped and 'in the can.' 

Filming happens the 2nd weekend of June, which means we are bangin' HARD right now to raise funds by the end of May so that we can shoot before the band travels.

We plan to edit and release the video while the band is in England - where they plan to exclusively eat Bangas and mash!

Our producers are targeting MTV Europe and other partnerships so that your funded video can reach other Bangas all over the world by the fall!

Any funds raised will go toward filming Rhythm of Life even if our goal isn't met - but the Cosmos just ain't gonna play that way! 

Our friends are professional local film crew, who are reaching out to their own sponsors and friendships for support.  We guarantee that great things get done when we help turn each other's dreams into reality!

THE “RHYTHM OF LIFE” MUSIC VIDEO TEAM INCLUDES:

DIRECTOR: MARISA CREED

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY: ADAM LIPSCOMB

C0-PRODUCER: LEXXI BROUSSARD   CO-PRODUCER: ROSE BEALE

PERKS and the Bangas 

Rhythm of Life is all about the fun & fun is all about the perks!
Music buff, film fan, out of state friends, and local Bangas:  These Perks are for you.

* Be VIP at a show, get a shout out on stage & hang all night with the Bangas!

* Watch your funding magic in Action!

-In Nola:  Grab a skinny soy latte, your best Spielberg director's hat and hang out on set the last day of shoot!  Stay for the wrap party and rock the rhythm with us!

-Out of State?  It's 2015, baby! Your assistant is on our set to Skype or Facetime you so you can see the shoot in action & say hi to cast and crew!

Also, Tank has special gifts for y'all! Custom perks made just for you. If she could, Tank would take every fan out for waffles...that's from her heart.


MONEY CAN'T BUY YOU LOVE

ALL SUPPORT IS A BLESSING!!!!  WE NEED YOU!  SHARING IS CARING.
Bangas Unite!  If you're currently in perks anonymous and can't contribute to the fund, we need you even more! 

Help us get the word out using IndieGogo's sharing tools & through your own fabulous friends! #believeinyourmagic  BECOME A BELIEVER.  Post You, Your Perks & Dreams!
NOLA resident?  Please come to a show so we can meet, dance & be Bangas together.   Much Love, Tank and the Bangas

story:
(Turkçe video için ’galeriye’ bakiniz)

(Scroll down for English)


KISACA FESTİVAL HAKKINDA...

Bizler, müziğin ve özellikle de klasik müziğin gücüne inanmış; onun toplumları birleştiren, kültürleri birbirine kaynaştıran bir ortak dünya dili olduğunu savunan bir grup gönüllü olarak 2004 yılında yalın, basit bir piyano festivali ile yola çıktık. Gümüşlük’ü mekan tuttuk, festivalimiz ilk yılından itibaren çok sevildi. Daha ikinci yılında uluslararası bir klasik müzik festivaline dönüştük. Üçüncü yılımızda yaz müzik okulumuzla, festival akademimizi hayata geçirdik. Bu yaz 12. yılımızda dünyanın en önde gelen sanatçı, quartet ve orkestralarını ağırlamaya hazırlanıyoruz. Gümüşlük Festival Akademisinde 4 ayrı disiplinde masterclasslar düzenleyeceğiz ve öğrencilerimize sertifika vereceğiz. Ayrıca Ahmed Adnan Saygun Piyano Yarışmamızın da üçüncüsünü düzenleyeceğiz.

Bütçemize destek verin!
Tüm bunları yapmak sadece fiziksel güç, inat ve imanla olmuyor. Festivalimizin bu yıl ihtiyaç duyduğu bütçe 580.000 TL’dir. Bütçedeki başlıca kalemler şunlardır; Sanatçı kaşeleri, sanatçı transfer ve konaklama giderleri, mekan kiraları, festival ekip ve personel giderleri,  tanıtım ve promosyon giderleri, teknik (ses, ışık) giderler ve daha birçok kalem… Lütfen IndieGoGo paylaşım araçlarını kullanarak kampanyamızın duyulmasında bize yardımcı olun

Destek kategorileri
Kampanyamızda iki ayrı kategoride destekçi belirlemek durumunda kaldık. Bunlardan ilki festivale coğrafi açıdan uzak olan ancak yaptıklarımızı takdir eden kişilerin bize sunacakları maddi destekler. Diğeri ise festivale yıllardır katılan ve festivali zaten önceden de desteklemiş ya da gelecek dönemlerde desteklemek isteyen müzikseverler. Biz kendilerine önceden de “Festival Dostları” diyor ve yaptıkları maddi destekler ölçüsünde sınıflandırıp, o ölçüde hediye ve avantajlarla teşekkürlerimizi sunuyorduk.
- Sayfanın sağındaki "DESTEKÇİ" başlıklı kutucuklarda; festivale katılamayacak klasik müzikseverler için 10$, 50$,100$ ve 200$’lık seçenekler ve avantajlar sunduk.
- Ve yine sayfanın sağında "FESTİVAL DOSTU" başlıklı kutucuklarda; bizi takip eden ya da takip edecek festival dostları için farklı maddi destek seçenekleri ve avantajlar sunduk.

Festival Dostlarına katılın!
Festival Dostlarına katılmakla Festivalin en önemli yan organizasyonuna üye olursunuz. Festivalin sürdürülebilirliğine ve eğitim programlarımızın gerçekleşmesine katkı sağlamış olursunuz.
Festival Dostları, festivalin son derece saygıdeğer ve önemli bir unsurudur. 2015 Gümüşlük Festivali sizi Festival Dostları üyesi olmaya ve Gümüşlük Festival Ailesini yaratma ve yaşatmasında köklü bir rol oynamaya davet ediyor. Seçeceğiniz kategoriler ve elde edeceğiniz avantajlar sayfanın sağında ilginize sunulmuştur. 

 

                      ?



****************************************************************************

A SHORT WORD ABOUT THE FESTIVAL...

The festival began in 2004 with a group of volunteers as a series of 5 piano recitals. In our second year, we became the Gumusluk International Classical Music Festival. By year three, we had added a summer school to the program of events. This summer, the festival program includes an outstanding program of the worlds greatest artists, quartets and orchestras. The Gumusluk Festival Academy, which has attendance of over 600 students since 2006 turns 10 this year. This year, the GFA will open masterclasses in flute, piano, voice and violin.  Young students from all over the world are also invited this year to participate in the 3rd Ahmed Adnan Saygun Piano competition. 


Help us finance the festival !

It takes a whole lot of hard work, conviction and determination to keep the festival going each year. However, this is not enough!  The festival needs a budget of 580.000 TL this year to cover all expenses. Expenses are categorized as follows: Artist fees, Artist travel and Accommodation expenses, Venue rentals, Festival staff and Festival team salaries, Promotion and Advertising expenses, Technical expenses ( Sound and Lighting), Monetary awards for piano competition and much more... Please, use the share button and help us spread the word to get the financial help we need.



Support Categories

We have separated our supporters into two categories. 

The first is for those who like us, want to support us but are far away from the festival and cannot attend the festival program of events.

 The other category is for supporters who know and attend the festival, and have either been a supporter in the past or would like to become a supporter. These supporters are our "Festival Friends" and are awarded advantages and perks in relation to the amount that they donate to the festival. 

- To the right of the page you will see our "COMPANION" categories. For those music lovers who are too far away to attend, but want to help, you may support us by donating 10$, 50$, 100$ and 200$ for which you will receive various advantages and festival- related presents.

- To the right of the page, you will also see our "FRIENDS" support categories. This is for followers of the festival, who will receive perks within the festival time according to their donation. 


Become a Festival Friend !


By becoming a festival friend, you are becoming a member of the most important driving forces behind the festival and its educational programs' continuity. 

Our festival friends are our biggest and most treasured motivation.

The 2015 Gümüşlük festival invites you to becoming a member of its family, and in doing so playing an integral role in the success and continuation of the festival.  The advantages you will receive upon becoming a member are listed in the relevant boxes to the right.

story:
About Me

Hi! My name is Elizabeth (a.k.a. Beth) and Welcome to my fundraiser sight! I'm so excited to tell you about a wonderful opportunity that's come into my life, but before we get into that, here are some tidbits about me and my music career. So get comfy, sip some coffee, and read on!
  • I'm a young artist trying to further my development as a classical singer. I'm currently pursuing my Masters in Vocal Pedagogy and Voice Performance at Westminster Choir College. 
  • In my undergraduate education, I won multiple awards for vocal excellence as well as parts in Opera scenes and musicals. After graduation, my college hired me to perform as a soloist for fine arts events.
  • I've been awarded scholarships for both my undergraduate and graduate educations.
  • I'm a part-time music teacher at JoiStar Studio as well as a small Christian school. I'm also a church music director.
  • I've been consistently involved in community and church music events since grade school and have sung all over the east coast as a member of a music ministry team and a school choir.
  • I've performed and participated in music concerts/training programs in Asia, South America, and Europe.
  • Most recently, I performed a graduate recital at Westminster Choir College. (here's a link to one of the pieces I sang https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mIAZnJWAfFI)

My Campaign

Over the winter, I won an audition for a Young Artist Program with Land of Enchantment Opera. http://landofenchantmentopera.com 
This summer, LEO is putting on a production of Le nozze di Figaro and I will be singing the role of Susanna.  http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/366268/The-Marriage-of-Figaro

Along with this Opera, I will also be singing opera scenes, solos, and sacred pieces. 

This is an enormous opportunity, and I'm asking you to help make this program accessible through your monetary support. Your contributions will give this struggling artist much need assistance, and I will be inordinately grateful for your generosity. 

What I Need 

LEO's young artist program lasts for five weeks which means I have housing, training, and travel costs. (If you've flown lately, you know the pocket-book pain!) 

Below is a letter from the Director of LEO which explains more about the program and its costs.

Dear Friends,                                                                                                             The arts today are more important than ever. As we see their support weaken in this economy, it is imperative for emerging artists like Elizabeth to have help as they begin their careers. In 2010, the Land of Enchantment Opera Institute, a non-profit organization in arts education, was established through a collaboration between our artistic directors and accomplished opera singers Peter and Linda Strummer and their friends Jason Winfield and Patrick Mason.                                     
The Land of Enchantment Opera Institute was founded in order to refine the talents of gifted young singers looking to hone their skills in a pre-professional environment. This five week training program consists of daily lessons and coachings for each student, as well as master classes with an all-star faculty. Additionally, students will sing in many public concerts, including scenes performances, the yearly donors’ dinner, and other events scheduled throughout the program. In addition to the exceptional training, our students are serve a unique purpose as one of the artistic pillars in the Gallup community due to our proximity to the Navajo Nation and our affiliations with the Gallup Cultural Center. 
Our program offers training that helps our young singers bridge the gap between their conservatory or university education and the demands of young artist and professional opera work. Our singers have gone on to perform in some of the most famous venues both in America and abroad. Distinguished alumni include baritone Nathan Myers of Deutsche Oper Berlin and bass-baritone Jeremy Milner of San Francisco Opera and Philadelphia Opera. Elizabeth was selected from among a very large pool of candidates to attend this summer’s institute. It is clear that Elizabeth has the potential to grow and evolve as an artist. 
We strive to keep ours tuition among the lowest, however, a struggling artist cannot often afford these programs without some help. I would like to ask you to consider helping Elizabeth with a gift that would aide in her participation. Your donations will be used for that artist’s tuition, which is $3,200.00. You will be developing a relationship with a young artist that will last a lifetime.                                                                              With thanks for your consideration,                                                              Peter Strummer                                                                                                Artistic Director 


What You Get

    To show my appreciate for your support, I have some fun little perks for donations....and someday when I'm famous *wink wink* they'll probably be worth lots of money....or not really....but still, they're pretty cool.

  • $20 donations: A track from my To Be Recorded Audition CD coming Fall 2015.
  • $50 donations: ALL the tracks from my TBR Audition CD.
  • $100 donations: One free half-hour voice lesson with yours truly.
  • $200 donations: TBR Audition CD and a super hip "Team Susanna" T-shirt.
Even if you cannot contribute monetarily, PLEASE take a moment to write me a little note of encouragement in the comment section. This is a huge undertaking for me. Your kind words will be a priceless boost to my morale. Knowing friends far and near are rooting for me will help keep me strong...even when I'm really missing my husband, cat, and turtles. So please send me your love and prayers. I need 'em!

Spread the Word

Feel free to share my campaign with others. The more the merrier! Indiegogo has a cool and convenient share button thingy. Give it a click.

I cannot wait to take on this adventure with you all! 

Thank you for stopping by! 

Sincerely,                                                                                                                                                   Beth

story:
SHORT SUMMARY:

I want to be an Opera Star. I'm currently a college student at Valdosta State University in Georgia. I'm pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Music and a French minor and I will be graduating in Spring 2016. I plan to pursue a Masters in Performance and pretty much take my act on the road. That means participating in summer programs, masterclasses, competitions, and a bunch of other things that will help me reach my goal.

I've already got accepted into a summer program in Indiana and even received a scholarship but it's not enough. By the way, did I mention I have a beautiful baby girl. Opera is expensive and I need your help to make my dreams come true and become successful. It takes a village to raise a child and I believe it takes a village to make an Opera Star. Please help us and fund me today.


** The shipping address section for the perks is only for those who want to claim their perks and have the materials mailed to them. Remember all of my perks are exclusive to this campaign. The CD, the contribution section, the tickets to Opera events, and Valdosta Symphony Orchestra events are all for the 2015-2016 season. But don't fret, perhaps in the future I can make more CDs in graduate school and get opera or orchestra tickets from my school. With your help our opportunities are endless.


THE IMPACT:

By taking part and investing in me, you yourself are taking charge and personally putting a hand in changing my little girl's and my life. You are putting your faith in me to practice, work, and do everything I need to do to be successful. Every time I've practiced and pushed myself to be better in the past I've had my little girl on my mind and now I will have all of you. It's not a responsibility I take lightly.

All of that being said, I promise you won't regret this and I will not settle for "average" or "good enough", and I won't take any short cuts because at the end of the day it's not just me anymore; it's about all of us.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Not everybody has the funds or opportunity to help me financially and trust me when I say I COMPLETELY understand. However, that doesn't mean you can't support and back this project. The biggest way you can support this project other than investing is by spreading the word. Networking and making connections is the next best thing I need to be successful. I only know so many people but with your help I can get help from so many more. Tell your friends and family and please let them know what I plan to do. With all the social networking and media we have access to, you can post the link to this page and help me reach places that I could never do alone.


*NOTE: Any funds that exceed my goal will be used as tuition money for graduate school, competitions, and any other beneficial opportunities to further advance me in my career.

story:
"Journey of a GemInEye:" 

My full length album, "Journey of a GemInEye," has been a long time coming. For those of you who have been supporting my music since "Light Shines Through Me," you know that this has been a long journey to get this project done. I've been recording for the last three years and working on getting everything in place, but I realized it might be another three years before I can get it off the ground...without your help. And since I've learned that if you never ask, the answer's always no, I'm asking for your faith, support, and whatever you can spare to help turn the next phase of my dream into a reality! 

What I Need & What You Get

If the project's almost done, why do I need your help? Let me explain:

  • The music and lyrics are almost entirely done, but I still have to pay for certain copyright and productions costs, which add up very quickly. 
  • As an investor in my dream (aka a GEM), you'll receive a perk for every contribution made! Whether you donate a dollar or a hundred, I've got perks for everyone that believes in my dream! 
  • In the event that I'm unable to reach my set goal, ALL of the money will STILL be used to complete the project; that may mean fewer songs, etc., but it will be released no matter what. With YOUR help, I can release it as I've always intended since I began on this journey! 

The Impact

  • Music is one of the only real things that brings people connect; with your contribution, you'll help bring people together through music! 
  • You will help turn another phase of my dream into reality, further proving that dreams do come true! 
  • You will help inspire others that people still truly believe in music and support  exists for those with dreams in their heart! 

Risks & Challenges

  • I've gone as far as living out of my car to complete my first project, "Light Shines Through Me," and I know what it means to sacrifice to make it happen by any means necessary. There is NO risk involved in investing in this project; only reward! 
  • Though no plan is foolproof, the amount I've estimated for this campaign has anticipated some possible challenges that I faced during my original project so that I don't have to move back into my car...good news! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you don't have a dollar to spare, please lend me your voice...and your social media! ;) Please do me the next best thing, which is sharing the campaign with others to help spread the word! 
  • Indiegogo has built in share tools, which make it easy to make some noise about "Journey of a GemInEye!" 

Ready for the next step! Here goes everything. And the journey continues...
story_txt:
"Journey of a GemInEye:"  My full length album, "Journey of a GemInEye," has been a long time coming. For those of you who have been supporting my music since "Light Shines Through Me," you know that this has been a long journey to get this project done. I've been recording for the last three years and working on getting everything in place, but I realized it might be another three years before I can get it off the ground...without your help. And since I've learned that if you never ask, the answer's always no, I'm asking for your faith, support, and whatever you can spare to help turn the next phase of my dream into a reality!    What I Need & What You Get
