story:
My name is Jordan Whitney. I serve as the drummer for the small garage band Nitrous. The other members of the band are Heather Hetzel (singer), Trey Quinn (guitarist), Jonah Smith (guitarist), and Patrick Ross (bass). We are all a bunch of high school friends who got together for fun and just started playing music. Over time we started to learn popular rock songs and taking lessons and realized that we could actually make money and produce music for other's entertainment. We have written a few of our own songs and have been spending a lot of our own time and money on equipment that we need to keep playing music.

We are running into tough situations, though. We no longer have a space to play music, we are spending more money on equipment than we really have to spend, and there are still lots of "things" we need to get organized before we can release any music and tour the local area to get our names out there. Because of these problems, our band is facing the threat of falling apart.

We need money for equipment, really. our goal is to get recording equipment and record in our own place, a home recording studio really. We need microphones for the drums, we need an audio interface, and we need monitors so we can hear what we are playing. Those are just the most basic of our needs. In reality we still need a new mixer, some new heads for the drums, an amplifier, and a few other tools for playing, but those will come as a bonus if we raise more funds than what our goal is.

We really need your help to get on our feet. Once we have the last few bits of eqipment we need we are going to record three original songs as well as a few covers and send them out to record companies and put our original songs on itunes so that people can hear us. As we progress and make money we are going to record more songs and tour around and hopefully get somewhere making music.

story:
The Fanflo app, takes live music to the next level .

The Fanflo app makes every show an amazing live experience.

*Developers: Fanflo is based on an an open platform that will change live music. Our platform will be adapted for use in education, public speaking, theater, and sports!

For fans:
  • Interact with the band
  • Interact with fans
  • Share pics and  video in real time
  • Control how you hear the music
  • Sing along with the band  and be heard through the speakers.
  • Download live performances  as they happen. ..even add yourself to the mix.
And much more

For artists :
  • Engage your audience
  • Increase audience participation
  • Gain new streams of revenue - make more money
  • New data streams for marketing
  • Know your audience's likes and  dislikes
  • Grow bigger loyal fan base
  • Take the stress out of touring...ok, some of the stress

Please view the video!

Origin of Fanflo
I bought a ticket to experience the amazing prototype of Fanflo more than two decades ago. It was long before I ever saw a smartphone, a stream was a place to catch frogs, and my father had told me to never touch a screen... Ever! I was a fourteen year old kid. I convinced my loving mother that I was man enough to go to the event by myself. She convinced me that I was man enough to pay for it. So, a few days later, I found myself at the box office counting dollars, silver coins, and then pennies to pay for the very last ticket. I actually ended up borrowing 8 cents from the cashier, but I was happy I made it. I love great live music. Years later, I was a mild­mannered music manager/producer by day, custom computer­building /repair business owner at night (and day). I loved the music. I loved building custom computers for home, music studios, and other businesses. Unfortunately, both the music industry and the desktop computer industry were being squeezed to near death by the exploding mobile device industry and the glut of free music downloads. The tide was coming. Lots of people were being drowned. I decided to build a boat. I knew there must be ways to innovate so that tide of mobile technology could be used to take music higher rather than take it under. I brainstormed nightly. On one of those nights, I was pacing through my pitch dark living room when that experience from decades before popped into my head. It was live music transformed into an interactive experience that engaged and enthralled the audience like nothing I have ever seen. That experience was a Bobby Mcferrin one man live performance..... More like a two thousand and one man performance because Bobby put us all in the show. We were singing background parts with him on stage, harmonizing in our seats, even deciding which songs he performed. We all felt like stars. I paced the floor of that living room for several months more. I dreamed up the the ultimate interactive live music experience. I spent countless hours imagining features. I went to shows and imagined how amazing they could be. I added, subtracted, and refined features and processes until I had the most amazing product I could imagine and made it as simple as possible. It took a couple years for technology to catch up. In that time, I had built a team of rockstars who are passionate about this idea and they made it even better. Their innovation turns live music into an interactive experience that engages and enthralls

story:
~Aloha~

Thank you so much for checking out my fundraiser!

Music is a powerful and sacred tool to create change, peace and healing in this world and in ourselves. I know that we can alter our surroundings with the gravity of our collective, benevolent intentions~ which is why I create the music I do.

The purpose of this fundraiser is threefold: 

First: I am raising money to complete and print my third, full-length CD,  "Pool of Love."  I hope these songs nourish you as much as they've nourished me! 10 new originals... (Hear part of two new songs in the video, at the beginning and end).

Second: To reprint my first CD, "Roses,"  which has sold its first 1000 physical copies, worldwide. You can hear songs from this CD at: http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/AlexaSunshineRose

And Third: To purchase the minimal, high-quality recording equipment I need to be able to record my own music anywhere and eventually, to offer my sound engineering and production services to other sound artists. 

**There are many ways to help out!** 

Please, share this campaign on social media sites and leave a comment in the comments section of this campaign (which helps its ratings on Indiegogo).  

Please, check out the sweet perks & donation incentives offered over here --->                 -------------->>    ------------------>>       ------------------->>

Visit my website: www.alexasunshinerose.com/music

Online store/listen: http://www.cdbaby.com/Artist/AlexaSunshineRose

...And see the details of my projects below!  <3


1. A New CD, "Pool of Love" (Working Title)~

I am pleased to announce that my third CD is just around the corner!

For the past three years, I have been recording the new songs I receive. I have spent many hours in studios (and also recording on my iPhone!) to get the sounds I want. Many of the songs on this CD were received a cappella, because I am often so busy with my children that I don't find the time to pick up my guitar.  :)

This CD is a musical tool belt, with song tools for your personalized use. These are songs to sing to yourself in moments when you need to anchor into the Good Reality, to affirm the life you wish to inhabit. These are songs for singing in groups, with friends, children, the elderly. These are songs with a purpose!

Expect juicy collaborations with sacred sound artists Murray Kyle, Sara Tone and more...

Now, with 10 songs recorded and ready to receive their final instrumental and/or harmonic layers, I am reaching out for your support to see this third CD through to the print. ~ I estimate it will take $3,500 to complete and print this CD. ~

2. Reprinting my "Roses" CD~

"Roses" was released in 2009 and was my first, full-length CD. These were my favorites of the first wave of songs I received and developed, from 2006-2009. There is a potent beauty to this first-born creation.

I receive letters from people all over the world about how this album has affected them in profoundly positive ways, has helped them through particular difficulties, or has become a family favorite in the car. The first 1000 physical copies have flown out into the world and I would love to see this CD back in stock, ready to spread more sonic love! :)

~Reprinting "Roses" will cost about $1,800.~

3. Recording Equipment and Sound Engineering~

I am very excited to step into the next phase of my creative works with music. I have learned a lot about recording and sound engineering over the process of creating my CDs and now I am ready to buy some basic, but high-quality, equipment that will enable me to record my own music in my home or on the road. This will make it much easier for me to share my music, without the often prohibitive costs of recording in a studio.

Eventually, I look forward to supporting other musicians in the process of recording their songs and creating high-quality, beautiful CDs of conscious music to bless our world community with more inspiring sounds. Rising up together... Sharing our Gifts with the world.... Sounds great to me! 

With the professional guidance of my dear friend/Sound Engineer, I have made a list of the items I would like to purchase. The total for these comes to around $3,500.

The Timeline...

I am really hoping to finish and print this CD by this summer. That said, life amongst the swirl of raising three young children often takes unexpected twists and turns. So... When I meet my funding goal, my commitment to you is this:

I will complete this CD and publish it, reprint Roses and obtain recording equipment by 12/2015. 

Any funds I make above and beyond my goal amount will be used to empower these musical endeavors happening in a beautiful, timely way. (Above and beyond, my next goal is to create a CD of conscious children's music.)

If I don't meet my funding goal, I will prioritize my new CD, then reprinting Roses, then getting the gear. 

Gracias!!

THANK YOU  so much for using your energy and currency to empower my offering to the world.

Your support means so much to me. May all that you give return to you 1000-fold! <3

Amen!

                 ~Aloha Dear Ones~

story:
Dear all,

My name is Catarina Ferreira, I am a cellist from Portugal, currently finishing a Masters degree in cello performance at the Peabody Institute of the Johns Hopkins University. 

One of the things I love to do most in my life is to play the cello. And I feel like now is a good time for me to record an album for all my fans, friends and family to enjoy any time they want.

When I have a concert many people ask me for a music CD, and unfortunately it saddens me to say I have not recorded one. This is why I need your help to carry out this project; it is not just a gift to me, but to all the people that want to listen to me playing.

There is nothing more rewarding for an artist than being appreciated by his/her audience, and it is a shame to leave beautiful chords and melodies within the confines of a concert hall.

With your help, I will be able to make this important step in my career, as well as achieving one of my life dreams.

So I really hope you can contribute to my project! Learn more about me from my website: www.catarinaferreira.net


Breakdown of expenses:

The funds requested will be used for recording and mastering a CD:

  • $500 - Studio Recording
  • $500 - Mastering
  • $250 - Album artwork and copy production

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share my campaign with all your friends on twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn and any other social media website you are on.
  • Verbally tell your friends, family and colleagues about this campaign.
  • Participate: Are you a creative person looking for your next project? I am looking for artwork for the album cover art, as well as help creating some pictures and videos. 
  • Feel free to contact me for more details.

Thank you so much for visiting, and please consider helping or donating however you can. Any contribution would be very much appreciated!

story:
Skalator

Born in Lisbon, Skalator is a music producer and DJ. My interest for music grew on me since I was a kid, largely influenced by the collection of vinyl from my parents.

Names like Jazzanova, Trüby Trio, Fabio & Grooverider, LTJ Bukem, Calibre, Gilles Peterson, Thievery Corporation, Kruder & Dorfmeister, Sofa Surfers and Omni Trio represent my main musical references.

This campaign was created for you to support this fundraising project by making a donation towards the production costs of my first release on vinyl.

Your contribution to this project is most helpful as it will make it easier for this dream to become a reality.

The core concept of this record is to provide a sonic journey to the listener, with special focus on the soundscape and the groove.

Basically, I´m aiming to raise 800 US Dollars, this is how much it costs to produce the whole thing. Includes vinyl mastering, manufacturing 300 copies with full artwork and distribution to major record shops worldwide.

Read on the side of this page about the perks by making your contribution!
They include:
- Your own copy of "Jungle Train / Gadget Heads" vinyl delivered to your door
- Vouchers to download the 2 tracks featured in this release (WAV format)
- "Once Upon A Dub Tale" and "Rising Beyond" EPs by Skalator
- Skalator Music Badges

Should the amount that I want to raise not be reached within the campaign time frame, the existing funds will be used for the same purpose with my together with my personal contribution.
Over the last 10 years, physical music sales have declined drastically, where the industry reports that the number of CD´s sold worldwide reaching an all time low since its inception in the mid 80´s.
Vinyl instead, had its bad days on sales´ numbers up until 2002 when surprisingly (or not), sales figures started increasing again, mostly due to the fact that bands started realizing that everything was going digital, so they dropped CD´s, released on digital format BUT ALSO ON VINYL thus not leaving aside the real music lovers...

I strongly believe that releasing my music both in MP3 and Vinyl is the best format for me as a music producer and DJ.
You can listen to my music released on digital format here:
https://skalatormusic.bandcamp.com/

I will do my best to achieve the amount set for this crowdfunding and I hope to count with your contribution!

Don´t forget to spread the word and share this crowdfunding campaign with your friends and your family!

Thank you all for your support!
Skalator

Over the last 10 years, physical music sales have declined drastically, where the industry reports that the number of CD´s sold worldwide reaching an all time low since its inception in the mid 80´s.Vinyl instead, had its bad days on sales´ numbers up until 2002 when surprisingly (or not), sales figures started increasing again, mostly due to the fact that bands started realizing that everything was going digital, so they dropped CD´s, released on digital format BUT ALSO ON VINYL thus not leaving aside the real music lovers...I strongly believe that releasing my music both in MP3 and Vinyl is the best format for me as a music producer and DJ.You can listen to my music released on digital format here:https://skalatormusic.bandcamp.com/I will do my best to achieve the amount set for this crowdfunding and I hope to count with your contribution!Don´t forget to spread the word and share this crowdfunding campaign with your friends and your family!Thank you all for your support!Skalator

story:
A Short Summary

Hi, my name is Takako! I am a Japanese pianist currently working towards a doctoral degree in piano performance at University of Miami's Frost School of Music. This summer is my very last chance to be a student and participate in music festivals and competitions before launching myself into the cutthroat job market. 

I have been recommended and accepted to attend PIANALE, an international piano competition and institution where I will be given performance opportunities and have masterclasses/lessons with an international roster of acclaimed professors. In addition to the competition, I want to take this opportunity to broaden my network by meeting and playing for the diverse population of musicians at the festival in preparation for my life after school.

If I win the top prize, which is what I am practicing tirelessly for, I could be offered additional concert engagements in Germany, Spain, and the UK - including an appearance as a soloist with a symphony.

I was also accepted to play for the renowned Japanese pianist, educator, and juror, Akiko Ebi. She is held in very high regard throughout the international musical community and it would be truly valuable for my career advancement if she recognizes my talent.

The Challenge

Everything sounds wonderful except for the one thing that is holding me back from my dream to play in Europe, which is why I am calling for help through this funding page. I unfortunately cannot empty my available funds to travel and study in Germany, nor can I ask my mother for assistance as she has been surviving minimally on her own after my father passed away.

To make this project a reality, I need assistance in covering these main fees:

  • Airfare - $1300
  • Tuition & Room and Board - $2000

Every penny would help me approach my life goals and I truly appreciate your time for reading this page. I want to sincerely thank you for being a part of my endeavor! I would also be grateful if you could share this funding campaign with anyone who may be willing to contribute.

____________________________________________________________________________

A little more about me in detail :D

Takako Tokuda has been known to “work magic at the keyboard, playing with sensitivity, dramatic power and elegance,” as most recently written by South Florida Classical Reviews. She began playing the piano in Japan at 4 years old and since then won many prizes in competitions from the age of 6.  These events include the Chopin International Competition in Asia, the PTNA Piano Competition, the JPTA Piano Audition and the AOCC Piano Competition in Japan. She has performed on concert tours in the Czech Republic and Austria as a selected student of the Sapporo Conservatoire in 2002 and was featured in special concerts in Vienna and Prague when she was 14. She was a finalist in the Chautauqua International Piano Competition in 2007, 2008, and 2010 and Margaret A. Guthman Keyboard Competition in 2007.  As the 1st place winner of the Concerto Competition at the Cincinnati Conservatory, she performed the Piano Concerto No.1 in E-minor by Chopin with the University of Cincinnati Orchestra in 2009. In 2014, she was awarded the gold medal as the first prizewinner of the International Keyboard and Odyssiad Festival (IKOF) Competition in 2014. This year in July, she is invited to return as a guest artist and juror of the IKOF.

As an active performer, Takako has been appeared to number of solo and chamber recitals with singers, string, and woodwind players. She has performed in Asia, Europe besides many states in the United States.

Takako has studied with Noriyuki Miyazawa and Yoko Miyazawa in Japan, Fr. Sean Duggan and Judith Burganger in the US, as well as Rebecca Penneys and Frank Heneghan during summers. She has received her BM from University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music where she received numerous scholarships and MA from Florida Atlantic University where she held a Graduate Assistantship. Currently, she is a DMA student at University of Miami Frost School of Music, where she holds a Graduate Assistantship in opera and vocal accompaniment.

story:
Hi, we are Will and Bobby Mos. from the Mos. Bros. Twins originally from North Carolina and now reside in Nashville, TN. We are an award winning rock/folk duo and currently preparing for our 2015 Radio and Concert Tour. We took a step back after being disillusioned by the mainstream music wringer, and refocused our energy into making music more authentic to us. We just put out our EP this past March, entitled "Three," which has received radio play all over the US, UK, France and Canada. We will be touring in support of the EP as well as participating in and supporting several charity events along the way. www.reverbnation.com/mosbros, www.facebook.com/mosbrosmusic, twitter@mosbrosmusic.

Our current needs our:

Music equipment (amps and sound)

Travel expenses (food, lodging, gas,rental car)

Merchandise (posters, download cards, shirts)

Recording (summer single 'Hold the Sky')

Risks & Challenges - Since we will be living on the road, there will be many risks and challenges. With your donations, we will be able to overcome those challenges! Car troubles, gas, places to sleep, food and anything else that keeps a person going! Many of our fans and friends have requested us to come to their city, play and hang out. We would love to see each and everyone of you but we can not without your donations. We appreciate your kindness and your help does not go unnoticed...

Other Ways You Can Help -We understand that not everyone can donate but please help spread the word. The more people that know about what we are trying to accomplish, the better. Please share our page and help make some noise about our campaign :)




Current Radio and Concert Dates

- 6/5/15 Concert Window Fan Appreciation Show - Nashville, TN

- 6/21/15 SW1 Radio DJ Angelika Miller (Interview and Live performance) - London, UK.

-6/23/15 Beyond The Stage

-6/26/15 The Irish Ginger Show (W4CY.Com) - Brussels, Belgium

-7/1/15 Swoopsworld (swoopsworld.com) - Long Beach, Ca.

-7/2/15 Daddy Mur Show (W4CY.com)

-7/12/15 The David Bowers Show - Laughlin,Nevada

-7/15/15 The City Tap - Pittsboro, NC

-7/16/15 Pittsboro Roadhouse (Tokyo Rosenthal Radio Show) - Pittsboro, NC

-7/19/15 Second Wind - Carrboro, NC

-7/20/15 The Station - Carrboro, NC

-7/25/15 Night and Day Farm (Nashville's Rock and Rythm Fest) - Nashville, TN

-8/3/15 Eddie's Attic - Decatur, GA

-8/5/15 Abbot's Bar and Grille - Duluth, GA

Dates are still coming in and will be added.

story:
Short Summary + A Little About Me

  • I'm a comedian/musician from Durham, NC.
  • I've been a finalist in the Comedy category of the International Songwriting Competition for the past two years.  I think these songs are the funniest yet and can't wait to share them with you.
  • I host the Homoground Queer & Allied Open Mic along with Laila Nur, where we provide a platform for other marginalized artistic folks in the South.
  • I've self-funded all of my musical projects to this point (4 albums and 3 videos total), but recently left my day job to perform full-time.  I'm asking your help to print 1000 copies of Vageezus: Voice of A Gynaration, with a stretch goal of helping offset the costs of making a music video for one of the tracks, "Sweatsuit Swag."
You can hear some of the tracks here:
"Baby Got Bush"
https://purdyholsom.bandcamp.com/track/baby-got-bush
"Sweatsuit Swag"
https://purdyholsom.bandcamp.com/track/sweatsuit-swag
"It All Went Wrong (When I Pooped My Thong)"
https://purdyholsom.bandcamp.com/track/it-all-went-wrong-when-i-pooped-my-thong
"Gay Money"
http://purdyholsom.bandcamp.com/track/gay-money

What I Need & What You Get

  • I want to print 1000 eco wallet CD copies of Vageezus: Voice of A Gynaration  through Bison Disc for $899, plus $104 shipping = $1003 total. 
  • If I don't meet that goal, I'll get 500 eco wallet CDs for $599, plus $68 shipping = $667 total. Or less--I'll do as much as I can with what I'm given. :)
  • Selling these at shows helps me re-coup expenses and record more sick tunes. I use Bison Disc because they make great CDs, are affordable and are a woman-owned, small business in the South. 
  • Stretch Goals: I've been in talks with a local film student in Berlin about shooting "Sweatsuit Swag" for 350€, including the acting/editing (200€), videographer (50€), and two dancers (100€). YouTube videos weigh heavily in today's entertainment industry, and this one, which is about street harassment, could be the do-gooder viral sensation that lets you say, "Hey, I was a part of that!"

The Impact

  • This album will make you laugh. It will make you dance. Westboro Baptist Church will hate it, but you and your friends will love it.  
  • Although it's a comedy album, it touches on real issues like LGBT rights, breast self-exams, street harassment, body image, incontinence and dubstep. So yeah. World peace and pants-pissin'.
  • I've nearly sold out of my debut album, Purdy Holsom, and the last video I did ("Ladies Don't Crap") got over 2,000 views in the first month. I hope to take things to the next level with Vageezus: Voice of a Gynaration.

Risks & Challenges

  • If I'm not able to raise the money to print albums, I'll have to make them myself with Dollar General CDs and a Sharpie. While there's a certain DIY charm in that, I hope to create something a little more credible. 
  • I've always tried to support other artists so they can continue to put great things into the world.  So I'm trusting karma will come back on this one. 
  • $1000 isn't a lot in the scheme of things. We can do this, y'all!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help spread the word about my campaign. Thanks, friends! :)

story:
( French below )

Contribute in the creation of a unique musical universe.

Valfreya needs 6500$ for the upcoming album. We require your help !


We’re looking to gather funds for the recording of our 2nd full length album which we plan to do next March 2016. We’re pretty happy with what we were able to do with limited funds on our 1st album entitled « Path to Eternity », but we want to raise the bar much higher for the next one. Any help is greatly appreciated.
Plus, if we get known better in the process, that also means we have better chances of playing in your area! A simple share supports us. 



Promised land tells the story of a conqueror and his warriors who came from the North to leave a glorious legacy for his people and the memory that his name deserves. 

He will discover his promised land, but will also meet Odin's divine wrath.


Where the money goes:

Here's how the costs all break down:

  • Recording, mixing, and mastering
  • Marketing
  • 500 CDs with inserts 
  • The rest goes towards new quality t-shirts, stickers, etc
All funds raised here will go towards the production costs of the records, CDs, shirts, and shipping costs.  Any additional funds raised will go towards bonus goodies like stickers, koozies, buttons, etc.

___________________________________________________________________________
Demo samples : 
Great Sons of Warlords: 

Peuple du Nord: 


___________________________________________________________________________

Contribuez à la création d'un univers musical unique. 


Valfreya a besoin de votre aide! Les frais du prochain sera de 6500$. 

Nous voulons offrir à nos fans du matériel de la plus haute qualité possible. Nous cherchons à amasser des fonds pour l’enregistrement de notre 2e album qui se fera en Mars 2016. Nous sommes très heureux de ce que nous avons a pu accomplir avec des fonds limités pour l’enregistrement de notre premier album « Path to Eternity », mais nous visons beaucoup plus haut pour celui-ci. 
Toute aide est grandement appréciée ! Un simple partage nous aide aussi! 




Promised land raconte l'histoire d'un conquérant venu du Nord avec ses guerriers pour obtenir l'héritage glorieux qu'il laissera à son peuple, ainsi que la mémoire de son nom à travers le temps.
 Il découvrira une nouvelle terre, mais aussi la colère divine d'Odin.


À quoi vos Dons serviront:

Voici  les services pour lesquels nous avons besoin d'aide financière: 

  • Enregistrement Studio
  • Mixte et ''Mastering''
  • Commercialisation
  • 500 CDs avec pamphlets à imprimer
  • Le reste ira dans la production de chandails de qualités, d'autocollants...etc
Tous les fonds amassés dans cette campagne iront uniquement sur les coûts de productions de l'album, des chandails et de la livraison. Tous les fonds supplémentaires seront pour offrir à nos fans des bonus comme des autocollants, des vinyles ...etc

story:
Thanks for stopping by, and showing your support!

Neither Shadow Clone nor Shadow Clone music  would be possible without the greatly appreciated kindness of contributors just like you! Thank you!

Hello Peoples

Hello friends!

I'm Shadow Clone, and I make music!  I love making music!  For some odd reason, you all like to listen to the music that I make, and for that I am truly thankful.  It's WICKED that you all like listening, because I want to continue making more music just for you! My team and I worked really hard to bring you the GEEK PARTY Mixtape and you received it with open ears, but after a grueling, intense training filled time-skip, we've LEVELED-UP and are ready to bring you GEEK PARTY 2!! I can't wait to get it out for you all to enjoy! If you're able to help, that's AWESOME! If not, that's cool too! I'm just happy you stopped by! Take a minute and peruse and start getting HYPED about GEEK PARTY 2!! Thanks again!

Shadow Clone


What's Next?

GEEK PARTY 2 is of course the sequel to the coolest, nerdyist, fandom filled fiesta around! It's the original GEEK PARTY leveled over 9000! Both of these mixtapes are the manifestation of the requests and suggestions of the listener, and nothing makes Shadow Clone happier than making music for your listening pleasure.

How You're Helping?

Music is a way of communicating with the world, and everyone should be a part of the conversation. For this reason, Shadow Clone does not charge for his music. A price tag would just limit the reach of his voice by making it only accessible to those willing and/or able to pay. Your contribution will make it possible for Shadow Clone's voice to continue to be heard, while also helping him to create more of the music that you enjoy.

What You're Helping to Do?

Much was learned from the making of the GEEK PARTY.  So much goes into the production of an album, and without adequate funding, sometimes things don't go very smoothly, which causes delays and cancellations. Your donations would allow GEEK PARTY 2 to be produced without the difficulties and hinderances of its predecessor. The fundraising goal of $7,000, if reached, will help produce a quality album, of the music you love, within a short period of time. Here is a list of some of the expenses your contribution may help cover.

  • Beat purchasing
  • Mixing and Mastering
  • Promotion
  • Hard copies
  • Album art
  • Recording Studio time
  • Music Videos

What You Can Get?

Your contribution will not only bring music literally to your ears, but it can also put gifts in your hands!  There are several cool perks available to contributors to thank you for your continued support!  The perks can range anywhere from a signed Hard copy CD of GEEK PARTY 2 to an EXCLUSIVE Shadow Clone performance at an event of your choice!

If for some reason, the goal is not reached by the deadline, GEEK PARTY 2 will still be released. All moneys collected will be retained and used towards the release of GEEK PARTY 2. All perks received are guaranteed.

Other Ways To Help

Some people may want to but are just unable to contribute and that is understandable, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Here are some ways you can continue to support Shadow Clone without making a monetary contribution.

  • Spread the word about the GEEK PARTY and GEEK PARTY 2!
  • Invite people to LIKE Shadow Clone on Facebook, Follow @shadowclonesan on Twitter, Subscribe to Shadow Clone on Youtube, visit other Shadow Clone social media pages (@shadowclonesan on Instagram and Tumblr), and visit the Shadow Clone website (www.shadowclonesan.com)!
  • Spread the word about Shadow Clone music!
  • Come to shows, events, and appearances!
  • Make fan art!
  • Suggest Shadow Clone as a Musical Guest at Comic and Anime Conventions!
  • Suggest Shadow Clone at a venue near you!
  • Make sure to check out all NEW videos and NEW songs when released!

Thanks again for stopping by and showing your continued support!
Love and Peace and as always...

Unleash the FRO!!!
story_txt:
Thanks for stopping by, and showing your support!

Neither Shadow Clone nor Shadow Clone music  would be possible without the greatly appreciated kindness of contributors just like you! Thank you!Hello Peoples
Hello friends!I'm Shadow Clone, and I make music!  I love making music!  For some odd reason, you all like to listen to the music that I make, and for that I am truly thankful.  It's WICKED that you all like listening, because I want to continue making more music just for you! My team and I worked really hard to bring you the GEEK PARTY Mixtape and you received it with open ears, but after a grueling, intense training filled time-skip, we've LEVELED-UP and are ready to bring you GEEK PARTY 2!! I can't wait to get it out for you all to enjoy! If you're able to help, that's AWESOME! If not, that's cool too! I'm just happy you stopped by! Take a minute and peruse and start getting HYPED about GEEK PARTY 2!! Thanks again!Shadow Clone
What's Next?GEEK PARTY 2 is of course the sequel to the coolest, nerdyist, fandom filled fiesta around! It's the original GEEK PARTY leveled over 9000! Both of these mixtapes are the manifestation of the requests and suggestions of the listener, and nothing makes Shadow Clone happier than making music for your listening pleasure.How You're Helping?Music is a way of communicating with the world, and everyone should be a part of the conversation. For this reason, Shadow Clone does not charge for his music. A price tag would just limit the reach of his voice by making it only accessible to those willing and/or able to pay. Your contribution will make it possible for Shadow Clone's voice to continue to be heard, while also helping him to create more of the music that you enjoy.
What You're Helping to Do?
Much was learned from the making of the GEEK PARTY.  So much goes into the production of an album, and without adequate funding, sometimes things don't go very smoothly, which causes delays and cancellations. Your donations would allow GEEK PARTY 2 to be produced without the difficulties and hinderances of its predecessor. The fundraising goal of $7,000, if reached, will help produce a quality album, of the music you love, within a short period of time. Here is a list of some of the expenses your contribution may help cover.


Beat purchasing
Mixing and Mastering

Promotion
Hard copies
Album art
Recording Studio time
Music Videos



What You Can Get?
Your contribution will not only bring music literally to your ears, but it can also put gifts in your hands!  There are several cool perks available to contributors to thank you for your continued support!  The perks can range anywhere from a signed Hard copy CD of GEEK PARTY 2 to an EXCLUSIVE Shadow Clone performance at an event of your choice!
If for some reason, the goal is not reached by the deadline, GEEK PARTY 2 will still be released. All moneys collected will be retained and used towards the release of GEEK PARTY 2. All perks received are guaranteed.
Other Ways To Help
Some people may want to but are just unable to contribute and that is understandable, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Here are some ways you can continue to support Shadow Clone without making a monetary contribution.

Spread the word about the GEEK PARTY and GEEK PARTY 2!
Invite people to LIKE Shadow Clone on Facebook, Follow @shadowclonesan on Twitter, Subscribe to Shadow Clone on Youtube, visit other Shadow Clone social media pages (@shadowclonesan on Instagram and Tumblr), and visit the Shadow Clone website (www.shadowclonesan.com)!
Spread the word about Shadow Clone music!
Come to shows, events, and appearances!
Make fan art!
Suggest Shadow Clone as a Musical Guest at Comic and Anime Conventions!
Suggest Shadow Clone at a venue near you!
Make sure to check out all NEW videos and NEW songs when released!


Thanks again for stopping by and showing your continued support!Love and Peace and as always...Unleash the FRO!!!

story:
Friends and Pals:

The goal/dream has always been to press a vinyl record and there's no time like the present.  After a pretty tough spell, I decided to get back into things and I wrote and recorded this album.  Since the album is already recorded, this campaign is aimed specifically at funding the mastering and pressing processes.  All donations will have the option of being refunded at a later date (up until the goal is met), as the point of this isn't to take your money, but to simply get the funding necessary to complete the record. I appreciate your considerations!


Read on if you're bored:

I've played in punk and rock bands since age 14 (somewhere around there) with varying degrees of success.  If you're viewing this, most likely you're familiar with some, or possibly all of those exploits.  If not, I'm sorry and they're not worth getting into, but I'll link some older tunes for reference. I've always been proud of my collaborations with others (although critical of my own contributions to those collaborations) and that stays true with this release. 

This album was recorded without much flow, as it was done around two very, very busy schedules, but the spirit of the record rings clear, I think and Jon (Gunnell) made it sound a lot better than it otherwise would have.  I really hope it provides some insight to myself and that possibly some folks can relate to it and, more importantly....just get it, as that was really almost the point of writing it. 

Hope to see you all around city in the meantime, as we start debuting these songs live!

story:
Thank you for your interest! A word about the title... Mass for a New World. Composers since the 1500s have used what is commonly know as "The Ordinary of the Mass" as a vehicle for musical composition. Composers from the Italian Baroque, to Haydn, Mozart, Beethoven, Schubert, Brahms, and even Bernstein have used this form to hang their musical ideas on. Composers are still writing new music using this form. 

As far as practical use goes - Roman Catholics would still call this a Mass. Lutherans would probably call it a "Communion Setting". Episcopalians would use either the term Mass or Liturgy - Methodists would probably call it Word and Table. Any other spiritual gathering can call it anything they want! Regardless of nomenclature, the intent is the same. And... if ANYONE has a better idea for a title.... I'm all for it!!

Here is a link to the original GarageBand demos I did in my bedroom. Through the kindness and generosity of spirit, and a genuine belief in the project, of my dear musician friends in NJ, the Processional is completely finished. I include it here so you can hear the level of quality this project aspires to. Imagine how great it will be when all the parts of Mass for a New World sound this awesome!!

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/nec2a91pbn30hzx/AACzciLKg529BjReJ8S1EPm7a?dl=0

You will hear gaps in the singing .(I apologize for my weak vocals, but I was the only one around at the time! Work with what ya got, right?) It is in these spots that I ran out of ideas, and sought out the collaboration of the best lyricist/song writer  I know - Peter Myers. He and I have worked together for over 20 years, and made fantastic music over that time. I played keyboards, arranged and produced an album of his Contemporary Christian music about 10 years ago.

The Liturgical texts and Psalms needed to be paraphrased to make them fit the music, and overall feel of the project, and in some spots - lyrics are needed. (We will All Get to Heaven (Offertory), Lamb of God, All who are tired (Communion),  and the Post-Communion Hymn-Thank the Lord for All that He has Done). 

Here is a video, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h6wKJ5Gw8S4 

and photo (some of the singers had to leave before we got the photo shot)  of the Methodist University Chamber Singers in the studio, singing to my demos, courtesy of Dr. Michael Martin, Director of Choral Activities, and Dr. Ben Hancock, President of the University!


 As I write this, Peter has completed ALL the work, and we are ready to go!! It has been a LONG 2 years since the night I said to myself "and so we begin" as I started up GarageBand, and began playing the piano part to the Gloria. Over the next 4 weeks, all these pieces took shape in my bedroom, as I came up with keyboard parts, drum grooves, percussion patterns, Bass parts, guitar parts, and backing vocal harmonies. I am "chomping at the bit" to finally bring this to life!

Here is a detailed budget worksheet, so you can see where and how the money will be spent...I am trying to raise slightly more than budgeted, because everything takes longer and costs more than one initially thinks.

  As I said in the video.... all the musicians have been auditioned and hired, the recording studio has been reserved, and all I need now is your support! Help me spread this new music for the Rite of Holy Communion, and in fact, any other spiritual gathering, across the globe! Thanks in advance for your support!! Blessings!!

story:
So let me introduce my self:

My name is Evgeny Smirnov, i'm 30 years old and living not far from Moscow, Russian Federation. If you like music, especially Trance genre, you may better know me as Aurosonic. Music production is my hobby since 1998 and for that 17 years period i've got thousands of people all over the world who enjoy what i do. If you never heared my music here is the link: https://soundcloud.com/aurosonic . 24 december 2014 i became a happy father.
The main reason i'm starting this campaign is hard financial situation in Russia due to sanctions and rouble cost. Since my baby born i've to spend all my time to work and almost have no time for music production. And unfortunately due to piracy i can't get any money from music production. Plus i need to upgrade my PC to continue music production. Here is a teaser of my current projects: https://soundcloud.com/aurosonic/2015-teaser-new-aurosonic
Some of them are already finished, some not.
I've heared a lot of stories from people about my music, how it helps them in their life, it makes them happy etc. I believe those who love it could also help me become a little happier and make my life a bit easier.
Here are two most popular tracks made by me:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-1I84cqRYLY
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T82Ot04aqNw
If you really love my music, if it makes you happier and if you want to hear more of my production, I'd be very thankful for any amount of donation you made.
Thanks a lot,
Evgeny Smirnov

story:
You asked for more, more music! 



Welcome Everyone and Thank You so much for visiting my Indiegogo! 

For over a year I have been writing, recording and self-producing tracks in my home studio for my 2nd full-length music project, ©Wood and Snake. I am really excited about what is happening in this wave of music coming through, and all of the people who are already helping make it shine!  

©Wood and Snake is a beat-driven groovy, rhythmic, eclectic dance-able compilation of original music and one traditional Sephardic song from Spain, with lyrics in English, Arabic, and Medieval Spanish.  I have fantastic musicians contributing their brilliance to each track, including the talented Daniel Mogtaderi on violin, Eric Ederer on Yayli Tanbur and Oud, Nicholas Ragheb on percussion, Bryan Snyder on flutes, Benjamin Cziller on Bass, Maz Karandish on Oud, Youssef Bouallag on Arabic translation and vocals, and Fred Nadis on clarinet.  Me on hammered dulcimer, vocals, percussion, and sound design.  My intention is to bring a couple of other musicians into the mix as well.


My last co-produced project, Mystery of Souls (© 2007), with Marshall Lefferts, was a blast to make and I have heard so many wonderful stories of people's experiences with the music. We affectionately called it "otherworld music" because of the ethereal aspect of the intuitive language lyrics  (If you don't know what intuitive language means, think Dead Can Dance. Lisa Gerrard did this when she sang on most of their albums). I had a vision from way back to vocalize that way. I loved hearing how it inspired and touched people. And this is why music is important for me personally. And the blessing of recording and collaborating with other musicians  totally turns me on!  

What is Wood and Snake?
Wood and Snake is a metaphor of the things we experience and how we interpret them, the past we bring into the present that robs us of seeing things as they are.  It is the perception we hold about life, and the illusions that hold us back. The title track, Wood and Snake, plays with these ideas and hopefully gets you dancing and contemplating! Wow, that's cool!
I have been writing, producing and recording, working on all the elements of releasing this CD in the Fall, and now I need your help!  I am really happy with what I've done so far...some of the music is included in the video above so you can hear the vibe.

What is Needed to Release this CD?

What I need, really need, to get this music out there, is this:
  • Pro studio time for some tracks, TBD/$1000-1500
  • Mixing and Mastering, $3,000+ -- I am very excited to have engineers on board and ready to start, to take this music to the stratosphere, and they are worth it! More to come on these experienced artists.
  • Paying the fine musicians who make this music shine, $1,000+
  • CD Duplication and Marketing materials, $1,500+
  • Website, Photography, Cover Art and Social Media Design, $1500
  • CD Release Concert, TBD
These are very basic expenses that will allow me to release the music to the public. My priority in asking for help is bringing the production to completion for the Fall Release, and these elements are key to that happening. Your support is  important and graciously appreciated, and I thank you from the bottom of my heart in advance for any contribution you can make. 
In addition to this campaign, there are other costs that will arise in making music videos, editing, live concert fees, merchandising, additional music production, etc.  So I humbly and gratefully accept all contributions above and beyond the Goal!  All contributions go toward making music, and anything above the goal will cover taking tracks to a deeper level of production with the expertise of others. I want these tracks to shine brightly, and be the best they can be for your ecstatic enjoyment!

The Impact

I really hope that one of the ways this music will inspire you is to carry a message that we are here to create in life that which moves us and brings us joy, and at any time, at any age, at any stage of our life, we have the right to create from our heart and soul, the way that is most meaningful for us. This is how I created this music, and I believe in a world where we are all encouraged and empowered to engage in our creativity, whatever that is. So take a step for your art, and let us know when you do! 

Giving back and helping others through this project is important to me. Right now, there are millions of women and children in Syria who are homeless and without food or shelter.  They need help desperately. So a portion of all sales will go directly to NuDay Syria (www.NuDaySyria.net) to help these people with basic needs and to rebuild their lives. The sooner the album starts selling, the sooner these contributions will go to help those in acute situations. Meanwhile, feel free to visit the organization and donate right away!

Crowd-funding is an excellent platform that asks us to step up and take a stand for what we are creating, ask for help, enlist the community, and make things happen that might not otherwise happen, without going into tremendous debt to do so. Let's all support each other to live our dreams!

My Intention and Commitment

My intention is to release this album in early Fall.  With your support, this will happen. Without it, I am still committed to releasing this music, but it will take longer.  

My commitment is to provide value for the Perks offered, like VIP concert passes, signed product, digital downloads, private concerts, Skype calls to support others with their musical visions, and even Executive Producer credit. Please see the Perks to the right, and note that a few carry the same giving amount while offering different perks. 

Other Ways You Can Help

And hey! If you can't make a contribution today, please know that your help can come in other forms. You can share this campaign with others, it's easy with the Indiegogo Share tools, and you can also post and share on social media.  You can even help us pull off our first concert behind the scenes. What goes around comes around, right? Thank you thank you thank you! 

Wood and Snake is me living a dream. Thanks for being a part of it.


ç

Please see the Perks to the right, and note that a few carry the same giving amount while offering different perks. 
    Other Ways You Can Help And hey! If you can't make a contribution today, please know that your help can come in other forms. You can share this campaign with others, it's easy with the Indiegogo Share tools, and you can also post and share on social media.  You can even help us pull off our first concert behind the scenes. What goes around comes around, right? Thank you thank you thank you! 

Wood and Snake is me living a dream. Thanks for being a part of it.

story:
Short Summary

I'm trying to crowdfund money for Smash Mouth's new album. They have a perk to let me sing vocals on their new album. Of course I want to do it but it's a lot of money, so this is where you come in, I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

I need about $1500. Here's how that breaks down:

  • $1000 for the reward.
  • $75 for the fees IndieGoGo Will Take
  • $100 for other misc fees.
  • $325 or so for any travel fees. 
    • I'll foot the rest if it's more. 

I have a bunch of great rewards for you. Just look in the sidebar. I'll sing to you, I'll mail you some things, I'll even make videos for you. 

All pledgers get some rad BTS access, but like $10 or more gets some additional fun BTS videos. Who knows, maybe if I succeed you'll get some cool videos from the band? I can't control if that'll happen or not, but if it does, that'll be amazing!  

The Impact

This can be huge. Seriously. Smash Mouth is like the world's biggest and bestest band (next to Miranda Consgrove #headphonesOn). Here's the impact this project can have:

  • I get to meet Smash Mouth
  • You get to listen and watch some cool videos.
  • Smash Mouth makes a cool new acoustic album!
  • Dreams will be made.
    • Some might even be shattered.

Risks & Challenges

I'm doing a flexible funding campaign. If I do not reach my goal, I will still pledge to Smash Mouth's new album, I will just probably select a lower tier perk. I'll of course keep you informed. I'm sure we can raise the money, but at the very least I'm sure we can raise the money for me to at least get the album. 

If I get just the album I'll share my reactions to it via some video I'll record with my phone. 

If I don't meet anywhere near the goal, I'm sure I'll still have some great content to share with the few backers that do support me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they aren't All Stars. Here's how you can help:

  • Go outside. Sign All Star. It's a great song.
  • Go to a gas station. someBODY will need some change for gas. You can spare it, even if you can't spare it for this campaign.
  • Share this on Twitter. Tweet SmashMouth. Buy their albums. Support this indiegogo. You can do it. 

And that's all there is to it, All Star.

$325 or so for any travel fees. I'll foot the rest if it's more. 


I have a bunch of great rewards for you. Just look in the sidebar. I'll sing to you, I'll mail you some things, I'll even make videos for you. 
All pledgers get some rad BTS access, but like $10 or more gets some additional fun BTS videos. Who knows, maybe if I succeed you'll get some cool videos from the band? I can't control if that'll happen or not, but if it does, that'll be amazing!  

The Impact
This can be huge. Seriously. Smash Mouth is like the world's biggest and bestest band (next to Miranda Consgrove #headphonesOn). Here's the impact this project can have:

I get to meet Smash Mouth
You get to listen and watch some cool videos.
Smash Mouth makes a cool new acoustic album!
Dreams will be made.Some might even be shattered.



Risks & Challenges
I'm doing a flexible funding campaign. If I do not reach my goal, I will still pledge to Smash Mouth's new album, I will just probably select a lower tier perk. I'll of course keep you informed. I'm sure we can raise the money, but at the very least I'm sure we can raise the money for me to at least get the album. 
If I get just the album I'll share my reactions to it via some video I'll record with my phone. 
If I don't meet anywhere near the goal, I'm sure I'll still have some great content to share with the few backers that do support me.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they aren't All Stars. Here's how you can help:

Go outside. Sign All Star. It's a great song.
Go to a gas station. someBODY will need some change for gas. You can spare it, even if you can't spare it for this campaign.
Share this on Twitter. Tweet SmashMouth. Buy their albums. Support this indiegogo. You can do it. 

And that's all there is to it, All Star.

story:
In 2016 the two members of rubyfruit, Jenny Posnak and Kate Hamilton, work-traded and wrote songs on farms throughout the United States. We stayed overnight on couches in 37 different homes, worked in 23 different towns and drove through 42 states.  At the end we landed in Nashville, TN to record the songs written from the experience of traveling, working and performing as a queer couple across the country in the divisive 2016 election year. 

As part of the release process of the EP, rubyfruit is raising funds to make a music video to one of the album's songs, 'Ivory Tower,' featuring the direction of Mia Cioffi Henry, movement by Jessi Barber, art direction by Kim Upstill and production by Annie Bernstein. (See collaborator bios below.) The concept involves a cow pasture in Petaluma, CA, a crowd of fifty people, instruments, dance, parade and protest. 

We've been able to raise some funds but need your help for the final push!

Contributions large and small will go to:

  • Payment to all artists involved
    • Director/Director of Photography
    • Choreographer
    • Two to Three Dancers
    • Producer
    • Art Director 
  • Transportation for the crowd of fifty to get to Petaluma the day of the shoot
  • Rental of video and audio equipment
  • Supply of two meals for participants on the day of the shoot
  • Editing of the video 

With the support we received from Rubyfruit's last campaign we were able to create something we are so proud of. Now, we can't wait to release it in May and have this collaboration be the album's first step into the world. With your support we can make a high-quality music video that is both relevant and expressive .

If you are unable to donate monetarily there are other ways to be involved in the project:

  • We are creating something that involves a group of people ranging widely in age, body type, ethnicity, race, religion, sexuality, gender identity and ability. If you have friends who are interested in being a part of the project's crowd or if you yourself wanna travel out we would LOVE to have you! Send us a message here, become friends on social media or reach out to rubyfruitjams@gmail.com for all of the details. 
  • Spreading the word is so valuable! Please share this link or use Indiegogo's share tools on this page.

We realize that there are so many other causes that you can contribute your time and money to right now. We hope that this video is more than an insular or esoteric artistic project, but a real commentary that speaks to a wide audience. We hope that, with you help, we can make an impact.

Thank you thank you thank you!

You're the best! 

Collaborator Bios

Mia Cioffi Henry (Director/Director of Photography) is a director and cinematographer based between New York City and Rome, Italy. With a background in dance and still photography, she likes to make magic come to life on screen. Ms. Cioffi Henry is a working artist who received her MFA in cinematography at NYU Tisch as a Dean’s fellow and Production Associate, she is the recipient of the Nestor Almendros Award for Outstadning Achivement in Cinematography, a finalist for the ARRI Volker Bahnemann Award and winner of the Best Cinematography Award sponsored by Canon at the Fusion Film Festival 2015 and has had her work screen all over the world including premiers at Sundance Film Festival and Berlinale. miacioffihenry.com

Jenny Posnak (Composer/Performer) is an accomplished jazz and classical musician, teacher and composer. She has taught theory and piano skills at the University of Miami Piano Preparatory Program, and was a piano accompanist for operatic vocalists in the Kenyon College Music Department in Gambier, Ohio. She also provided music lessons at Head Start Early Education Centers, where she developed her passion for working with young children and beginners. While living in Washington, D.C., Ms. Posnak apprenticed at the Young Women’s Drumming Empowerment Project (YWDEP), teaching African drumming and leadership skills. In 2015, Jenny was a composer at The Art Monastery project, a two month artistic residency in Caramanico Terme, Italy.

Kate Hamilton  (Composer/Performer) is a theater artist, producer and composer. Rubyfruit's EP will be her third album. Her co-composition, The Highwayman, received a Cap 21 Writer's Residency and performance at Ars Nova's ANT Fest 2014. Erosion, is an album created with Loom Ensemble, a group Kate has produced theater with in Dubai and Italy. Kate is a founder and Artistic Associate of Calliope Theatre Company, an ensemble that creates work inspired by literature and poetry organically through long-form improvisation. Her performance credits include- New York: Songs of Ascension (BAM dir. Meredith Monk),Discovery Show (Lincoln Center Jazz), Stop the Virgens (St. Ann’s Warehouse), Ghost Life(Playwrights Horizons Resident Workshop), Tamar and the River (New World Stages), Erosion: A Fable (La Mama). Regional: Far From Heaven (Williamstown Theatre Festival), The Boyfriend (Princeton Music Festival) and lead solo work with five orchestras throughout the US. International: Say I Am You (thejamjar, Dubai), Si Quis Sitit (Art Monastery Project, Italy). katehamilton.net

Jessi Barber (Choreographer/ Performer) is an Oakland-based choreographer, dancer and production manager. Her work seeks to connect audiences with their physical selves by creating contemporary movement that stems from stories and spaces. She is the artistic director of Everything All At Once, a Bay Area modern dance company which has been in residence at Shawl-Anderson Dance Center, SAFEhouse for the Arts, and The Art Monastery Project. As a performer she has danced with local companies including Nina Haft & Co. and Mid-To-West Dance Collective. eaaodance.org

Annie Bernstein (Producer) is a freelance producer and editor based in the Bay Area. Her work includes policy campaigns, music videos, and digital branded content that have captivated a wide range of audiences. Her most recent project was screened at the James Beard Leadership Awards in 2016. When she's not producing, she can be found performing stand-up or making homemade bagels.

 Kim Upstill (Art Director)  is an artist, chef, costume designer and event producer based between Berkeley CA, and Berlin. It's wet there. Her work dips into social practice and poetics. She designs and cooks pop-up cafes and events that investigate feastings ability to enact lyrical and discursive participation. She makes print media that work with texture and color as seen, felt, and flirtatious. She likes getting messy and involved. She dislikes industrial ketchup. kimupstill.com

Photo Credits:

Rubyfruit photos taken by Omar Diaz and edited by Bjorn Bolinder. 

The Mall During The Women's March on Washington taken by Kate Hamilton

story:
Toasted Rat the great band in the world?

Toasted rat formed in the past and some point, we were too young and foolish to remember when. We had a huge cult following at local venues including the legendary Frog and Fiddle and the less known but equally questionable 2pigs. 

Toasted rat staring Naz on vocals, toast on lead guitar and jack on bass had hit songs including Barry the bagel and the sex song. Not to forget penguin and my dog has fleas.

 

We want for the first time to get these legendary tracks recorded for the enjoyment and career damage for everyone in years to come

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support and cold hard cash to get these epic sounds recorded for the benefit of everyone. These songs will be released license free for everyone to enjoy.

The Impact

We will change the international music seen for everyone

story:
Short Summary

Hello my Ladies in Waiting (Potential name for the fan base but I'm still taking suggestions). I have just recently released my first ever single titled "Baroque" and I need your help to get the music video produced. Beginning my career as an actress in LA, I've been doing it all to pay the bills. Babysitting, waitressing, being a cashier, and MLM pyramid schemes all at the same time. Yet I was still getting burn out by barely paying off my finances. And on top of that I wanted to stunt on these h**s by trying to look like the daughter of a failed reality TV star with my Goodwill Budget and my roommates hand me downs. A Gen- Z problem indeed. I've always wanted to write and produce music but have always refrained from doing so. But with my situation giving me depression and wanting to try something different with my life, I channeled my frustration into writing this funny yet relatable banger! And of course, I needed to compliment the song with an equally clever music video to do it justice. 

What We Need & What You Get

The music video has a very simple structure. My head will be placed on various 17th century paintings whilst singing the song. But all of the magic is in the editing. Your donation will provide...

  • A proper editor who can flawlessly attach my face to these paintings and color grade my skin tone to match as close as possible (Not a lot of black representation back then).
  • Fund the space, lighting, and director, to get this process done!

And thats it! Not only is the idea simple because that's how I see it, but I want to take the appropriate precautions for the safety of my crew in the wake of the pandemic. That means limited people on set and social distancing!

 

The Impact

A music video really can push a musicians career forward to reach a much wider audience. I'm hoping that eventually I become mainstream and possibly open doors for more black females to write funny songs that people can bump their heads to. My catalog may not all be about the humorous things, but as of now thats all I can write about! While I still have a passion in acting and film making, I believe this music career will help me explore different parts of my artistry that I haven't been able to fully tap into before.

Risks & Challenges

I think the biggest risk is timing. With the pandemic going on the entertainment industry is taking everything on a day by day basis. I'm hoping to get the video finished by the end of the month so I can be able to release other projects that I'm currently working on in time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Stream and share my song! Available on all platforms such as Spotify, Amazon Music, Itunes, and Deezer!

story:
Hey! 

My name is Karen, and before we get started, please know I do NOT want to speak to your manager…I want to make movies. 

Being a woman of color and first generation American, provided me with the drive and ambition necessary to pursue the art of storytelling. I have made it my mission to direct projects that help inspire younger girls, coming from any social or economic background, to realize their infinite potential. 

This mission would be insurmountable without my creative partners at Greater Boston Artist Collective, otherwise known as GBAC. GBAC is a collection of female artists across all mediums based in Boston, MA. Our focus is to give artists a platform to share their work. We accomplish this by hosting live musical events, art shows, and through the power of film. 

Money is not our motive, but it is how we are able to keep giving artists opportunities to shine, which is why we humbly come to you for help on our next project, a music video for the song ‘Chop.’ 

Chop, performed by SHELLZ and Dutch Rebelle, two female rappers from Haitian descent, is a song about cutting out the negatives in life, and continue moving forward with your head held high. GBAC is honored to amplify black voices and give them the opportunity to share their message with the masses.

In this video, we pay homage to Kendrick Lamar, Beyonce, Nicki Minaj, J. Cole and countless other inspiring black artists that have shared their journey of struggle and prosperity with a world that was not set up for them to succeed.

As you can see on our WEBSITE we've created some amazing films with little to no money. This requires our crew to dedicate our time for free, despite needing to make rent. With the added difficulties provided by 2020, our team is not able to fully finance all of our work, but with your contribution we can continue to raise voices through the arts, while also putting food on our tables. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,000. Making our goal means we can provide safer and better working conditions for our crew, and pay them what they deserve, this being our top priority. 

Our locations are booked, our gear is rented and our talent is ready to perform ALL OUT. We have been able to get this far with just GBAC’s imagination and drive, but with your support we can elevate this project to the next level. 

The Impact

 

The message behind Chop is one this world is so desperately needing right now. A message of positivity, unity, inclusivity and triumph in the face of tragedy. With an army of women behind you, there is no obstacle you cannot overcome. 

You may have seen our last video with Shellz, called SOULZ. A project fully funded from our own pockets, which has now surpassed 67K views! Making it onto MTV on demand, Music Choice on demand, and finally BET channels! With your support today, we have the opportunity to reach even further. 

Risks & Challenges

GBAC has and will always be passionate enough to collaborate, even if it means not having the funds, but due to COVID, we have to ensure all of our members are financially safe and secure during these trying times. 

There are many avenues you can take to help us bring this vision to life. Music performances, art auctions, master classes offered by our members.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Every dollar counts! GBAC understands that not everyone can help financially during these tough times. Even just sharing this link and spreading awareness in our fundraising campaign would be tremendous. The fact that you have read all of this so far, already means the world to us! 

 

We are all puzzle pieces of a bigger picture. GBAC is an all women group, we are Latina, Armenian, and of Italian descent. We believe in chosen family, unity, and love. Our different backgrounds, our hardships and successes are the backbone of our stories. 

Every painting, every film, every piece of art GBAC creates, is never self serving. We don’t sit around and talk about what we can do for our community, we are out there serving it. Thank you for your continued support, for believing in the power of women, the power of POC and the power of our creative community.

story:
My name is Bianca Bernardi and I am a Singer/Songwriter/Musician based out of Dundas, Ontario, Canada. Music has always been "it" for me. I was 6 months old when I was on my first stage and I feel like I've never left. It's been 6 years since I released my debut self-titled EP. A lot has changed, a lot of life has been lived and a lot of songs have been written. 

For obvious reasons, this year has been different. I went from playing consistently and having many gigs on the horizon to going months without performing at all, all while in the beginning stages of recording my first full length album. Before the world turned upside down, I was self-funding this album through gigs, teaching and a full-time job. All of that stopped and so with the halt in work came a halt in production. 

By contributing to this campaign you will help me finish what I started. There is nothing that I want more than to have this music in your hands. 
 

What I Need & What You Get

Being an independent artist & self-funding is a challenge, even without a pandemic. Your contribution would allow me to finish the 4 songs that are recorded and complete 6 more songs for the record. 

  • Recording & Mixing
  • Mastering the Album  
  • Compensating Local Musicians
  • Album Artwork, Duplication & Distriburtion 
  • Merch & Promotional Material
     

The Impact

To be honest with you, this all feels a little strange to me. I've always prided myself on being fiercely independent, so asking for help doesn't exactly come naturally or easily. But I believe in this music. I believe in this project and the people involved. And I believe that asking for help to get these songs out into the world is what I am supposed to be doing right now. So thank you for contributing, in any way, and for helping and hearing me. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough right now, I understand. If you aren't able to contribute financially but you still want to help me make this a reality then please, SHARE SHARE SHARE. Tell your friends to tell their friends to tell their friends and so on. Nothing is stronger than word of mouth and an amazing community. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Je m'appelle Bianca Bernardi et je suis chanteuse/compositrice/musicienne basée à Dundas, Ontario, Canada. La musique a toujours été "mon truc" à moi. J'avais 6 mois quand je suis allée sur scène pour la première fois et j'ai l'impression de ne jamais l'avoir vraiment quittée depuis. Cela fait 6 ans que j'ai sorti mon premier EP éponyme. Beaucoup de choses ont changé, beaucoup de morceaux de vie ont été vécus, et beaucoup de chansons ont été écrites.

Pour des raisons évidentes, cette année a été différente. Je suis passée de faire de la musique sans cesse, avoir plein de concerts prévus à ne plus faire de musique (sur scène) du tout pendant des mois ; tout ça alors que je commençais tout juste à enregistrer mon premier album. Avant que le monde ne tombe à la renverse, je finançais moi même l’enregistrement de l’album grâce à mes concerts, l’enseignement et un travail à plein temps. Tout ça s’est arrêté, et qui dit un arrêt du travail dit un arrêt de la production de l’album.

En contribuant à cette campagne, vous m’aiderez à finir ce que j’ai commencé. Pouvoir vous mettre cette musique dans les mains, c’est tout ce que qui compte pour moi.

 

Ce dont j’ai besoin & Ce que vous obtiendrez

Être un artiste indépendant qui s’auto-finance est un challenge, même sans une pandémie. Votre contribution me permettrait de finir les 4 chansons qui sont enregistrées et de compléter les 6 autres qui doivent l’être.

L’enregistrement & le mix

La masterisation de l’album

La compensation aux musiciens locaux

L’impression des cds & la distribution

Le merchandizing & le matériel promotionnel

 

L’impact

Pour être honnête avec vous, ça me fait bizarre de vous demander ça. J’ai toujours été profondément fière d’être indépendante, donc demander de l’aide ne me vient pas naturellement ni facilement. Mais je crois en la musique. Je crois en ce projet et en les gens qui en font partie. Et je crois que demander de l’aide pour que ces chansons voient le jour, c’est exactement ce que je suis censée faire. Donc merci de votre contribution, de n’importe quelle manière, et de votre aide et votre écoute.

 

D’autres manières d’aider

Les temps sont durs en ce moment, je comprends. Si vous ne pouvez pas m’aider financièrement mais que vous voulez tout de même m’aider à réaliser ce projet alors s’il vous plaît, s’il vous plaît, s’il vous plaît : partagez, partagez, partagez ! Dites à vos amis de le dire à leurs amis de le dire à leur amis etc. ! Rien n’est plus fort que le bouche à oreille dans une grande et bienveillante communauté !
story_txt:
My name is Bianca Bernardi and I am a Singer/Songwriter/Musician based out of Dundas, Ontario, Canada. Music has always been "it" for me. I was 6 months old when I was on my first stage and I feel like I've never left. It's been 6 years since I released my debut self-titled EP. A lot has changed, a lot of life has been lived and a lot of songs have been written. 
For obvious reasons, this year has been different. I went from playing consistently and having many gigs on the horizon to going months without performing at all, all while in the beginning stages of recording my first full length album. Before the world turned upside down, I was self-funding this album through gigs, teaching and a full-time job. All of that stopped and so with the halt in work came a halt in production. 
By contributing to this campaign you will help me finish what I started. There is nothing that I want more than to have this music in your hands.  

What I Need & What You Get
Being an independent artist & self-funding is a challenge, even without a pandemic. Your contribution would allow me to finish the 4 songs that are recorded and complete 6 more songs for the record. 

Recording & Mixing
Mastering the Album  
Compensating Local Musicians
Album Artwork, Duplication & Distriburtion 
Merch & Promotional Material 


The Impact
To be honest with you, this all feels a little strange to me. I've always prided myself on being fiercely independent, so asking for help doesn't exactly come naturally or easily. But I believe in this music. I believe in this project and the people involved. And I believe that asking for help to get these songs out into the world is what I am supposed to be doing right now. So thank you for contributing, in any way, and for helping and hearing me.  

Other Ways You Can Help
Times are tough right now, I understand. If you aren't able to contribute financially but you still want to help me make this a reality then please, SHARE SHARE SHARE. Tell your friends to tell their friends to tell their friends and so on. Nothing is stronger than word of mouth and an amazing community. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
Welcome to Evol ... The Journey Continues 

This has been a life journey for me and music, I often try to understand the hold it has on me but to be honest, its been there for me as a treasure box holding a whole lot of stuff, lol. From I was young nothing helped me deal with obstacles, like music did. Surprising I held a lot inside and music helped me to vocalize that. 

I had started this project a few years back and wanted to do it myself, as it would be more authentic to who I am as an artist and expressing my true self.  I do music for the love of it, not for the fame and with that being said I wanted to involve the people that have surrounded me in my journey, my friends, family and supporters. This will be a intimate interaction, as my songs come from a personal place. I will only release these songs to you in my bonus pack ,for they are exclusives. 

Thank you so much for your support its been 10 years since Long Road and the Journey Continues 

Pre Order  $25

Pre Order today 

$25 

Includes 1 Video 

Bonus Video

7Album Tracks 

5 Exclusive tracks 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with others?

missnatashawaterman.com

Subscribe to my Youtube page 

Follow me on Facebook, Instagram and tiktoc

story:
OTTAVIA: build your music and your piano!

Ottavia is a professional modular keyboard! Each single Ottavia module (1 octave, 12 dynamic keys) can be used individually or together with others in order to compose a complete piano keyboard.

 

You can also use Ottavia for studio work, where the musicians use 1 or 2 octaves, or for live performances, where 7/8 octaves are needed. 

 

 

 

MUSICAL PHENOTYPE

The modularity of the instrument reduces its size, and therefore makes the instrument easy to transport. The prototype consists of 4 octaves. It is equipped with USB output, to connect it to the PC, MIDI connectors, to connect it to an expander, and a USB input to connect it to another Ottavia module.

OTTAVIA is not a toy! It's a real musical instrument. The quality of the mechanics will always have priority over new features, which will be present in future updates. 

FROM MOZART TO DJ IN A GESTURE

Whether you are a student, you just play or look for a good quality keyboard that grows with you giving you the ability to add octaves, you have found the right tool for you!

 
 

OTTAVIA'S TEAM

 


MORE INFO?

Write Us: info@lamiaottavia.eu
Visit our website: www.lamiaottavia.eu

 

 

CAMPAIGN RISK

With the creation and delivery of a brand new product there are always risks and challenges.
The OTTAVIA team has minimized them thanks to the entire process, from production to delivery, already set up and organized.
In fact, we have all the necessary skills within the team, we have the first prototypes already working and the certifications necessary for the beta version of our product.
All this, together with our strategic partnerships with crowdfunding experts, leaves little room for error and guarantees a very rapid delivery.
