story:
Short Summary

Hi I’m Chris Komer,  Founder/Director of The Artists Refuge at Thunderhead near Hughesville, Montana.  We are a fully accredited non-profit organization with 501(c)(3) status so all of your contributions will be tax deductable.  I’m a musician/artist living in New York City but in the summer, with the help of many volunteers I am building a rustic retreat for artists and creative people from all walks of life.  We will be opening up on a limited basis this summer but due to the COVID-19 crisis our funds have been impacted and we need to increase our funding in order to be able to accommodate and feed our volunteers who are helping to build our small village.  The money will also go towards building supplies.  In order to do this we are making a push to attract new members to be a part of our community.  Our usual membership fee is $100 to join and $35 a year to keep the membership current.  But for the duration of this campaign we will only be asking $70 to join.   As a member you become part of our unique, organic community of adventurous, creative people from all over the world and will be  able to participate in the planning and growing of the project.   It is truly a group vision and every idea is added to the soup and considered.  You will also receive special discounts to stay in our cabins (if you volunteer to work as well it is free depending on availability)  and invitations to special events when they start to occur in the not so distant future.  You will also always be welcome to reserve campsites on the grounds of Thunderhead (subject to availability) free of charge.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are shooting for $15,000 but even $5,000 will allow us to make some progress.  With our own sawmill (bought with our last IndieGoGo campaign) and with half of our 60 acres solid forest we are able to build very, very inexpensively using mostly standing dead pine or dead fall that has yet to begin to rot.          

Right now and for the foreseeable future Thunderhead is a working retreat.  Last summer we had 50 volunteers and artists come thru Thunderhead during the course of the summer to help us build more infrastructure.  The food budget averaged about $600 a week and another $11,000 was spent on building materials.  Much progress was made however as we came closer to completing the Poets Cafe,  built another new cabin and added a solar powered water pump to our spring box and ran new water lines to many of our structures.  

Not only are we offering a discount on new memberships but we are offering ridiculous deals on renting our cabins to be used anytime within the next 3 years!  3 meals a day included!  (July and August)

 

The Impact

During this crisis it became clear to me and many others just how special a live performance is.  You don’t know what you have until it’s gone.  Right now it is unclear when they will begin again.  Performing artists and artists of all types are struggling to make ends meet during this time and are in dire need of support and community.  Thunderhead helps to provide that community and is a place where artists (professional or amateur) can go to heal, find support and create.   It’s quite a magical place.  Ask anyone who has been.   I offer two quotes below.   

 

Feedback left by Jeppe Hastrup  (Denmark)

There is nothing other than this to say about this place: Go! You'll never regret it!
Chris is an amazing, inspiring person with realistic plans to achieve his dream of an artist refuge, and he is well on the way already. The work is fun, but it doesn't hold a candle to all the late-night campfire jam sessions, delicious food and thousands of laughs. This was my first Workaway, and I literally cannot recommend it enough. I will be telling my friends, grandparents and strangers that I pass on the street about this place.

 

Feedback left by April Weathers (Alabama, USA)

This is now my favorite place on earth! It became my home away from home. I actually ended up staying two weeks longer than planned and still didn't want to leave when the time came. Chris has created a magical place where inspiration is practically in the air you breathe. The creativity is tangible, and if you are experiencing a creative block, consider yourself unblocked. Seriously, if you have the opportunity to stay here, I HIGHLY recomend it!! The work is hard but fun, the food is great, and the people are the best of the best. I can't wait to go back!

 

Risks & Challenges

Founded in 2007, we have been growing every summer.   Since we are used to operating on a shoestring budget we have learned how to build structures very inexpensively using our own natural resources and our own portable saw mill.  We use solar power and employ other eco conscious building techniques.  (One cabin has a living roof!)

Our plan is to build a small village capable of hosting up to 50 creative folks at a time and To eventually host workshops and an eventual diverse festival of art and music and dance.   We are not in a rush though and our timeline is flexible.   We grow as fast as we have funds and volunteers to lend a hand.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute?  That doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Introduce people to our project by using the share tools provided by IndieGoGo, and keep us in mind in the future as a donor or a volunteer.

story:
ENGLISH

Babylon ORCHESTRA is a young, urban Berlin-based Jazz-fusion ensemble that combines European and Middle Eastern musical styles. It fuses a Big Band with a contemporary orchestra and it’s unlike anything you’ve ever heard before. 

Each concert features brand new music and is performed with a level of intensity, passion and soul that remains uncommon in the orchestral world. 

This music has only ever been heard live in concert, until now:

2020 will see the release of the Babylon ORCHESTRA debut album! But we need your help - due to COVID we cannot make a release concert as planned - therefore we are going to produce two MUSIC VIDEOS 

– and with just €14,000 we can make it a reality!

Help us to capture the music to share with a larger audience to enjoy the magic from home, to listen to whenever you want. 

----------------------------------------------------------

DEUTSCH

Babylon ORCHESTRA ist ein junges Fusion Orchester aus Berlin, das auf einzigartige Weise den nahöstlichen Sound mit dem europäischen Orchesterklang Europas verbindet. Es mischt die Big Band mit traditionellen und klassischen Instrumenten und schafft aus dieser besonderen Kombination einen eigenen Stil.

2020 erscheint unsere erste CD - aufgrund der aktuellen COVID Situation können wir kein Release Konzert wie geplant im Juni umsetzen. Stattdessen möchten wir 2 MUSIKVIDEOS produzieren und das Album online promoten - und mit einem Budget von 14.000 € ist das zu schaffen!

Helft uns unsere Musik einem größeren Publikum vorzustellen!

------------------------------------------------------------

BUDGET USE

The money raised will go towards supporting our album release by producing two music videos. By supporting the production you contribute not only to the production team of the video and the musicians involved but also help us share our music beyond the borders of Berlin. All sales from the CD are divided between all musicians involved. 

Production costs of the videos amount to approximately 3000 € and further material and audio recording costs amount to 1000 €.

Furthermore, contributions will benefit the PR campaign (approx. 3000 €) and expenses exceeding the original budget of the CD for author's rights (GEMA), private investments into the CD made by members of the orchestra (8000 €). Donations will be implemented to promote the album, videos and the orchestra through advertisements online and to organise a CD release dinner with all musicians.

 

FILMING

We are glad to have secured acclaimed a young Iranian filmmaker for the shootings - identity to be revealed later!

Filmed in two amazing locations in Berlin we have managed to find friendly deals for our low budget production. Also we invited a very special guest for one of the shooting - but we cannot tell more at the moment for to not spoil the surprise. :)

-------------------------------------------------------------

The aim of the album is to spread the music beyond Berlin’s borders, to introduce new Arabic, Persian, Turkish and fusion jazz music that has never been recorded before and to showcase the young uprising talents who make-up the Babylon ORCHESTRA. 

With compositions written by international guest composers like MAias Alyamani, John Kameel Farah, Layale Chaker, Osama Abdulrasol, Mohannad Nasser and core ensemble members like jazz guitarist Michael Glucksmann, trumpeter Damir Bacikin and artistic director and principal violinist Mischa Tangian, the varied repertoire reflects the orchestra’s many musical backgrounds and cultural interpretations, all of which will be captured on the CD.

A number of special guests will also be featured on the CD, including Persian-Kurdish singer Hani Mojtahedy, acclaimed Syrian singer Rebal Alkhodary

Help us promote this album!

------------------------------------------------------------

Babylon ORCHESTRA is made up of around 15 musicians originating from Syria, Iran, Israel, Russia, Serbia, Poland, Italy, France and Germany. 

The aim of the orchestra is to promote the musical exchange between the Middle East and the West. The ensemble has developed a repertoire where traditional oriental music meets the modern contemporary genre, calling upon various urban elements from the local musical environment in Berlin.

www.babylonorchestra.com

www.facebook.com/babylonorchestra

Instagram: @babylonorchestra

The ensemble has developed a repertoire where traditional oriental music meets the modern contemporary genre, calling upon various urban elements from the local musical environment in Berlin.www.babylonorchestra.comwww.facebook.com/babylonorchestraInstagram: @babylonorchestra

story:
Enregistrement et promotion de notre premier album !

    Afin d'accompagner la sortie de notre premier album dans les meilleures conditions et nous permettre de franchir les étapes suivantes : enregistrement, mixage, mastering, artwork, clips, résidences artistiques, merchandising, presse, radio, streaming, showcase ... nous faisons appel à votre aide !

    A l'issue de plusieurs années d'évolution : concours Premières Scènes, résidences, coaching (avec Michaël Larivière de MLCD), concerts (Reflektor, Fiesta du Rock, ...), démo en studio, interview en radio, logo, merchandising ... Et après deux voyages d’un an au bout du monde, le moment est venu de lancer notre premier album de 11 compositions originales : 

    Buy buy love - Dear fear - Donkeys march - Justice park - Kyoto joke - Midnight heroes - More than a sharing - Nip it in the bud - Now is the new future - Quake like - White collar rebellion​

    Voici un bon aperçu de ce que l'album te réserve dans ce clip tourné sur les lacs gelés de Terre-Neuve :

    A quoi votre aide nous servira-t-elle ?

    Vous nous aiderez à réaliser notre rêve, sortir notre premier album et passer à la vitesse supérieure : obtenir de la visibilité auprès des professionnels (label, booker, manager, radio, festival, ...) et du grand public.

    Voici en toute transparence comment s'organise le cahier des charges de cette campagne :

    1. Enregistrement & mixage (au Studio B de Jérôme Baum à Anthisnes) : 1.800€
       
    2. Mastering (au Leftright Studio de Dan D'Ascenzo à Liège) : 700€
       
    3. Clip vidéo : 1.000€
       
    4. Captation live : 500€
       
    5. Artwork (avec Benjamin Bielen de Ben Graphic Designer à Liège) pour la pochette de l'album, le dossier de presse, le merchandising, ... : 300€
       
    6. Promotion (impression et envoi de dossier de presse et CDs) : 400€
       
    7. Prototypes de merchandising (avec BeLynx Gallery à Liège) : 200€
       
    8. Commission Indiegogo & transactions : 450€

    Comment faire pour nous soutenir ?

    • Vous pouvez choisir une ou plusieurs contreparties : l'album dédicacé en avant-première, une casquette à l'effigie du groupe, 4 entrées guests + 4 verres à l'un de nos futurs concerts, un concert privé dans votre salon, un week-end all-in pour 8 personnes en notre compagnie au bord de la Semois, ...
    • Ou tout simplement faire un don du montant de votre choix via le bouton  en haut de cette page sur PC ou en scrollant tout à droite des récompenses sur smartphone :

     

    Dans tous les cas :

    • vous pourrez encore ajouter des récompenses exclusives juste avant de confirmer votre participation : les paroles de l'album, l'apparition dans notre prochain clip, notre démo digitale de 5 titres, ...
    • vous serez invités au showcase de l'album
    • et nous partagerons régulièrement l'état d'avancement du projet avec vous !

    Partagez notre projet avec le monde entier !

    Un partage nous aide autant qu'une contribution et nous vous en sommes déjà extrêmement reconnaissants !

    • Vous pouvez partager notre crowdfunding https://igg.me/at/digitaldonkeys
    • la vidéo de teasing du crowdfunding

    Facebook : https://fb.watch/2m04JcNowt/

    Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/tv/CILjVmlHSaQ

     Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qJhF04dB3ZU

    • ou notre page de profil

    Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/DigitalDonkeys.music

    Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/digitaldonkeys/

    Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCouE_FvHHQkPLQfAXq-4Twg

    Mais au fait, d'où provient l'univers de cet album ?

    Nous venons d’avoir la trentaine quand l’Âne-Dieu, incarnant l’absurdité de la tendance des masses à se laisser manipuler, nous apparaît et nous désigne comme ses messagers sur terre. Nous avons pour mission de prêcher l’absurde parole : à l'heure où les dindons tendent à disparaître, ne sommes-nous pas devenus les ânes d'une grande farce ? Face à l'engourdissement des peuples, à l'immobilité garantie des nations, aux inactions programmées de nos familles, l'âne illustrerait-il l'absence de poigne ? Pas sûr... 

    Ânement vôtre, Digital Donkeys.

story:
Fresh Vinyl from Jefferson Berry & the UAC

You or someone you know is in love with their record collection.  Old fashioned? Maybe.  But the clarity and warmth of vinyl is a thing of beauty.  And it's making a big come back with people who are serious about their music.

Double Deadbolt Logic was released this Spring, right before the pandemic hit. I love these songs and while the timing of the CD was COVID challenged, the release of the 12" vinyl version of Double Deadbolt Logic is perfect for the holidays.

The test pressing of this record really reveals the production values we were shooting for when we recorded it. It's a record that will make your gift list rock.

Limited Vinyl Pressing

We'll be receiving our shipment of 200 discs on December 1st. We'd like to get half of them out on pre-order to our friends. Preorders should arrive by December 12th with modest postage (which is included in the cost). The more folks you have on your holiday gift list, the more you will save.

  • $30 FOR ONE COPY OF DOUBLE DEADBOLT LOGIC
  • $50 FOR TWO COPIES OF DOUBLE DEADBOLT LOGIC*
  • $60 FOR THREE COPIES OF DOUBLE DEADBOLT LOGIC*

         *. Includes Perks!

COVID & the Musician's Dilemma

While we haven't been able to play these songs live as much as we like (there was The Porch Show, it was a blast)--folks have been digging our songs on Spotify and YouTube.  Get to the Shore is over 10,000 plays on Spotify.  Ghost of California and At the Festival are both around 500 views on YouTube.

But really, musicians need to play out to recoup the costs of producing records. So this Holiday Gift Giving Season, we hope you'll support the local cats who miss playing for you live by purchasing vinyl and CDs.

Guarantee

There are always risks to these type of fundraisers.  The "what ifs".  I guarantee to ship all preorders by December 3rd with media mail postage included. Orders received after December 5th will get bumped up to first class postage.  Need a card to go with a present, we can handle that.

And wait until you hear this! I loved this CD, but the vinyl....mmmm!

story:
I Believe In My Village

Peace and love fam! As an independent artist, the new normal due to the Covid-19 pandemic has discontinued some of the most efficient ways I have been able to sustain in my profession and give you the music and content you've grown to enjoy and appreciate from me. With that being said, I wanted to reach out to my village of fans and supporters to assist in my effort to build my home studio so I can continue to create my soul's expressions. As a token of my appreciation for your support, you will receive a signed copy of my next studio album Boundless Wavelengths before the general public! 

 

You Got Me And I Got You

I know how hard you work for money, and I definitely wouldn't ask for your support without giving something in return.

  • I want to reach a goal of $1200 to buy the necessary studio equipment to continue to produce my art to my fans, supporters, and the world.
  • My tiers of support range from shoutouts on my social media handles to a personalized Eternal song just for you! Here's the kicker, depending on what tier you opt to support in, you will receive all the other tiers that come before it! Any amount you donate will guarantee you a physical or digital copy of Boundless Wavelengths before the general public! 
  • Any and all amounts I receive will go towards my home recording studio, and I'll have the receipts to prove it. 

 

The Impact

What is an Emcee without a microphone? Your support will directly help in the advancement of my career. For that, I will be forever grateful

  • Through my music and moves, I make a point to be an advocate for social justice, the beauty Hip Hop culture, and a humanitarian approach to a better tomorrow for the world. 
  • From my albums, my lectures at prestigious universities, Hip Hop workshops, to my organization Cypher Univercity I live my truths. With your contribution, I will be able to continue to live my truths by producing my next album Boundless Wavelengths, which will be my most personal to date. 

 

2020 Changed The Game

I am absolutely conscious of the gravity of the decision to ask for support for my cause when so many of my people are in the midst of their own challenges trying to navigate this new normal and economy due to Covid-19. If I don't receive a dime from my campaign, I would totally understand. I also understand the power of faith, not only in God but in my community. Support goes way beyond finances, and even if you're personally unable to support financially you may know someone that may see this as a righteous cause, and that would help me tremendously.

 

You Are Appreciated

I thank you for taking the time to consider supporting my campaign. Know that you are appreciated even if you can't support financially. If you rock with my music and message, then pass the link to your people! Check out my music on your digital streaming platform of choice. Subscribe to my YouTube channel. This helps me more than you know.

story:
Hi everyone!

It's crazy times, so I'll try to keep this brief. 

I'm Adam Bauer, and I'm here to ask for your help in finishing my 3rd solo album of original songs for my upcoming album, Return to the Sacred. 

I've spent much of the recent years traveling the world and sharing my love of sacred chanting from the Indian Bhakti yoga tradition. I love singing with people, and I'm always inspired when people respond to this practice with such enthusiasm!

Working with the talented Ben Leinbach producing, and with the help of some great players in India and the USA, I'm now in the last big push to complete this project. The songs are really coming together well, and the mood of the album feels sweet and tender--a welcome counterpoint to this unwanted season of Covid lockdown! We are almost done with recording, which means that I can see the finish line from here--so, with a little help from YOU, my friends, I'll be ready to release this music this summer!

 

I'm trying to raise $10,800 to do the following:

$2800 to finish paying the musicians

$1900 for studio production work to be ready for final mixing

$3000 for studio time to do final mixing with the fabulous Ben Leinbach

$500 to professionally master the final recording and prep it for release 

$700 for album art package, graphic design, etc.

$1000 to press some CDs (for those like me who still like to hold an album in their hands)

+ about $900  to cover the Indiegogo fees + credit card processing fees

If I raise more, I'll have a modest budget for spreading the word, yay! If I raise less, I'll figure it out somehow...one way or another, I will share this music!

 

Perks:

The easiest way to help is simply to pre-purchase the music (on CD or digital download) and within a few short months you'll have the music! 

There's also perks ranging from private Zoom serenades of one song or the whole album, all the way to a full-on Executive Producer credit (for up to two people). I'm trying to keep it simple, but there's a range of options...

 

Why it matters

Music has power to help soothe the heart and heal the soul; sacred & devotional music even more so. I've received such tremendous feedback from folks who have heard this new material that I am hoping this new album will contribute a little sweetness and inspiration during what promises to be the long, strange summer/fall of 2020. 

It takes a village--each one of us--to keep arts, culture and love alive. I promise to do my part to keep offering my voice to the world in a spirit of healing and service. I hope you will join me!

 

Risks & Challenges​

I've already made two albums (Shyam Lila in 2014 and Wonderville in 2017) with the support of you, my global community, and this one is already almost completed--so with your good wishes and support, this record will definitely get done--and soon! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute $$, no worries, I get it--and, it helps a lot if you can help me share the word on social media, so I sure will appreciate your help in sharing the love!

You can easily use the Indiegogo share tools found on this page... <3

story:
Be part of our fan-based album release

Nikki Oniyome recently released the slow disco song save me, and their core listeners covered their tears with glitter and gave it a spin. The upcoming album, however, is constituted of ambient and mournful beats, this time experimenting with new-age elements and psychoacoustics.

With a slight nod to the works of Portishead, Björk, Fever Ray, Lamb, and other forms of weird and existential beats, the song based album is colored by unusual sounds and weird ideas in the production, making an alluring backdrop to the distinct female vocal.

Try out some sad beats you can't help but dance to. Cover your tears with glitter and give Nikki Oniyome a spin in the video above. Immerse yourself in the mournful beats of Nikki and let's make this album happen together. 

 

Who are we, you might ask?

Nikki Oniyome is the heart child of songwriter, vocalist and guitarist Lisa Canlinha, producer Jørgen Skjulstad (aka Center of the Universe), and bass player Vebjørn Axelsen. In 2017 they released their first two singles, followed by their debut EP 水 Sui/Mizu in 2018, described by reviewers as «strangely beautiful and strangely twisted» (Your Dead Partner), captivating «with unusual sounds, weird ideas and a successful production» (Global Music Magazine).

We are part of the music collective Metronomicon Audio, consisting of a wide range of affiliates which together aim to promote new and interesting music. We have chosen to focus on individual members’ freedom to make music they like, and the community has a flat structure where the artists themselves have full artistic control.  

Metronomicon Audio started in 2001. As of today the community has produced more than 100 releases. Among these we find in addition to a lot of CDR and CD and vinyls, even more obscure formats such as circuit boards and USB sticks.  

So as you understand, we are independent artists, which means we rely 100% on our fans to help us continue making music. If you purchase anything directly from us - whether a t-shirt, digital or physical music - you can rest assured that you've just done a very good thing in supporting music

 

Money Talk

  • Mastering and pressing of Vinyl and CD costs us €4,000.  Being part of a music collective we are so lucky to have access to our own studio at just €800 a year as a membership. The recording, studio work, editing and mixing has been done for free by the excellent Jørgen Skjulstad (who is in fact quite a reputable producer here in Norway!) just because his heart is of pure gold. This has been paid for by blood, sweat and tears, including funds from gigs we play, and synchronistic blessings along our path! Our dream is merely that this album will be self-liquidating, that means that sales will pay for all the costs of what it takes for us to make this music. 
  • A music video by Melissa Follestad costs us from €1,000 and €2,000 to record. Follestad has until now made all of the videos for free for us. Through her art film company Monkeyhill Creations, she has recent years become increasingly reknown, collaborating with Norwegian stardoms such as Gundelach. There is only until a certain moment that such an artist can do work otherwise paid for free. With your help, we can continue the visual profile that Melissa has established for us, by creating more stunning music videos to color our music. 
  • It costs us €500/month to do a minimum of PR during the launch. If we try to do PR around the launch for 4 months, that's €2000. 
  • Our goal is to raise €7,000  to pay for the mastering and pressing of vinyl and CD, as well as the music video and PR required to bring this album to life. You with us? 

 

What You Get

  • Limited edition bundle of unsigned or signed vinyl and CDs.  We have pressed a very limited edition of each physical item. Depending on how much of a co-creator of this album would you like to be, there will be additional perks like specially designed and signed t-shirts and art work, polaroid photos from the studio sessions, and hand written lyrics for those who really want to be a intimate part of our crew. 
  • Host a House Concert. We are currently booking a Nikki Oniyome 2020 tour! Hop on our tour schedule now and we will offer a House Concert in your community or playing a private show for you and your closest friends or your favorite organization. 
  • Sponsor a video. For those interested in putting their creative stamp on this project, there are a limited number of videos available, 6 to be exact. Sponsor a video and choose which song you will bring to life. Listen to the new music in it's entirety before everyone else and take a 'sneak peek' at the creative vision for the video you are bringing to life. Send an email to nikki@nikkioniyome.no if you would like to claim a video. 
  • Swag. There WILL BE plenty of opportunities for you to wear our t-shirt, raise your glass, and show off your support in the name of mournful bliss. Stay tuned as the reward section will expand and contract throughout the campaign. 

 

The Impact

We are  100% independent and it is entirely up to two people - Nikki & Jørgen - to be responsible for all the financing, managing of the entire project, the merchandice -- the lot!  It's quite an undertaking and many people do not understand why we bother to invest this much into this musical project just for the love of it.  

Most people today are used to streaming music for free or a small monthly fee, and have little knowledge of the cost behind much of the music they are listening to. Especially when you are doing it without the support from one of the major labels! 

We do this because we prefer the freedom to make whatever music we choose, without the middle men in corporate suits. As a consequence of this, we have been blessed with a very intimate relationship with our listeners. You, our listener, enables us to create music off the beaten track and made for all the musical loners out there. 

By pre-ordering a bundle for a limited time you become a trusted part of the team surrounding us. Your contribution is what will bring this album into the world. 

 

How you can partner with us

  • Pre-order an exclusive bundle
  • Join the official Nikki O. Street Team
  • Post the bundle you bought on Facebook or Instagram
  • Encourage your friends and music lovers to also join the team! 

 

Small efforts matter - if you are not able to buy any of the music this time around - even just sharing to your social media and telling people about us will ALWAYS be of a great help. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

  • In the unlikely event that we will not be able to finance any of the physical items you will of course be refunded all of your contributions.
  • All the bundles are included shipping, so there will be no additional costs for you, once you have made your contribution.
  • The bundles will be shipped primo December, and we hope that you will have them delivered before or by Christmas!
  • A risk is of course, that the shipping will be slow, due to Christmas, and that your bundle will arrive after Christmas.
  • If in doubt of where your bundle is, make sure you get in touch with us at nikki@nikkioniyome.no
story_txt:
Be part of our fan-based album release
Nikki Oniyome recently released the slow disco song save me, and their core listeners covered their tears with glitter and gave it a spin. The upcoming album, however, is constituted of ambient and mournful beats, this time experimenting with new-age elements and psychoacoustics.
With a slight nod to the works of Portishead, Björk, Fever Ray, Lamb, and other forms of weird and existential beats, the song based album is colored by unusual sounds and weird ideas in the production, making an alluring backdrop to the distinct female vocal.
Try out some sad beats you can't help but dance to. Cover your tears with glitter and give Nikki Oniyome a spin in the video above. Immerse yourself in the mournful beats of Nikki and let's make this album happen together. 
 
Who are we, you might ask?
Nikki Oniyome is the heart child of songwriter, vocalist and guitarist Lisa Canlinha, producer Jørgen Skjulstad (aka Center of the Universe), and bass player Vebjørn Axelsen. In 2017 they released their first two singles, followed by their debut EP 水 Sui/Mizu in 2018, described by reviewers as «strangely beautiful and strangely twisted» (Your Dead Partner), captivating «with unusual sounds, weird ideas and a successful production» (Global Music Magazine).
We are part of the music collective Metronomicon Audio, consisting of a wide range of affiliates which together aim to promote new and interesting music. We have chosen to focus on individual members’ freedom to make music they like, and the community has a flat structure where the artists themselves have full artistic control.  
Metronomicon Audio started in 2001. As of today the community has produced more than 100 releases. Among these we find in addition to a lot of CDR and CD and vinyls, even more obscure formats such as circuit boards and USB sticks.  
So as you understand, we are independent artists, which means we rely 100% on our fans to help us continue making music. If you purchase anything directly from us - whether a t-shirt, digital or physical music - you can rest assured that you've just done a very good thing in supporting music
 
Money Talk


Mastering and pressing of Vinyl and CD costs us €4,000.  Being part of a music collective we are so lucky to have access to our own studio at just €800 a year as a membership. The recording, studio work, editing and mixing has been done for free by the excellent Jørgen Skjulstad (who is in fact quite a reputable producer here in Norway!) just because his heart is of pure gold. This has been paid for by blood, sweat and tears, including funds from gigs we play, and synchronistic blessings along our path! Our dream is merely that this album will be self-liquidating, that means that sales will pay for all the costs of what it takes for us to make this music. 

A music video by Melissa Follestad costs us from €1,000 and €2,000 to record. Follestad has until now made all of the videos for free for us. Through her art film company Monkeyhill Creations, she has recent years become increasingly reknown, collaborating with Norwegian stardoms such as Gundelach. There is only until a certain moment that such an artist can do work otherwise paid for free. With your help, we can continue the visual profile that Melissa has established for us, by creating more stunning music videos to color our music. 

It costs us €500/month to do a minimum of PR during the launch. If we try to do PR around the launch for 4 months, that's €2000. 

Our goal is to raise €7,000  to pay for the mastering and pressing of vinyl and CD, as well as the music video and PR required to bring this album to life. You with us? 

 
What You Get


Limited edition bundle of unsigned or signed vinyl and CDs.  We have pressed a very limited edition of each physical item. Depending on how much of a co-creator of this album would you like to be, there will be additional perks like specially designed and signed t-shirts and art work, polaroid photos from the studio sessions, and hand written lyrics for those who really want to be a intimate part of our crew. 

Host a House Concert. We are currently booking a Nikki Oniyome 2020 tour! Hop on our tour schedule now and we will offer a House Concert in your community or playing a private show for you and your closest friends or your favorite organization. 

Sponsor a video. For those interested in putting their creative stamp on this project, there are a limited number of videos available, 6 to be exact. Sponsor a video and choose which song you will bring to life. Listen to the new music in it's entirety before everyone else and take a 'sneak peek' at the creative vision for the video you are bringing to life. Send an email to nikki@nikkioniyome.no if you would like to claim a video. 

Swag. There WILL BE plenty of opportunities for you to wear our t-shirt, raise your glass, and show off your support in the name of mournful bliss. Stay tuned as the reward section will expand and contract throughout the campaign. 

 
The Impact
We are  100% independent and it is entirely up to two people - Nikki & Jørgen - to be responsible for all the financing, managing of the entire project, the merchandice -- the lot!  It's quite an undertaking and many people do not understand why we bother to invest this much into this musical project just for the love of it.  
Most people today are used to streaming music for free or a small monthly fee, and have little knowledge of the cost behind much of the music they are listening to. Especially when you are doing it without the support from one of the major labels! 
We do this because we prefer the freedom to make whatever music we choose, without the middle men in corporate suits. As a consequence of this, we have been blessed with a very intimate relationship with our listeners. You, our listener, enables us to create music off the beaten track and made for all the musical loners out there.

All the bundles are included shipping, so there will be no additional costs for you, once you have made your contribution.

story:
Help make Marissa's 4th album

“Marissa writes really catchy songs that draw you in with the melody, but keep you with the smart lyrics. Ever since I heard her for the first time, I wanted to hear more.”

- Lisa Loeb [Grammy-winning Singer/Songwriter]

 

It has been almost 8 years since I released 63 Songs About Joe and that is far too long. Time to record a new EP with some of the songs I've been writing lately.

For the past 5 years I have been spending my summers at a songwriting retreat with the lovely and talented Dar Williams. From those retreats I have a trunk full of more mature and emotional songs just waiting to be recorded and put out into the world. That is why I'm asking for help.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

It takes money to record an album, even an EP. I plan on traveling up to Medford, MA where I recorded 63 Songs About Joe and work with the very talented Ducky Carlisle in his studio with producer Brian King of the band Parks.  The studio, Ducky and Brian all cost money.  In addition, I would like to hire a publicist to help spread the word once the record is done.

The good news is 1/5 songs is already recorded, mixed and mastered so I only need to record 4 more songs.

I would like to raise $10,000 to make this album. It's a large sum on money but not impossible to raise. This would pay for studio time, musicians for the record, mixing and mastering of the record and marketing and publicity to get the record out in the world.

 

Perks

For perks I will be offering downloads of the record when it's complete, gift sets of my past records, mystery merch bags, cakes, performances, custom songs and more! But don't do it for the perks, do it for the music!

story:
Short Summary

We are in our final steps of finishing our new EP - Album "Serenity". We need help financing the mixing and mastering of the record! 

  • Who am i? My name is Hans-Marius Johnsen and i am a 23 year old music-artist from Norway. My artificial name is HM Johnsen, and i am soon to release my second "album" called Serenity. I have toured with my band over 50 shows in 2018, and i started to write and compose my new EP in March 2019. The lyrics and melodies are a big step up for me, and tells stories of the modern insanity within our minds, attached and slaved to our screens and busyness.
  • Campaign: I work with my producer Eirik Grønner, together with Idar, Ole-Markus and Judah we have been working hard and focused on my new music. And we need your help to finance the mastering and mixing part of the EP. This is very important to make the "sound" of the EP. We simply cannot release it before this is done! 
  • Financial: I have spent all of my own money in to this project, and i have had one goal! That is to make the music as good and important as possible! That cost money in these days. Both me and the band are glad for any financial support! It doesn't have to bee single big amounts of financial help, it can be many different small or big funds,  depending on what each individual wants to give or are able to. We appreciate all help we can get. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • WE NEED! 30 000 NOK. We have calculated a budget on 20 000 NOK for the mixing of 5 songs, and 10 000 NOK for the Mastering of the songs. We have gathered prices from different approved mastering companies, and we see that we are going to land on aprox 10 000 for the Mastering. The mixing is calculated with our mixing engineer to 20 000 NOK. 
  • When we reach our goal! The EP will be available on every single approved music streaming and purchasing portal. Such as Spotify, Tidal, Youtube, iTunes etc.... In my and my producers mind, the music that we are making is something new and exciting. With us, we have some of the biggest promotors in the country, and also an amount of good and professional people working with making this EP a well noticed and apriechiated one. 
  • If wee don't reach our goal? We are going to spend the money we earn in the EP prosess, no matter how much we get. The more we get, the sooner and better the music and te prosess will be. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • MAKE SOME NOISE! Please feel free to share the campaign on your Social Medias, or with your friends and family. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

READ MORE ABOUT ME, THE BAND AND FOLLOW US ON OUR SOCIAL MEDIAS!

@hm_johnsen

www.hmjohnsen.com

story:
I'm so excited to be recording my first professional album!

 “I remember the first time I heard Andree sing... There's a depth and quality to her voice that I feel coming from a place deep inside, down the well, into a place of pure unfiltered emotion.”

Thank you for being here. 

The Team

Over the last couple of years I’ve been collaborating with the ever eloquent guitarist, songwriter and long-time performing artist Christopher Shortall. Chris has been performing and recording for the last 35 years. With his steady mentorship, we have written a collection of songs that are ready to be captured in their moment of time. This music is simple and clear in its ability to open the heart and move the soul.

Producer and recording artist Logan Thorpe has agreed to help bring this album to life. Most of the money raised will go towards paying him for his musical gift of production; he is also offering a significant donation of his time in-kind. I’m excited to work with him, he is a dear friend and brings joy wherever he goes.

Timeline

We expect to work six months to complete this project, recording the final track at the Zenith Retreat Centre in Anderson Lake, BC. We will be recording a special choral acapella track on-site with the voices of good friends, including opera singer Sarah McSweeney and family in the remote mountains of British Columbia. This track will capture the beauty and simplicity of the water, sky, and land where good friends gather.

Budget Breakdown

  • Production (Logan Thorpe): setup, recording, arrangement, mix, edit - $3800 (from $7800 – producer has offered  52% as an in-kind donation)
  • Mastering - $30/song - $300
  • Photography & graphic design (Chloe Krolak) $150
  • Guitar and background vocals (Christopher Shortall) - $1200
  • Studio rental, equipment rental/purchase & artist supplies - $1583
  • 200 copies of the CD printed by CD Baby with art jacket and online distribution $467

Total Funding Goal: $7500
Revenue: I will be applying for grants and personally contributing to this goal. 

* any additional funds raised will be put towards paying the artists, marketing, licensing & digital distribution, and travel expenses.  

Thank you so much for supporting independent music. 

Andree

story:
Mental Health Day - The Band

As a band, we focus on music that moves us. We write songs that mean something to us. The band name is a play on words, sure, but it's also something that matters to us. This new album reflects the struggles we (us and you!) go through in life, and how important it is to keep fighting, and keep talking. It's about 2nd and 3rd and 4th chances. It's about getting a little better ever time. It's about struggling even when things are good. It's about helping each other. It's about continuing to live. And most importantly, it's about never, EVER giving up. 

This campaign for us is not about the money, though it will help. We'll be putting this record out even if we don't raise a dime. It's about connecting with you, and trying to get the music and message out to as many people as we possibly can.  We want to build a community, and to support each other, even outside of the music. 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down in more detail:

  • Any money we do receive will go initially to recouping costs of post-production. 
  • Anything beyond that, we will reinvest in the band. Equipment, tee-shirts, stickers.
  • Even if we don't reach any specific monetary goals, we will still be putting the album out and making it available to purchase and stream. 
  • We're creating tiered reward systems with lots of fun little perks for your donations.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people would like to help, but aren't able to make financial contributions. That's okay! You can still help!

  • Spread the word! Please forward this campaign to other friends and family. There are sharing options below!
  • Keep listening to songs (Our first album is still available for purchase and streaming on just about all of the major platforms such as iTunes, Spotify, etc...).
  • Come out to shows! Most of our shows are free or very cheap, and we'd love to see you there.
  • Oh and one more thing...Anyone know any drummers that enjoy playing this type of music? Send them our way, we're looking to add a drummer to handle live show duties!

story:
Eugen Botos

Young passionate keyboardist and composer is a multi-talented musical visionary who has found a way to break down the boundaries and brought together the often unfairly separated worlds of contemporary jazz fusion and urban pop music.

At the conservatory (2002) he founded a jazz-funk band titled “Eugen Botos Finally“ with Robert Vizvari (bassist) and Martin Koleda (guitarist). All of them were brought up on Chick Corea ́s Electric Band and Mark King ́s Level 42. They has spanned the musical genres of contemporary jazz fusion, R&B, funk, urban pop music, hip-hop, etno and latin music. Eugen Botos and his music can be definitely seen as a new fresh and innovating energy in the jazz genre.

The band became more visible in 2008 when Eugen started to cooperate with famous American saxophonist Eric Marienthal and Finally became his band for European concerts. These performances moved them forward to finish their debut album called My Space (2010). There are also another famous guests, great musicians, on this album as Canadian bassist Alain Caron, Venezuelan pianist Otmaro Ruiz, bassist Janek Gwizdala, guitarist Harri Stojka and American pianist Peter Horvath.

In 2011 the band Finally had a concert tour in Slovakia with great musician Gary Bias, the saxophonist from the band Earth Wind and Fire. In 2013 Finally and Sheldon Reynolds had a concert tour throughout central Europe and in 2014 the band appeared again at Bratislava Jazz Days. Eugen Botos and Finally are relesed a second CD album (Final Definition) which was released in japan label P-Vine in 2016 with many special guests again like: Brian McKnight – R&B singer, Maysa Leak - smooth jazz singer also known as a former singer of British band Incognito, Sheldon Reynolds - singer of Eart Wind and Fire, Eric Marienthal saxophone player, Angela Johnson - jazz singer, Jeff Lorber - jazz piano player and producer, Marcus Miller multiinstrumentalist and bass guitar player, Brian McKnight – R&B singer , legendary Dionne Warwick sings on Botos tune called "Symphony of broken hearts", Victor Wooten play bass battle with Robert Vizvari on track " L.A. Funk". “From that point, the writing and recording of Final Definition was something like a puzzle, but also full of many dreams come true, as I began working with so many artists who are heroes of mine, from Dave Weckl and Marcus Miller to Victor Wooten and Brian McKnight,” says Botos. “I draw from many musical influences, including the fusion jazz we did on My Space, as well as pop, pop-jazz, R&B, funk and even Latin music.

In 2019 Eugene Botos invite for his Slovakian tour one of the most talented drummer - Pete Ray Biggin from Level 42. They record one of their live performance in club Blue Note and Eugene wants to released this fantastic concert on DVD and CD.

With this campaign, I am asking all of you to be directly involved in this project from the very start so that I can complete my LIVE DVD record. Thats why we asks for a crowdfunding.

All The world needs good funk music!

The band became more visible in 2008 when Eugen started to cooperate with famous American saxophonist Eric Marienthal and Finally became his band for European concerts. These performances moved them forward to finish their debut album called My Space (2010). There are also another famous guests, great musicians, on this album as Canadian bassist Alain Caron, Venezuelan pianist Otmaro Ruiz, bassist Janek Gwizdala, guitarist Harri Stojka and American pianist Peter Horvath.
In 2011 the band Finally had a concert tour in Slovakia with great musician Gary Bias, the saxophonist from the band Earth Wind and Fire. In 2013 Finally and Sheldon Reynolds had a concert tour throughout central Europe and in 2014 the band appeared again at Bratislava Jazz Days. Eugen Botos and Finally are relesed a second CD album (Final Definition) which was released in japan label P-Vine in 2016 with many special guests again like: Brian McKnight – R&B singer, Maysa Leak - smooth jazz singer also known as a former singer of British band Incognito, Sheldon Reynolds - singer of Eart Wind and Fire, Eric Marienthal saxophone player, Angela Johnson - jazz singer, Jeff Lorber - jazz piano player and producer, Marcus Miller multiinstrumentalist and bass guitar player, Brian McKnight – R&B singer , legendary Dionne Warwick sings on Botos tune called "Symphony of broken hearts", Victor Wooten play bass battle with Robert Vizvari on track " L.A. Funk". “From that point, the writing and recording of Final Definition was something like a puzzle, but also full of many dreams come true, as I began working with so many artists who are heroes of mine, from Dave Weckl and Marcus Miller to Victor Wooten and Brian McKnight,” says Botos. “I draw from many musical influences, including the fusion jazz we did on My Space, as well as pop, pop-jazz, R&B, funk and even Latin music.
In 2019 Eugene Botos invite for his Slovakian tour one of the most talented drummer - Pete Ray Biggin from Level 42. They record one of their live performance in club Blue Note and Eugene wants to released this fantastic concert on DVD and CD.
With this campaign, I am asking all of you to be directly involved in this project from the very start so that I can complete my LIVE DVD record. Thats why we asks for a crowdfunding.
All The world needs good funk music!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jeremy Crooks, also known as Made By Crooks, and I'm an artist based in Pasadena, CA by way of Sacramento, CA. For the past year, I've been performing at shows all around California promoting my latest album ALLISON. It has been a dream of mine to be able to tour this album, and the time has finally come!

I've been blessed enough to be able to partner with SoFar Sounds for a west coast tour this summer, from Southern California all the way up to Vancouver! SoFar Sounds is a highly regarded organization that throws secret shows in over 400 cities around the world. My band and I have personally performed already at SoFar San Francisco and SoFar San Diego, and every show sells out well in advance. The shows cater to a stripped back, acoustic sound, offering an intimate experience for listeners, and a chance for artists to personally connect with potential fans and supporters. Artists like Billie Eilish, Ed Sheeran, Leon Bridges, Lianne La Havas, and Yebba have performed for SoFar in their careers.

This tour would allow audiences in other cities and states the ability to experience a full live set from my band and me. We've been polishing our set since October of last year, and we would love to be able to perform music for audiences all over!

This is where I need your help! My band and I are all still up-and-coming, and that means that we all work part time or full time jobs in addition to pursuing our dreams. As much as this 3 1/2 week tour will be great at gaining us some momentum, it'll also be hitting us hard on our wallets. It would be amazing to have some financial support, so we can carry out this entire tour without financial stress being a factor. We've all spent well into a decade working at our individual crafts, and can assure an amazing show wherever we go. In exchange for your contributions, I'm offering some awesome gifts and perks!

 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is $12,000 and funds from this campaign will go directly into compensating my band, travel costs, food and lodging.

We have 8 contribution tiers for supporters to choose from!

  • The first tier is the “Aye, you’re pretty good” package, which includes a written Thank You card, Made By Crooks stickers, MBC Logo Pin, and a signed copy of ALLISON.
  • The second tier is the “Your music is nice” package, which includes everything in the first tier, plus an MBC Dad Hat (color of your choice) and an invite to a secret album release show for my next project. That’s right, I’m holding a secret album release show for my next project and Indiegogo contributors will have an exclusive invite to it!
  • The third tier is the “I really dig your merch” package, which includes everything in the second tier plus an MBC Long Sleeve shirt.
  • The fourth tier is the “For real, I fux with you heavy” package, which includes everything in the third tier plus an MBC hoodie of your choice and the option of getting the MBC Patch Tee instead of MBC Long Sleeve shirt.
  • The fifth tier is the “I’ve been a fan since Day 1” package, which includes everything in the fourth tier plus an extra MBC Dad Hat and Thank You credits on the next album. I’ma give you a proper shout out for being down with my work for real for real.
  • The sixth tier is the “I’ma need everything you got” package, which includes an MBC Dad Hat in every color, both MBC hoodies, the MBC Long Sleeve shirt, MBC Patch Tee, along with a written Thank You card, MBC Logo pin, signed copy of ALLISON, invite to the secret album release show AND Thank You credits on the next project. Basically, it’s a steal meant for the truest Crooks supporter.
  • The seventh tier is the “I wanna get to know you thru more than just the music” package, which includes everything in the sixth tier plus a Meet and Greet Lunch with yours truly. We’ll go out for a bit, eat a dope meal at a fairly expensive joint, and chop it up on whatever you wanna talk about.
  • The eighth and last tier is the “P. Diddy, I wanna be all up in the music video” package. This includes everything in the sixth tier plus a cameo in my next music video. You’ll forever be ingrained in Made By Crooks history, and can tell your kids...look! I starred in a music video before that guy blew up!

 

The Impact

This tour would not only be extremely important for my music, but also for my band. I always work hard with the intention of providing opportunities for the ones around me. This tour would give my band and me great exposure in cities some of us have never even been to. It'll also give audiences in other cities and states the chance to experience a really dope set of music! Plus, with your contribution, you would allow us the opportunity to focus solely on the music, without the worry of being able to pay rent, pay bills, or eat food when we get back. For me personally, you'll be helping kick start my leap of faith into doing music full time. This tour can be a great success, but it can also carry a lot of risks. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Organizing a tour is a feat in and of itself. Most bands have a manager, booking agent, or tour manager to help plan and route a tour. For me, I went ahead and planned the entire tour myself with some added help of SoFar Sounds SF City Director, Karim Saleh. We reached out to a bunch of SoFar cities on the West Coast and were able to get in contact with a good portion of them, enough to route a tour! The challenge now is funding the tour. I've been reaching out to brands for sponsorship, saved up some of my own money, and am launching this Indiegogo campaign to try to reach my calculated budget for the tour.

The tour budget will be used to compensate my bandmates, take care of food, travel and lodging expenses. Since we'll be out for three weeks or so, some of us will either be taking extended leaves of absence from work, using up a TON of PTO, or just quitting our jobs! It's pretty insane, but is also personifies the belief and willingness to take risks that's needed to keep momentum moving in the music industry. It's a tough business for sure, and requires a lot of sacrifice. We're hoping with your help, we can take some of the mental stress and load off of our financial plates, so we won't be worrying quite as much when we get back from tour.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would love for your contribution at any capacity! Purchasing any of the 8 tiers of Perks would be amazing for my band and me, but we could also just use your help in spreading this Indiegogo campaign around!

Share the campaign link, talk to your family, friends and coworkers about it, or use any of the social media buttons at the top to share this campaign across your social media platforms!

story:
Who are we?

Pluck & Rail is an original acoustic trio who sound like The Punch, Avett and Felice Brothers all got into a brawl over who loved Gillian Welch the most.  They've been performing together since 2014 and released their first record, Trigger, in 2016.  Pluck & Rail blend together guitar, cello, banjo, mandolin, standup bass and vocal harmonies together in original, eclectic tunes that are energetic and emotional.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need money.  Unfortunately, the record business doesn't work the way it used to, and this is where the fans come in.  Crowd-funding allows you to be part of the project - part of the art!  Art cannot survive without patrons.  You make this all possible.

Your generosity will purchase hours of studio time, hours of mixing and mastering, art design, production and promotion.

Your donation also comes with perks.  A small donation will get you a copy of the album.  Think of it as pre-paying for something you'd buy at a show anyway in the future.  Donations will get you on the guest list for the record release party.  Bigger donation will get you bigger and better perks such as a house concert at your place or entrance to a Pluck & Rail pool party and concert.  All donations big or small are GREATLY APPRECIATED!

If you cannot donate at this time but would like to support our efforts, you can post to social media about us and this campaign.  Word of mouth goes a long way.

If you have any questions or concerns, you can write them in the comments section.

story:
*Pour lire notre campagne en français c'est ici! 

Choeur Maha: Innovating in choral music

 

This season, let your senses indulge in choral music like you’ve never seen or heard before. Choeur Maha is premiering a live and co-creative choral experience with our audience! We are setting out to create a unique, multidisciplinary and immersive performance of an original contemporary piece, breaking ground in the genre. We couldn’t be more excited to share this project with you.  

 

Maha, a renewable source of feminism, high-level performance and community 

Choeur Maha was founded in 1991 by composer and performer Kathy Kennedy and visual artist Su Schnee. The choir has delighted audiences for two decades with their creative repertoire, singing in as many languages and styles as possible, from Hildegard von Bingen to Hildegard Westerkamp; from Mozart to Madonna and incorporating a healthy dose of electroacoustic music for good measure.

Our name is always associated with innovative feminist music, high energy performances and a decidedly non-traditional take on choral music. The choir has been a pillar of support for women’s choral music in Montreal, helping the public understand and appreciate women’s choral music and the different arts tied to musical performance. Maha has produced some of the city’s most memorable musical interventions and guerrilla performances incorporating technology and social commentary and continually turns heads. 

Choeur Maha is well-known for its support of women’s organizations throughout Montreal and holds a charitable status as a non-profit organization.

 

A new live approach to choral music 

Choeur Maha breaks the mold yet again.

The project will give life to an original composition by Kim Farris-Manning, our commissioned composer-in-residence. Chorister and writer Christelle Saint-Julien provides the words to the piece, which are inspired by a beautifully profound essay she wrote about memory and time. The idea of pairing a contemporary piece of music to thermal technology came to Kim during a conversation with mechanical engineer Anaïssa Franca, and the possibilities of illustrating music through time, space and energetic realms became endless. 

This commissioned composition will take the form of a 30-40 min transdisciplinary piece.  

The way it works: different thermal and motion sensors will be set up around the performance hall. Taking the live data from each sensor, the projection designer will create projections which will create visual expressions of the moving bodies and changing energies. This way, the movement of bodies in the audience will impact the resulting piece. The score, with composed sections, will allow for improvisatory sections, which breaks from traditional ways of understanding choral music.

By supporting the making of this piece, you are supporting female and non-binary identifying singers, composers, artists and engineers emerging from Montreal.

 

Choeur Maha Composer in residence

Kim Farris-Manning is a versatile composer, multimedia artist and keyboard player (piano, organ, harpsichord). Kim studied Composition and Piano at the University of Victoria (BMus'18), where she was introduced to sculpture by Mowry Baden and Daniel Laskarin. Her work is often made in collaboration with artists and creative thinkers from other disciplines, resulting in performances worldwide led by organizations such as the Canadian Music Centre, Quatuor Bozzini, and the Ostrava Days Festival (Czech Republic).

 

Choeur Maha Artistic Director

Megan Batty is a bilingual choral music educator based out of Montreal and Ottawa. She is currently pursuing an M.A. in Musicology with a focus in Feminist studies (McGill) and holds a B.Mus. in Voice and B.Ed./O.C.T. in vocal music (Queen’s). Choeur Maha allows Megan to combine her passion for feminist theory, and her desire to form community through musical projects. 

Collaborators 

Anaïssa Franca - Mechanical engineer 

Christelle Saint-Julien - Writer 

TBA - Projection designer 

 

We need your contribution 

 

We cannot wait to see you there and share with you this unique musical experience.

We are 3000$ short of making this performance happening. The funding we get will determine how elaborate our special performance will be. 

 All your donations will be used towards production costs (sensors, projection, equipment, venue) and to compensate our collaborators (composer, musicians, engineers, artists). Choeur Maha is a non-profit organization whose revenue is based on ticket sales. 

We are committed to making and performing the piece. Choeur Maha is a registered not-for-profit organization and exists solely for artistic purposes: all funding we receive gets reinvested into the choral community through our concerts and through musical projects like  this multidisciplinary artistic performance. By supporting our choir, you are investing in the growth of choral music in Canada.

Choeur Maha is also a registered charity with the Canada Revenue Agency.  For any donation of 20$ or more, Choeur Maha can issue a tax receipt which will be sent to donors via e-mail before February 28th of the year following the year the donation was made. To claim your tax receipt, please email us at choeurmaha@gmail.com before February 1st. 

 

Show your support! 

Your help matters! We are grateful for contributions that are non-monetary, such as spreading the word about our project. 

Like our page on Facebook and share our campaign posts and updates with your circle on your feed

Email your community with our Indiegogo fundraising  campaign using this link.

 

We sing for you.


Choeur Maha

story:
Thank you so much for showing interest in supporting the music that I make! 

In the course of my career, I’ve experienced the music industry as an exciting, creative world full of possibility and opportunity. At the best of times, it’s been challenging but rewarding. At the same time, it is rife with power dynamics, manipulation, and legal battles. Sadly, I have been witnessing this first hand as my debut album Wild Heart has been withdrawn and withheld from all streaming services without my consent, due to conflict with someone I once worked closely with. It’s devastating to have a project I poured so much creative energy, love and financial resources into, taken away from me overnight. 

I have decided that the best way to move forward from this loss is to find a silver lining! My goal with this Indiegogo is to reclaim and re-record a live version of Wild Heart to share with all of you! I want this experience to celebrate and honour all that Wild Heart was in 2017, while allowing a new version to be born that reflects where I’m at musically today, and my personal growth since that time.

From hurt and confusion, a new album and a community gathering is being born! I can't wait to share it with you!!!

I am going to be performing at Bluelight Studios in Vancouver on December 5th, recording video and audio of the whole evening. Soon after I will be able to offer you the full album along with live videos on all major streaming services! I am SO excited about this performance and to share the final album with you. The vibrant energy from the musicians matched with the exciting bustle of the live audience makes this form of recording my absolute favourite and I know it is going to make this album so special! 

As you can imagine, creating an album is no small job. In some ways, a live album can make things a little bit easier financially but it's still a lot to put together.  It takes an immense amount of time, energy and resources to coordinate a project like this. Expenses such as paying musicians, audio engineers, photographers, videographers, graphic designers, publicists, editors, etc. add  up very quickly.

I know there are a million places to put your hard earned money and I cannot tell you enough how much I appreciate your help! Choosing to put money into this project is a choice to support artists autonomy over what they create and a choice to support art that centres healing and growth.

 Every little bit helps and I am endlessly grateful for your contributions. If you are unable to contribute, sharing this cause is vey helpful as well :)

Music is medicine and this world is definitely in need of more medicine. I hope to be able to continuously support the beings of this planet by sharing my gifts and I hope you continue to share yours as well! 

Thank you again!!

 PS. I will also be sharing 2 new songs with the crowd and will be live streaming the whole show!

I want this experience to celebrate and honour all that Wild Heart was in 2017, while allowing a new version to be born that reflects where I’m at musically today, and my personal growth since that time.From hurt and confusion, a new album and a community gathering is being born! I can't wait to share it with you!!!I am going to be performing at Bluelight Studios in Vancouver on December 5th, recording video and audio of the whole evening. Soon after I will be able to offer you the full album along with live videos on all major streaming services! I am SO excited about this performance and to share the final album with you. The vibrant energy from the musicians matched with the exciting bustle of the live audience makes this form of recording my absolute favourite and I know it is going to make this album so special! As you can imagine, creating an album is no small job. In some ways, a live album can make things a little bit easier financially but it's still a lot to put together.  It takes an immense amount of time, energy and resources to coordinate a project like this. Expenses such as paying musicians, audio engineers, photographers, videographers, graphic designers, publicists, editors, etc. add  up very quickly.I know there are a million places to put your hard earned money and I cannot tell you enough how much I appreciate your help! Choosing to put money into this project is a choice to support artists autonomy over what they create and a choice to support art that centres healing and growth. Every little bit helps and I am endlessly grateful for your contributions. If you are unable to contribute, sharing this cause is vey helpful as well :)Music is medicine and this world is definitely in need of more medicine. I hope to be able to continuously support the beings of this planet by sharing my gifts and I hope you continue to share yours as well! Thank you again!! PS. I will also be sharing 2 new songs with the crowd and will be live streaming the whole show!

story:
A Note from Chris

Hey Friends!

I'm inviting you to join me as I record my new studio album!     

Early in 2020, I had just started working on my new record. Then COVID hit and turned all our lives upside down. My entire 2020 tour schedule disappeared instantly, and the revenue I was relying on to finance the record evaporated almost overnight.

While I’m very grateful for the extra time I’ve been able to spend with my family, and keeping them safe has been my top priority, I'm not giving up on this project.  

While I've been able to complete some of the record, and have been funding it myself so far, I’m seeking your help in completing it.

I am kindly asking you to please pre-purchase it now so my team and I can afford to finish it.  

I know times are tough for everyone, and we are not seeking donations, but pre-purchasing it now will make all the difference - we need the funds to keep going!  

If you are interested, there are additional perks available, such as my personal songwriting journals, studio visits, guitar lessons, a house concert, etc.  Take a look to see if something suits your budget!

If you've enjoyed my past albums, and are excited to hear the latest, please pick an incentive that fits your budget and join our team!

 

The Team

The new record is being co-produced by myself and Juno-Award winning producer Derek Downham (Paul Reddick, Broken Social Scene), engineered by Grammy Award-winner Jeremy Darby (David Bowie, Lou Reed, Alicia Keys, Van Morrison, Sara Bareilles), and features some of my favourite musicians, including:

  • Alan Zemaitis (keys)
  • Riley O'Connor and Derek Downham (drums)
  • Our dear friend, the late-great Guenther Kapelle (bass)
  • Juno and Maple Blues Award-winning keyboardist Jesse O'Brien (Colin James, Harrison Kennedy)
  • Two-time Grammy Award-winner Mike Mattison (Tedeschi-Trucks Band, Derek Trucks Band) - guest vocals on a tune.
  • Juno Award-nominee Alison Young and Juno Award-winner Richard Underhill co-arranging horns.
  • Other guest stars to be announced.
  • For those outside of Canada, a Juno Award is the Canadian equivalent of a Grammy award.

 

The New Songs

In 2018, my last album “Monarch” was nominated for Record of the Year at Canada’s Maple Blues Awards (and myself for Producer of the Year).  I am very grateful for this recognition as that record was a very personal work dealing with loss, divorce, forgiveness, and the art of letting go.

This new record chronicles my life as a single parent of two children, building an enriching home life for them, and strengthening the community around us.

When I began to write this record, I read something by Carl Jung, who said "in the second half of our lives, humans reconnect with the human race. They become part of the collective once again.” These words really resonated with me and became the starting point of this new record - songs of community, self-compassion, hope, and belonging.

While I started writing these songs prior to COVID, they have since taken on even more importance, especially now when we’re all so far apart from each other.

 

The themes on this record, include:

  • The power of community.  
  • The power of home - building a new home with my children in the aftermath of a divorce.
  • Seeking out positive role models for my children – striving to be a good example for them, but also lamenting the absence of strong role models amongst certain political leaders.
  • My sobriety - at the end of 2018, I gave up alcohol for good, after finally acknowledging it was a problem in my life. I’ve been sober now for over two years, and I’m very proud of this.

 

The Sound

Over the course of the last three albums, three Maple Blues award-nominations, international radio play, several international tours, and even playing on stage with Buddy Guy three times, I have been exploring various aspects of blues, roots and blues-rock traditions. 

Now I'm making a more modern, progressive blues-rock album with heightened mainstream potential, not beholden to the "rules" of blues, but respectful of tradition, weaving classic with contemporary - adventurous, but not polarizing; stretching every idea across the aural spectrum.

Of course, traditional blues lovers will dig the handful of traditional blues numbers; I know my roots and will never abandon them.

 

What We Need and What You Get

We're asking you to pre-purchase the record now because we want to make it in the best possible way (with the talent mentioned above ), and we want to do it right!!

Here's a breakdown of what we need.  

  • Remaining studio time - $3,000  
  • Guest Musicians - $2,000
  • Mixing - $3,000
  • Mastering - $1,000
  • Manufacturing - $3,000

 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks in the music business, especially when making independent records.  However, I have an excellent track record for managing and delivering projects of this magnitude, and I am well-prepared to deal with any hurdles as they arise.

Since 2010, I have successfully financed and produced three large-scale and critically acclaimed recordings (featuring Juno- and Grammy-award winning musicians).

The planning for this campaign alone has been months in the making. PLUS, I have a GREAT team working with me to make sure that everything runs smoothly.

The plan is to release the record in late 2021. However, we may hit some logistical roadblocks and delays due to COVID but we will get it to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please help by sharing on social media sites, tag friends in comments (that's huge!), e-mail to your pals, and anything you can to generate interest so that we hit this goal as soon as possible so we all get something out of it!

Now all we need is the support and love from the people, friends, family, and fans! Join us on this ride and be part of the team to get it out there! Thank you so much for your support!

Chris

http://www.chrisantonik.com

Campaign Video by 

CABruneau Productions Inc.

story:
Short Summary

Channeling the dance of the undead and playing songs distinguished by atmospheric synth melodies, lush guitars, and melodic vocals, Neon Coven is equal parts tragedy and beauty. Their anthems of love, loss, life, and death are delivered with the passion that only comes from someone that has lived it. From Los Angeles, CA, Neon Coven is releasing their debut full length album digitally on October 30th, 2020 and on vinyl and cassette the second week of November.

  • This campaign is the pre-order for the vinyl and cassette.  By pre-ordering you are helping us with manufacturing costs and promotion.  All orders will ship the second week of November.

story:
Help Me Release My Latest Project of Steely Dan Music! 

My name is Donovan Raitt, and I play acoustic fingerstyle guitar music. While working on my DMA degree at the USC Thornton school of music, I started working on a series of solo guitar arrangments of one of my favorite groups, the legendary Steely Dan! I started on this project in order to better understand their unique use of jazz-influenced harmony in the framework of pop music song structures, and it evolved into a set of arrangements of 11 of their best-known tracks, which I premiered live in a recital in the spring of 2020. 

My goal with this project is to create a combination of a CD release as well as a transcription set of each arrangement that will be made into a book, complete with a section containing historical background and performance notes for each arrangement. 

I would also like to professionally record videos of each song to go along with this book/cd set so anyone who wants to learn how to play these arrangments can watch the videos and see how they are performed from multiple angles and close-up shots of each hand.

Goals and Budget

The good news is that all of the arrangements are already recorded and the transcriptions are already complete! The reason that I am putting on this campaign is to help cover the remaining costs that are needed to fully fund this project. These include:

  1. Mixing/mastering the recording.
  2. CD and book printing and duplication
  3. Artwork and book layout.
  4. Professional video shoot and video editing. 
  5.  Licensing and song clearances.

The Impact

This project has been very challenging to complete, yet has been one of the most rewarding things I have ever done in my musical career. I am so proud of these arrangements and I want to share them with everyone! I know there are lots of fans of Steely Dan out there, and I think they will really enjoy hearing each part of their favorite tracks arranged for solo acoustic guitar. 

Long term, my goal with this project is to have it professionally published and distributed, and I hope with your help we can make that a reality!

Risks & Challenges

Since the recordings and transcription are already "in the can" so to speak, the major challenge here is purely a financial one. This project will be completed, I just need your help! 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to supporting this project financially, Spreading the word and telling your friends and family about it is so important in helping me reach this goal. I hope that you will consider supporting this project and sharing it on your social media platforms! 

Thank you all so much! 

-Donovan

story:
Hi, I`m Xi Fractal. I am a 12 year-old percussionist and I have drummed pretty much my whole life. 

The past few years, I have been invited to perform at many festivals. I have always felt very drawn to playing the Hangpan and anytime I get kindly lent one to perform with in my set, I get completely drawn-in to the sound and I just feel the rhythm pour out of me. 

I love that I open people`s hearts, raise the vibrations, and bring great joy and inspiration to many people.

Having my own Hangpan would mean so much to me, as I could practice everyday and develop so much more. I would also no longer need to be a nuisance and keep asking to borrow a Hangpan from supportive Hangpan players for my performances! 

I am wishing to get a smaller sized, Meridian Hangpan, because, out of all the different types I have played, this one felt the best and is a perfect size for me. 

I have an instagram account for my music- xi_fractal and I have just started a youtube channel- Zeozi Fractal. So you can receive my percussion-joy and see my development on these platforms, as well as hopefully seeing me perform live sometime.

The cost of the Hangpan is £1495. Protective case - £160. I have already gratefully received £100 in cash donations, from my audiences, so I am now requiring a further £1555. I am very grateful for any amount that you feel you would like to support me with.

By the way, we understand that children cannot set up crowd funders. My Mum has set this up in her name, and I have just written this to express my personal reasons for wanting my own Hangpan.

Thankyou for taking the time to read it and feel free to contact my Mum if you have any questions.
